Agnes is a baker. She is married and has given birth to one child who is three years old. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and the little child in a rented apartment in their community. She is fifty. 

Agnes is a hard-working woman. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers in her community. She has been in the baking business for twenty years and is well experienced. The working materials Agnes needs to keep her business booming are bags of flour, margarine, sugar and other ingredients. It is her dream to acquire a bigger oven to expand her business. She also aspires to own a house to accommodate her family. 

Agnes is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Da Dwene’ which literally means worry. There are six members of this group and they are mainly into trading. The group requests the loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up their businesses.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and other ingredients for baking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks, wine and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ELIZABETH VIVE EN ALQUILER CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS TRES HIJITOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ELLA NUNCA TRABAJO SOLO ESTABA DE AMA DE CASA Y CUANDO A SU ESPOSO LE DESPIDIERON NO SABIA DE DONDE SACAR EL DINERO Y TUBO QUE PASAR EPOCAS MUY DIFICILES, SU ESPOSO NO CONSEGUIA TRABAJO Y ELLA TAMPOCO, PERO NO FALTO UNA MUY BUENA AMIGA QUE LE DIJO QUE HAGA ALGO POR SUS HIJITOS YA QUE ELLOS ESTABAN SUFRIENDO SU AMIGA BERTHA LE AYUDO BASTANTE YA QUE LE ANIMO PARA VIAJAR Y TRAER EDREDONES  Y ES ASI COMO ELLA ACTUALMENTE TRABAJA ENTREGANDO LOS MISMOS A TIENDAS Y SEÑORAS AL CONTADO AL FIO AHORA ELLA ESTA FELIZ PORQUE TIENE INGRESOS Y YA NO TIENEN QUE ESTAR SUFRIENDO NI PREOCUPARSE DE LA COMIDA COMO MUCHAS MUJERES ELLA SALIO ADELANTE Y NO SE QUEDO ATRAS. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA POR MAYOR. LA SRA. ELIZABETH ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA YA QUE ELLOS LE TENDIERON UNA MANO EN LOS MOMENTOS DIFICILES PARA ELLA YA QUE GRACIAS AL CREDITO LOGRO SALIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
Elizabeth rents the place where she lives. She lives with her husband and their three school age children. She never worked. She was only a housewife. When they fired her husband, she did not know where to get money, and she went through some very difficult times. Her husband did not find work, and neither did she. But, she did have a very good friend who told her to do something because her children were suffering. Her friend, Bertha, helped her a lot. Bertha motivated her to travel and get comforters. That is the work she now does. She delivers the comforters to stores and women for cash or credit. She is happy now because she has income, and they do not have to suffer or worry about food like a lot of women. She got ahead, and she was not left behind. She will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. Elizabeth is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva. They gave her a hand in the moments that were difficult for her. Thanks to the loan she was able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy comforters and clothes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a trader. She sells groceries, drinks and food items to make life meaningful for her and her family in Lagos. She has been in the business for some years and she likes the business because it gives her the opportunity to interact with her customers. 

Florence's business plan is to buy her goods in a large quantities so that she can sell in wholesale and increase her profit. She hopes for loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, drinks and food to sell.

She is married and has 5 children: three males and 2 females. She is 44 years old and her husband is a civil servant. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, drinks and food to sell.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of three young children. She has been working as a private nurse for the past 10 years. Jeanette chose this occupation because it allows her to help the people around her. She has had one loan from Kiva and has repaid all the payments on time. 

Today, she is asking for a new loan of $1,500 to buy a new car to facilitate her transportation to the houses where she works so she can provide faster service to her clients.

loans.use: To buy a new car to travel to her clients' houses

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo tiene 45 años, está separado de su esposa, pero de aquel compromiso tienen una hija,  Fabiola de 12 años. En la actualidad vive en casa de su madre, Eluisa de 70 años, de quien cuida que no le falte nada, además es una persona que se dedica a las labores agrícolas. Desde  muy pequeño vio a su padre como un ejemplo, en donde la superación y perseverancia, son virtudes importantes para salir adelante, de esa manera la temporada de cosecha, sobre todo de tubérculos como la papa y el olluco, son trabajos rigurosos, que requieren de mucha dedicación, siendo la recompensa las ganancias que obtienen y que le ayudan a cubrir sus gastos y los de su madre. Paralelamente a la agricultura, se dedica a la ganadería, en donde la crianza de vacas,  le aporta otro ingreso adicional, ya que extrae diariamente leche para la fabricación de quesos, vendiéndolos luego en las tiendas de su localidad. Sin embargo, le es muy difícil desempeñarse sólo pues no cuenta con la ayuda de ningún familiar, por el contrario contrata operarios. Según refiere, en el futuro desea adquirir un mayor número de terrenos para cultivar y aumentar su producción y que sea de calidad, pues como motor de vida tiene a su hija, a quien le quiere brindar lo mejor que puede. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y se muestra con mucha disposición para mejorar, asimismo su grupo comunal es su segunda familia, con quienes le agrada trabajar, porque comparten sus mismos objetivos. Con los dos mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará dos sacos de abono y una bolsa de semilla de  arveja.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 45 years old and separated from his wife. They have a 12-year old daughter called Fabiola who lives with Adolfo's mother Eluisa aged 70. Adolfo makes sure she doesn't lack for anything. Adolfo is a farmer. Since he was a little boy, he has looked up to his father as an example of a person who overcomes difficulties and perseveres, virtues that are important if you want to get ahead. Harvest time, especially the harvest of potatoes and olluco (Peruvian tuber), is very hard work which requires a lot of effort. However, the reward is the money he earns which pays for his own expenses and those of his mother. As well as farming, Adolfo raises animals such as cows which bring in additional income. However, it is hard to manage by himself as he doesn't have any family members to help him. He has to contract out the work. In the future he would like to get more fields and increase both production and quality. His daughter is his motivation--he wants to provide her with the best he can. This is his fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP and he is clearly keen to improve his life. His community group is his second family and he enjoys working with them because they share the same goals. With the S/.2500 he plans to buy two bags of fertilizer and a sack of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy peas and fertilizer

loans.name: Kwapong Group

texts.en:
Francisca is forty years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to four children who are between the ages of two and eighteen years. She lives with her husband, who trades in clothes, and the children in a rented apartment in their community. 

Francisca is a hard-working woman. She trades in dried fish. She has been in business for sixteen years and has acquired a great deal of experience. Francisca buys the fish from nearby towns. She is hoping to be a wholesaler of dried fish in her community. She also aspires to give all her children a very good education as a legacy.

Francisca is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Kwapong’ (the name of the community where they reside). The group is made up of seven members and they are mainly traders. They are requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk for resale

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel tiene 37 años, es un hombre trabajador que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, es casado, de cuya esposa se llama Noemí, tiene 29 años y ambos tienen 3 hijos, menores de edad, y juntos viven en una hacienda antigua cuidando sus campos de cultivo. Le gusta mucho la actividad agrícola, es por eso que a diario, y con ayuda de su esposa, se dirigen a trabajar, desde las 6 de la mañana, llevando las herramientas necesarias para remover y cuidar sus cultivos, además para no tener que regresar al medio día a su casa, llevan consigo sus propios alimentos, de esa manera no descuidan su salud.  Es así que lleva 5 años en ésta práctica decisión, ya que le permite trabajar más tiempo hasta el anochecer, puesto que trabajan sobre terrenos arrendados. Como tiene confianza en su fuerza y en su trabajo para obtener mayores ingresos económicos, en sus días libres realiza la labor de operario, ganando 20 soles por día. Para él, lo más pesado de su actividad es tener que contratar toros para arar la tierra, es por ello que desea comprar dos cabezas de reses, para así no tener que gastar en el alquiler de estos animales. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y está dispuesto a seguir trabajando, a lado de su grupo  comunal, por todos muy unidos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una bolsa de arveja y tres sacos de fertilizantes, para asegurar una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Ángel, 37, is a hard-working man who struggles daily to help his family get ahead in life. He’s married to Noemí, 29, and they have three minor children. They live in an old farm caring for their farmlands. He enjoys farming very much. Every day at 6am, with help from his wife, he heads to the fields with the necessary tools to care for his crops. In addition, in order not to have to return home for lunch, they take food with them so as not to neglect their health. They have been following this practical plan for the past 5 years making it possible for him to work until nightfall because they till leased lands. Because he has faith in his own strength and ability to work to gain extra income, in his free time he works as a salaried laborer, earning 20 soles per day. For him, the hardest aspect of his work is having to lease oxen to till the land; for this reason, he’d like to purchase two heads of cattle in order to save on lease costs. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he’s willing to continue working alongside his communal group, which is quite united. He will use the requested funds to buy a sack of pea seed and three sacks of fertilizer to insure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sack of pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo de 65 años, es un hombre muy correcto, responsable y trabajador,  que está casado con Abelaida de 65 años también, ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero desde hace 7 años que viven solos en una casa alquilada. Hace 50 años que se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja, maíz, y habas sobre sus propios terrenos, pues estos productos naturales le resultan muy rentables al momento de comercializarlos, mientras que su esposa se dedica a cuidar del hogar y mantener bien atendido a su esposo, pero en temporada de cosecha, es ella que siempre lo ayuda en esa labor. Él asegura que su oficio, todo le parece fácil, ya que anteriormente se ha dedicado a la construcción civil, panadería y carpintería. Con el tiempo, espera construir su casa propia, debido a que las demás viviendas que construyó, las cedió a sus hijos, sin dejar claro la agricultura, que le brinda muchos beneficios. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que esta dispuesto a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, siendo la honradez y la puntualidad que lo caracterizan como persona. Asimismo asegura no defraudar a su grupo comunal. Los mil nuevos soles que solicita, le ayudará para comprar una bolsa de semilla de arveja, tres sacos de fertilizantes y tres botellas de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Cirilo, 65, is an upstanding, responsible, hard-working man. He’s married to Adelaida, 65, and they have 5 children. They have lived alone, however, for the past 7 years, in a rented house. He has been a potato, pea, corn and broad bean farmer for 50 years. He has his own farmlands and his crops are quite profitable. His wife is a housewife and tends to her husband but, during harvest season, she always helps him with this task. He assures us that he considers his work to be easy; he previously has worked as a construction worker, a baker and a carpenter. In time, he hopes to build his own house because he gave all the previous houses he built to his children, never neglecting farming, to be sure, which produces many benefits for him. This is his first loan with MFP and he is determined to repay in a timely fashion since honesty and punctuality are his personal traits: he also does not want to disappoint his fellow group members. He will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy a sack of pea seed, three sacks of fertilizer and three bottles of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more indomie noodle, eggs and tea to sell.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO D. EMPRENDIMIENTO ESMERALDA ESTA COMPUESTO POR LA SIGUIENTE MESA DIRECTIVA: 

LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO ES LA SEÑORA EMMA ES VIUDA, VIVE EN SU DOMICILIO PROPIO SU ESPOSO FALLECIO HACE POCO Y FUE UN GOLPE PARA ELLA Y PARA SU HIJA YA QUE LAS DEJO A LAS DOS SOLAS Y LES ESTA HACIENDO DEFICIL SALIR ADELANTE, ELLA VIVE EN COMPAÑIA D. SU HIJA MENOR EN LA CALLE CANCHA D. FUTBOL VINTO S/N, DICHA SEÑORA ES PORTERA D. UN COLEGIO CERCA A LA ZONA DOND. ELLA VIVE, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA SURTIR SU PUESTO D. VENTA COMO DULCE, PIPOCAS, GALLETAS,ETC.  Y D. ESTA MANERA INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO.

LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO ES LA SEÑORA SONIA VIVE EN LA ZONA D. SAN JORGE EN EL KM. 19 EN COMPAÑIA D. SU ESPOSO Y SUS 3 HIJOS, LA SEÑORA ES CONFECCIONISTA D. EDREDONES VEND. EN LA CANCHA EL MERCADO MAS GRAND. Y POPULOSO D. LA CIUDAD D. COCHABAMBA LOS DIAS D. FERIAS SABADOS Y MIERCOLES, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA TELA Y MATERIAL PARA REALIZAR LOS EDREDONES.  

LA SECRETARIA DEL GRUPO ES LA SEÑORA SONIA  QUE VIVE EN LA CALLE BARRIENTOS  A UNA CUADRA D. LA AVENIDA ALVINA PATIÑO VINTO EN COMPAÑIA D. SU ESPOSO Y SUS 3 HIJOS, DICHA SEÑORA TIENE SU LIBRERIA EN LA CALLE SIMON Y PATIÑO A UNA CUADRA D. LA ALVINA PATIÑO, TAMBIEN VEND. EN LA PLAZA D. PAPAS (QUILLACOLLO) LOS DIAS D. FERIA EN SU PUESTO PROPIO. ÉSTE GRUPO ES MUY UNIDO Y SOLIDARIO SE CARACTERIZA EN OTRAS INSTITUCIONES POR SU PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD; SE ENCUENTRAN MUY AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA  POR SU BAJO INTERES. NO ESTAN EN LA FOTO DOS D. LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO.
texts.en:
The Esmeralda Communal Bank is comprised of the following governing board members: Emma is the president of the group. She is a widow, and she lives in her own home. Her husband died a little while ago, and it was a blow for her and her daughter. He left the two of them alone, and it is difficult for them to get ahead. She lives with her minor daughter on the soccer field street in Vinto S/N. She is a janitor for a school close to the area where she lives. She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise to stock her stand where she sells things like sweets, popcorn, and cookies, etc. This way she will increase her working capital. Sonia is the treasurer of the group. She lives in the San Jorge region at kilometer 19. She lives with her husband and her three children. She makes comforters to sell at the Cancha market, which is the largest and most populous market in the city of Cochabamba. Saturday and Wednesday are the days of the fair. She is very hard-working and responsible. She will use the money from the loan to buy fabric and material to make the comforters. Sonia is the secretary of the group. She lives on Barrientos Street one block from Alvina Patiño Avenue in Vinto. She lives with her husband and their three children. She has a bookstore on Simon Y Patiño Street one block from Alvina Patiño. She also sells on fair days in her own stall at the Plaza D. Papas (in Quillacollo) . This group is very united and supportive. Other institutions characterize them as being punctual and responsible. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their low interest. Two of the group members do not appear in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops like passion fruit and also poultry to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more frozen food (chicken, turkey and ice fish) to sell.

loans.name: Napier Group

texts.en:
Secondhand clothes are in high favor with many people in Uganda. Not one to be left out of this lucrative opportunity which had presented itself in her home area of Napier in Jinja, an enterprising and lively 35-year-old woman going by the name of M. Rashida made a decision to try to cash in on this craze.

In 2000, Rashida laid the starting foundation stone for her business. With the money she had saved working in a local beauty salon, she bought her first consignment of garments. With these she took root and, though her business has had its fair share of ups and downs, she has emerged as a resilient woman who has refused to buckle under any sort of pressure.

With this kind of spirit in tow, Rashida has made enormous headway as is manifest in the 60,000 shillings she purportedly makes in a week. She is one lady who likes taking a long view and as such she has drawn up a blueprint to expand her business selling secondhand clothes into a wholesale franchise.

With this loan, Rashida is optimistic she will be empowered financially to see her dream come true.

loans.use: To buy bales of additional garments

loans.name: Pagando En Fe Y Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento PAGANDO EN FE Y AMOR se encuentra en su quinto ciclo son socias que se conocen muchas se dedican a la misma actividad que es la venta D. cosmeticos por catalogo.
 
La Sra. Ruth  tiene como actividad un agencia D. promotoras D. cosméticos D. diferentes lineas ella vive en plena avenida America D.  Villa Fatima es un lugar comercial y queda frente al mercado D. la misma zona  también hace el pintado y diseño D. uñas, es madre D. dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, con el dinero del credito comprara productos al por mayor ya que algunos D. estos productos se encuentran en promocion.

La señora Elvira es la secretaria D. Actas ella se dedica a vender cosméticos por catalogo D. tres lineas importantes,  quien estudia y a la ves cuida y atienD. las necesidades D. su hijo que es todavia pequeño con el dinero del credito comprara productos al por mayor ya que algunos D. estos productos se encuentran en promocion, uno D. sus deseos es terminar su carrera Universitaria y salir profesional para mejorar asi las condiciones D. vida D. ella y D. su hijito. .

La señora Rosa quien es la tesorera del banco D. emprendimiento ella se dedica a vender comida por las noches y por las tardes ofrece cosméticos por las mañanas se dedica a sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, es una persona trabajadora ella sola mantiene su hogar por eso se dedica a distintas actividades siempre buscando una actividad que le brinD. mejores ingresos, el destino del credito es para aumentar su capital.

El banco está conformado por  10 integrantes quienes se garantizan mutuamente ellas estan en su 5to ciclo y  quieren incrementar su capital D. trabajo, todas las socias estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Pagando en Fe y Amor (Paying with Faith and Love) Communal Bank is in the fifth cycle. The members know each other well. Many of them work in the same activity, selling cosmetics by catalog. Ruth has an agency of cosmetic promoters from different lines. She lives on the main street, America D. Villa Fatima. It is a commercial place, which is in front of the market in the same area. She also paints and designs fingernails. She has two school age children. She does have her husband’s support. She will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale products. Some of these products are on promotion. Elvira is the secretary. She sells three important cosmetic lines by catalog. She goes to school, and at the same time takes care of and sees to the needs of her small child. She will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale products. Some of these products are on promotion. One of her wishes is to finish her university career and become a professional. This is to improve living conditions for herself and her small child. Rosa is the treasurer of the communal bank. She sells food in the evenings. In the afternoons she sells cosmetics. In the morning she devotes herself to her school age children. She is a hard-working person who supports her household by herself. That is why she works different jobs always looking for an activity that will bring greater earnings. She will use the loan to increase her capital. The bank is comprised of ten members who mutually guarantee each other. They are in their fifth cycle, and they want to increase their working capital. All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El señor Justo vive en casa familiar con su esposa en la zona alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la reparación de motores de autos, electrodomésticos, etc. También tiene un taxi con el cual trabaja en transporte público.

El crédito que solicita es para conversión de gasolina a gas de su vehiculo, de esta manera conservar esta otra fuente de ingresos.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Kiva a través de Impro. El análisis socio-económico y el carácter social del crédito le permiten acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Justo lives in the family home with his wife in the Alto San Pedro neighborhood of La Paz. He repairs auto engines, home appliances, etc. He also has a taxi with which he provides public transportation services. He is asking for funds to convert his vehicle from gasoline to gas in order to keep this additional source of income. This is his first loan request from Kiva through Impro. The socio-economic analysis and social nature of the loan demonstrate his eligibility for it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For gasoline to gas conversion for his taxi.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Ana Luisa L. P., tiene 52 años de edad vive en el barrio de La ceiba, es casada y su esposo es agricultor, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, los cuales sobreviven de manera independiente, desde hace 9 años cultivan frutos, rubro que ha sido el sustento de alimenticio diario.

Dentro de las principales necesidades que tienen para sus  vidas, esta al reparación de la infraestructura de su hogar, para esto desean invertir en su negocio y de esta manera a futuro que su trabajo les provea bendiciones económico-sociales, que ayuden al porvenir de la familia, ellos solicitan de un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas en la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos para la diversificación de sus cultivos. Esta inversión atacara la afectación de plagas que tienen actualmente en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Ana Luisa L. P., 52, lives in the La Ceiba neighborhood; she’s married and her husband’s a farmer. They have three adult children who are now self-supporting. For the last 9 years they have farmed fruit, an activity that has provided them with daily nourishment. Among the main needs they have is improving the infrastructure of their home. To accomplish this, they need to invest in their business so that they will have future socio-economic benefits that will improve the family’s future. They are asking for funds to buy farming supplies, fertilizers and fungicides so that they can diversify their crops. This investment will attack the pest infestation that currently is affecting their farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, fungicide and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more juice and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foods to sell on a larger scale

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta V. had always dreamed of seeing her three children graduate with degrees. However, she and her husband, Salvador, did not have enough money to provide for their education so they have only reached elementary schooling. They have been unwaged until now because educational attainment is one of the major factors for gaining employment. Violeta thinks that, due to poverty, they have less opportunity than the wealthy. If she and her husband had at least had a small business, they may have had enough money and her dream for her children could have been achieved.

Regardless of what has happened, Violeta doesn’t like to remain unhappy. She wants to find a way to improve her family's quality of living. For this aspiration, she joined Kiva's partner, ASHI, and has been very happy to be given the chance of having working capital. The first few loans she received enabled her to operate a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) business. The profit from this business has been the main source of family income.

Now that she and her husband have secured access to capital, her proceeds are better than before. For that reason, she is now requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for a much bigger amount. Specifically, the loan funds will be used to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of her tricycle. This will enable her to grow their business further so that they have savings in the future. Her long-term dreams are to continue supporting her children and grandchildren as well as building a home strong enough to withstand the flooding which is common in her province. Also, she dreams of having an additional new tricycle to earn more income so that they can move further away from the cycle of poverty.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and pay for her tricycle's maintenance

loans.name: Luz Guillermina

texts.es:
Luz T. vive en el Sector la Playa en  la parroquia el Valle  a unos 45 minutos a las afueras  de la ciudad de Cuenca, su clima frío favorece para el cultivo de  las tierras principalmente  maíz, fréjol, papas, verduras y algunas frutas, ésta  labor realizan en su mayor parte la gente adulta mayor y las mujeres ya que el resto de la población se traslada a la ciudad de Cuenca donde realizan diferentes actividades económicas.

Luz  tiene 45 años vive en  unión libre con el padre de sus tres hijos de 20, 17, 7 años pero no les ayuda económicamente para nada en su hogar, por lo que sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la noche y trabajan en el día para cubrir sus propias necesidades,  mientras que ella cubre los gastos de educación de su hijo de 7 años, gracias a dios tienen casa propia aunque pequeña manifiesta. 

Luz cría y vende cuyes, pollos y también expende  leche desde las 8 a.m. hasta la 1 p.m. en su comunidad,  se encuentra hace cinco  años  trabajando con  los créditos de la fundación Espoir con éstos ha logrado un poco de estabilidad en su hogar, con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar crías de pollos, alimento y vitaminas.

Su sueño es que mejore el negocio ya que el fuerte verano les afectó en la alimentación de sus animales.
texts.en:
Luz T. lives in the beach sector of valley parish about 45 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. Its cold climate favors the cultivation of land, mainly corn, beans, potatoes, vegetables and some fruits. This work is mostly done by elderly people and women while the rest of the population commutes to the city of Cuenca for other job opportunities. Luz is 45 years old and lives in union with the father of her three children, ages 20, 17, and 7 years although he does not support them financially. The two oldest children study at night and work during the day to meet their own needs. Luz covers the cost of the youngest child's education and thank God she has her own home, although small. Luz raises and sells guinea pigs, chickens and milk dispensed from 8:00 am until 1:00 pm in her community. She has been working on loans through Espoir for five years. Through these loans she has been able to achieve a bit of stability for her home. With the new loan she has requested, she is going to buy baby chicks, feed and vitamins. Her dream is to improve the business as the strong summer affected them in the feeding their animals.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baby chicks, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Jonaly

texts.en:
Jonaly is 34 years old, married and lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband and two young children. To earn additional income for her family, Jonaly owns and operates a business selling rice in her neighborhood. She has been a busy entrepreneur for almost five years. Jonaly would like to take out a loan to purchase inventory of rice amounting to 20,000 PHP. She believes in offering sufficient inventory of rice in her house for customers seeking to make convenient purchases.

A good member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Jonaly is grateful for the secured access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams. Her long-term goals are to expand her retail business, fund her children's college education and support her family financially. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her entrepreneurial endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of rice

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 41 años, es un hombre luchador y entusiasta, su principal objetivo es salir adelante. Convive con Nancy de 37 años y ambos tienen 7 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 4 de ellos en su vivienda propia. Desde hace 16 años que se dedica a la siembra de Papa,  arveja y verduras, en terrenos arrendados. Con ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposa, caminan 3 kilómetros diariamente para cuidar sus cultivos, de esa manera aseguraría tener una mejor productividad. Las labores agrícolas para él son fáciles pues está acostumbrado a trabajos pesados, sin embargo le resulta complicado trasladar sus cosechas hacia los mercados de su ciudad, para comercializarlos a los mayoristas, quienes ya conocen la calidad de sus productos. Por el bienestar de su familia, espera comprar mas adelante sus propios terrenos para cultivo, además anhela construir otra vivienda más cerca de la ciudad e instalar un negocio de venta de verduras y tubérculos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, puesto que se siente comprometido con la labor que desempeñan sus compañeros. Con los dos mil soles que solicita, comprará dos bolsas de semillas de arveja y un saco de fertilizante.
texts.en:
Félix, 41, is an enthusiastic, hard-working man; his main goal is to succeed in life. He lives with Nancy, 37. They have 7 children but only four still live at home with them. For the last 16 years he has farmed potato, pea and vegetables on leased farmlands. With his wife and children’s help, they walk 3 kilometers daily to tend to their crops assuring a better harvest. Farm work is easy for him because he is accustomed to hard, physical labor. However, it is complicated to transport his crops to market in the city for sale to wholesalers who know the good quality of his products. For the good of his family, he hopes eventually to purchase his own farmlands; he also hopes to build a home closer to the city and set up his own vegetable and tuber sales business. This is his 5th loan with MFP. He enjoys working with his communal group because he feels committed to the work his fellow group members do. He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy two sacks of pea seed and one sack of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Guadalupe María

texts.es: La Sra. Guadalupe María Moron R. de  40 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos. Cuenta con  casa propia de material noble ubicada en sector Cantoral de Santiago. Trabaja como operaria de producción desde hace 3 años en una empresa agroindustrial. Su conyuge percibe otros ingresos como obrero. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Guadalupe María, who is 40 years old, has 2 children and her own house made of durable material, located in the Cantoral sector of Santiago. She has worked for 3 years as a production operator in an agro-industrial enterprise. Her spouse receives additional income as a worker. Guadalupe is an enterprising person, who thanks to her effort, came to acquire her goods. She needs the loan to finish constructing her home, which was affected by the earthquake of 2007. Her dream is to actually finish building her home, with the goal of achieving a better quality of life. Guadalupe is very grateful for the help she has received by means of this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FINISHING RECONSTRUCTION OF HER EARTHQUAKE-DAMAGED HOME

loans.name: Gerardo Manuel

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su familia en el sector Urrunaga del distrito de  José Leonardo Ortiz, zona bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial y de transporte, se encuentra ubicada a cinco minutos del centro de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi, actualmente cuenta con mas de cuatro años de experiencia en el negocio. Empezó alquilando vehículos y con lo que ganaba ahorró el dinero suficiente para adquirir su propia herramienta de trabajo. Actualmente cubre rutas dentro de la misma ciudad, los ingresos que percibe le sirven para solventar sus gastos personales y para ayudar al sostenimiento de su familia.

Gerardo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la reparación y mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular, ya que el contínuo uso otorgado a su vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas. Asi mismo una parte del dinero se utilizará en la renovación de su  vigencia de operatividad, lo cual le permitira trabajando de manera formal, sin temor a los operativos de control y con la seguridad que necesita para realizar su trabajo de modo adecuado.

Gerardo es un joven trabajador y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y poder contar con mas unidades. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 20, is single and lives with his family in Urrunaga sector, José Leonardo Ortiz district, an area that is well-known as a commercial and transportation hub; it is five minutes from downtown Chiclayo. He provides public passenger and cargo transportation services in a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo); he has been in this line of work for over 4 years now. He started out with leased vehicles but gradually saved up enough to buy his own work unit. He currently covers urban routes within the city. His earnings help him meet personal expenses and he is able to contribute to his family’s support. Gerardo is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan that he’ll use for vehicle maintenance and repair. The continuous use of the vehicle has caused it to begin to require repairs. Part of the funds will be used to renew his license to operate which will make it possible for him to work legally, without fear of control operatives, and with the security he needs to do his work properly. Gerardo is a young, responsible worker; his greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman and to have additional vehicles. He has collaborated with our institution in the past and has been punctual and responsible with his loan installment payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair and to pay for license renewal.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios owns and operates a business buying and selling chickens in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a week. In 2007, she joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in entrepreneurial business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI.

Remedios is requesting a new loan of 19,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. Having this loan will provide a chance to reach her dreams in life: to have a growing business, a good life and the financial means to support her family and fund her grandchildren's college education.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.en:
Aïssatou S. is 33 years old, divorced and the mother of three children. She lives in the village of Nianing, Senegal, and has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE for two years. She has paid back her previous loans on time. 

Madame S.'s main activity consists of running a small restaurant. With this loan, she wants to further equip her restaurant. The revenue from this business allows her to cover her children's school expenses.

loans.use: To further equip her restaurant

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
el sr. Luis Antonio Garcia tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Geronimo, Namasigue departamento de Choluteca. Luis se dedica al comercio tiene un negocio de ventas varias como ser relojes de mano y de pared, calculadoras, pastas dentales, cepillos, focos de mano, baterias, termos, llaveros, peliculas en dvd, fajas, naipes, corta uñas, billeteras y otras cosas mas. todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para arreglar todos sus productos y salir a venderlos, su negocio esta ubicado en una calle muy transitada y esto hace que las ventas sean buenas.
Luis utilizara el credito para comprar mas mercaderia, las ganancias que obtenga de las ventas son para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio is 41 years old and lives in the village of San Gerónimo Namisigue, in the department of Choluteca. Luis is a merchant who sells various items, including wrist watches, wall clocks, calculators, tooth paste, tooth brushes, flashlights, batteries, thermoses, locks, DVD film, band aids, playing cards, nail cutters, wallets, and other things. Every day, he rises very early to arrange all his products and venture out to sell them. His business is located on a heavily traveled street and this helps to give him good sales. Luis will use the loan to buy more merchandise. The earnings he obtains from his sales are used to cover household costs.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING WATCHES, FILM, ADORNMENTS, CALCULATORS, NAIL CUTTERS, CARDS, FLASHLIGHTS, TOOTH PASTE & BRUSHES TO SELL

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.en:
Marie Claire S. is a 47-year-old woman from the village of Nianing, Senegal. She is married and the mother of 10 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE for two years and has paid back her previous loans on time.

Madame S. raises chickens and gains a supplementary income by selling food. With this loan, she will purchase chicks which she will raise.

loans.use: To buy chicks to raise

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
María Jesús tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el sector Quemazón, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 12 años a la comercialización de animales: ella compra, cría y vende todo tipo de animales, aunque prefiere las aves de corral y carneros, los animales los comercializa con los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Este negocio es una fuente de importante ingreso económico para su familia ya que su esposo trabaja como agricultor y esta actividad no le brinda los recursos suficientes para el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de aves de corral y carneros para comercializarlos, así como en su respectivo alimento balanceado, ya que ella desea ampliar su negocio debido a la gran demanda que se ha presentado en la zona donde vive.

Ella es una mujer entregada a su familia y que siempre vela por el progreso y bienestar de los suyos, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos la oprtunidad de estudiar alguna carrera técnica que les garantice un futuro prometedor. María Jesus ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución Anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Jesús, 37, is married and has two children; she lives with her family in Quemazón, a rural district of Mórrope, Lambayeque province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For over 12 years she has been a small farm animal merchant. She buys raises and then resells all kinds of animals, although she prefers barnyard fowl and sheep; she sells to merchants that visit her area on a regular basis. This business is an important source of family income because her husband’s income from farming is insufficient to support the family. María is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy barnyard fowl and sheep to sell as well as nutritionally balanced animal feed because she aims to expand her business because demand is high where she lives. She is a woman who is totally dedicated to her family’s wellbeing; her greatest wish is to provide her children with the opportunity to study a technical career that will guarantee them a promising future. María Jesus has collaborated with our institution previously and has always been punctual and responsible with her installment payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: G.s. Quinta Rosa Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Quinta Rosa está conformado por Elizabeth Del Carmen y Maria De Los Ángeles ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. En el caso de Elizabeth ella se dedica a una pulpería, hace mas de 3 años, por lo que anteriormente no tenía un medio de ingreso para mantener a sus 2 hijos, fue por la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos alimentación, vestimenta y estudios. Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de comida hace mas de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella inicio por su abuela quien le asigno este negocio. es por eso que deciden unirse para solicitar este financiamiento para realizar las compras de sus productos que cada uno de sus negocios necesitan.
texts.en:
The Quinta Rosa communal bank is composed of Elizabeth Del Carmen and Maria De Los Ángeles; each is involved in a different commercial activity. Elizabeth has had a grocery store for the last 3 years; prior to this she did not have a reliable source of income to support her children and she needed to feed, clothe and educate them. Maria De Los Ángeles has sold prepared meals for over 2 years; she’s in this business because her grandmother started her out in it. They decided to join together to seek funding to buy the merchandise each needs for her respective business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Juan Martín

texts.es:
El señor Juan Martín P. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo mejorar su vivienda.
Nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo para reparar la losa por la porte exterior, que esta haciendo falta, para tener en buenas condiciones su vivienda y así su familia este mucho mejor en la casa.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la reparación y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos de chofer de camión de carga.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Eva Griselda esposa del señor Juan Martín P. ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Juan Martín P. is very grateful for the previous loan that made it possible for him to improve his dwelling. He is asking for funds again to repair the stonework on the exterior façade because he needs this in order to have his home in good condition thereby providing his family with improved shelter in their home. He will use the funds to make these repairs and he plans to repay with income earned as a truck driver. The person in the photo is Eva Griselda, Juan Martín P.’s wife; he was at work the day the home visit took place.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair stonework.

loans.name: Onyame Nnye Mmfosuo Group

texts.en:
Hanna is forty-four years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to six children who are between the ages of two and fifteen years. Hanna lives with her children and husband, a trader, in a rented apartment in their community. She is a hard-working and a trustworthy woman. 

Hanna trades in socks. She has been trading for seventeen years and has acquired rich experience in business. Hanna buys the goods from nearby towns. Hanna aspires to give all her children a very good education. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Onyame Nnye Mmfosuo’, which literally means 'God makes no mistakes'. The group is made up of six members and the majority are traders while a few are in the service industry. They are mostly requesting the loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up their businesses.

loans.use: to buy socks in bulk for resale

loans.name: Aïda

texts.en: Aïda N. is 47 years old, married and the mother of two. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE for two years and has always paid back her loans. She runs a tailor shop and wants to use this loan to buy new fabrics. The revenue from her business allows her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Cony Maria

texts.es:
La señora Cony Maria A. S., tiene 34 años de edad es casado y su marido se dedica a la agricultura, brindando un apoyo a al economía del hogar, ellos son una familia de 3 hijos de los cuales dependen económicamente de ellos, la Familia habita en el populosos Barrio 31 de Diciembre, conocido por la falta de necesidades básicas que agobian a los que ahí habitan.

Ella se dedica a la venta de leña, tortillas y tiene una pequeña venta de abarrotes y productos para el hogar, dentro de las necesidades, que mas la agobian, es el reemplazo inmediato del techo de zinc, que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, es por esta razon que ella solicita del prestamo para comprar los materiales de construcción para la nstalación del techo de concreto, asi les brinde mayor seguridad y la tranquilidad de realizar reparaciones que szean optimas a la infraestructura del hogar. En los últimos meses ha observado una baja en los ingresos de las ventas, es por esta razón que ella solicita del credito por que no tiene los recursos necesarios para invertir en este proyecto ha futuro solicitara de otros credito para reinvertir en su negocio en la compra de un mayor inventario, que le surta su pulpería y con esto mejore las condiciones de vida de la familia.
Ellos son una familia muy responsable y unida que gozan por el respeto y cariño de su comunidad pro el ejemplo de vida que han brindado a los demas.
texts.en:
Cony Maria A. S., 34, is married; her husband is a farmer and contributes to family support. They have three dependent children. The family lives in the crowded 31 de Diciembre neighborhood the residents of which are notorious for living there without their basic needs met. She sells firewood and tortillas and has a small grocery store where she stocks basic needs items. Among her reasons for distress is the need to immediately replace the zinc metal roof which is in very poor condition. She is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies to install a concrete roof that will provide better security and tranquility because it would mean optimal home infrastructure. Income from sales has decreased the last few months so she is asking for a loan because she lacks the necessary funds to invest in this project. She plans to ask for future loans to invest in her business, buying more inventory to stock her store thereby improving her family’s living conditions. They are a responsible and close-knit family that is respected and well-liked by their community because of the good living example they set.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes M. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a que su negocio tuviera más variedad de mercancía para vender.
Doña Mercedes está solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que el actual esta en muy malas condiciones y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder mejor su casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio de venta de ropa. Ya que sus hijos le ayudan con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Mercedes M. is very grateful for the previous loan that made it possible for her to have more varied stock merchandise to sell. Mercedes is asking for a new loan to repair the roof on her house because it is in very poor condition and she does not have funds at present to make these needed home repairs. She plans to repay the loan with profits from her clothing sales since her children help her out with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For roof repair.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga V. G. is a 30-year-old mother who lives with her family in Tierra Blanca, Costa Rica. She is currently seven months pregnant with her second child.

Olga is an experienced client: this will be her 4th loan with Fundación Mujer. The loan consultant that has been working with her over the years describes her as a professional, goal oriented, hardworking woman who has displayed exemplary client behavior regarding punctual repayments in the past.

Olga has a nurse’s license and a master’s degree. Years ago, she decided to put her nursing career on hold and opened a store in order to have more time to spend with her daughter. Olga’s business is based in Tierra Blanca where she sells women’s undergarments, cosmetics and jewelry. Olga works in the afternoons and has the mornings to attend to her other responsibilities.

In the past, Olga has used her loans to invest in her business, to purchase clothing, and to improve her services to her clients. However, the current loan will be used to pay her debt to the Professional Nurses Association so that she can retain the right to work as a nurse in Costa Rica.

Olga’s goals are to increase her client base, make more sales, and expand her business. She is dedicated to working hard, whether as a nurse or at her business, in order to ensure a quality standard of living for her children. An obstacle Olga faces is a recent decrease in sales levels. She says she needs to seek out new clients. Also, with the baby coming, life is sure to become a lot more exciting and challenging.

loans.use: To pay membership fees of the Professional Nurses Association

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es: Maria Haydee tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que 4 hijos a su cargo esto es lo que la impulsa a trabajar cada día más duro. ella inicio este negocio por esfuerzo propio no fue muy fácil, ya que tenía muchos obstáculos como fue el poco tiempo que le dedicaba a su familia, pero con el paso del tiempo fue mejorando, pues la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Haydee, 33, has had a grocery store for over 11 years. She has four children under her care and they are the moving force behind her need to work every day. She initiated her business on her own and it was not at all easy to do so because she faced many obstacles, like having little time to care for her family. Gradually, however, things began to improve because the store is located in her home. She is asking for funds to buy stock merchandise; her dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.en:
Diénaba S. is a 33-year-old woman from the village of Nianing on Senegal's Atlantic coast. She is married and the mother of five children. In the two years that she has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE she has never had any problems in paying back her loans.

Diénaba S. runs a small restaurant and, as a second occupation, raises chickens. She plans to use this loan in equal parts to buy chicks and to purchase products for her restaurant. The earnings from these activities help her to cover her family's living costs.

loans.use: To purchase chicks and buy products for her restaurant

loans.name: James Group

texts.en:
Comfort is thirty-three years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are between the ages of one and seventeen years. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband is a security man.

Comfort is a hard-working woman. She is into the palm oil production business. She has been producing palm oil for the past twelve years and has acquired rich experience in her business. Comfort buys her raw materials (palm nuts) from nearby communities. It is her desire to give all her children a good education.

Comfort is the leader of a six-member trust bank group called ‘James’. The group is made up mainly of traders. They are requesting the loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy palm nut fruits to make palm oil

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Maria De Los Ángeles tiene una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Desde hace tres años, la señora recibe ayuda de su esposo, por lo que juntos buscan la manera de salir adelante. Realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas son al crédito y de contado, las compras las efectúa en el mercado y a camiones repartidores. Por lo que la señora Maria está solicitando un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio ya que se aproxima la temporada en donde vende bastante. Por lo que tiene que mantener a su hijo que todavía depende de ella. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejorar a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles has had a grocery store in her home for the past 3 years; her husband helps her out and together they seek ways to succeed. She pays cash for her stock merchandise but sells for cash and on credit; she buys both at the market and from distribution trucks. Maria needs funds to invest in stock items because a high-sales season is approaching. She has a son who still depends on her and she wants to provide an improved dwelling for him.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Julio Francisco

texts.es: Julio Francisco tiene 37 años,  anteriormente él había tenido la experiencia de obtener financiamiento por lo que ha sido de gran ayuda. La actividad económica es venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que comenzó con la ayuda de su Mama. Por lo que tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y busca la forma de hacerse cargo de su negocio. El solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio. Su deseo es seguir trabajando mientras tenga vida.
texts.en:
Julio Francisco, 37, has had previous loans that have been of great use to him. He has sold general merchandise for over 16 years; he started out with help from his mother. Now, he has two children under his care and he seeks ways to tend to his business He is asking for funds to buy stock merchandise; his wish is to continue working for as long as he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Awa

texts.en:
Awa G. is 53 years old and lives in Nianing, Senegal. She is married and the mother of six children. Madame G. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE for two years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Her main activity consists of running a restaurant and selling food in a small grocery store. She wants to use this loan to improve her restaurant as well as to buy products for her grocery store: peanut butter, millet and flour.

loans.use: To improve her restaurant and buy food products for her grocery store

loans.name: Rosa Jakeline

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 19 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de año y medio de edad, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la ciudad de Chepén, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, perteneciente a la región La Libertad, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia hizo que iniciara un negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes instalado en su vivienda, ella trata de ofrecer a sus clientes productos de calidad y un buen trato, en el tiempo que lleva trabajando el negocio ha crecido y goza de buena acogida en el sector donde vive, sobretodo porque pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes productos de consumo diario por los cuales tendrían que movilizarse hasta el mercado de la ciudad para adquirirlos.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por eso se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes.

Rosa es una mujer bastante conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer responsable y entregada a su familia; su mayor anhelo es entregarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen aparece junto a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 19, is a single mother; she has an 18-month-old son. She lives with her parents in the city of Chepén, capital of Chepén province, La Libertad region, located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region capital. In order to support her family, she opened a general store in her dwelling; she tries to offer quality items and kind customer service. During the time she’s been in business, business has grown and she is well-received in her neighborhood, above all because she makes accessible to her customers everything they need on a daily basis thereby ridding them of the need to travel to the city to market. She wants to expand her business to better meet customer demand so she is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for funding. She is asking for 1000 new soles to buy stock merchandise for her store. Rosa is quite well-known and well-liked where she lives; her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be responsible and dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to provide her son with a better quality of life. She appears in the photo with her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Doña Adela de edad de 34 años, madre de familia de cinco hijos, desde hace varios años, logro poner su negocio, una tienda de abarrote en donde vende una variedad de productos como: granos básicos, frutas, verduras, golosinas, gaseosas y cosmético. Producto de sus ahorros que logro con venta de fritanga y apoyo económico de su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de cd de música y películas. Este negocio lo tiene en un mercado en donde hizo un pequeño local y se paga a la alcaldía diario una cantidad de dinero. Pero lo que mas desea es poder trasladar su venta a su casa y ahorrar más y con la finalidad de hacerlo mas grande. Con este préstamo lograra la inversión de comprar: arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite, frutas, verduras, golosinas, gaseosa para reforzar sus venta ya que la demanda es mucha contra los otros comerciante.
texts.en:
Adela is 34 years old. She is the mother of five children. Several years ago, Adela started her own business, a grocery shop where she sells a variety of products such as staple grains, fruit, vegetables, sweets, soft drinks, and cosmetics. She was able to start this business with the money she had saved from the sale of fritanga (fried snacks) as well as thanks to the economic support from her husband, who sells music and video cds. Adela has a small vending post in a market, an arrangement that requires her to pay a daily municipal fee. She would really like to move her vending location to her home so that she could save more, with the goal of further growing her business. This loan would allow her to invest in the purchase of the following items: rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, fruit, vegetables, sweets, and soft drinks. This will allow her to increase her sales and meet the increased demand from other merchants.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery store supplies such as staple grains, fruit, vegetables, sweets, soft drinks, and cosmetics

loans.name: Yamina De La Nube

texts.es:
Yamina P. es socia del banco Comunal Ensueños  ubicado  en la comunidad de la Policía en la ciudad de Azogues,  tiene clima frío y  se caracteriza por sus iglesias y por la belleza que esta ciudad encierra, su centro histórico se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es muy amable y luchadora, como nuestra socias quienes luchan cada día para mejorar sus situaciones familiares.

Yamina  tiene 43 años, se encuentra divorciada hace 13 para ayudar su esposo que obtenga los documentos legales en otro país, con él concibió  una hija que ya tiene  25 años y es abogada  de profesión, ella junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos viven casa de su madre con quien comparten no sólo el techo sino también los gastos del hogar.

Nuestra socia vende ropa y cosméticos por catálogo desde hace tres años y también se da tiempo para cuidar de sus dos nietos y dedicarse a los quehaceres del hogar, nos comenta que cuenta con su clientes fijos y que se inició en ésta actividad gracias a los créditos obtenidos hace tres ciclos en la fundación Espoir por motivación de sus amigas socias del banco comunal, con su nuevo préstamo va adquirir pantalones, camisas, blusas, sacos, interiores,  perfumes, cremas, sombras, rímel y más productos Yanbal para ofrecer  a sus clientes un surtido stock de ropa y cosméticos. 

Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y adquirir nuevas líneas de productos.
texts.en:
Yamina P. is a member of the village bank Comunal Esueños ("Shared Dreams") located in the community of Policía in the city of Azogues, which has a cold climate and is known for its churches and the beauty the city holds. Its historical center is a mix of colonial and modern, its people are both agreeable yet fighters, such as our members who fight every day to better the lives of their families.

Yamina is 43 years old and has been divorced for 13 years to help her husband obtain legal documents in another country. With him she has a daughter who is 25 years old, a lawyer, and who with her husband and two children lives in her mothers house, sharing not only the roof but the household expenses.

Yamina has been selling clothes and makeup by catalog for the past three years and also spends time taking care of her two grandchildren and doing housework. She told us that she has her regular customers and she was able to start this job thanks to loans obtained in three cycles with Espoir foundation with the encouragement of her friends within the village bank. With this new loan she would like to buy pants, shirts, blouses, bags, underwear, perfume, lotions, shades, mascara, and other products to offer her clients a better range of clothes and makeup.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying clothing and makeup for her business

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy S. is a 51-year-old woman from the village of Nianing, Senegal. She is married and the mother of six children. In the two years that she has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE she has always paid back her loans on time. Madame S. sells fish and palm oil. She wants to use her loan to buy more of these two products. The revenues from reselling them allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fish and palm oil

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel C. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le fue muy necesario porque pudo comprar los cosas que necesitaban sus hijos para la escuela. 
 Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar la colegiatura de la preparatoria de su hijo que pronto terminará y empezara su carrera profesional.
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que percibe como empleado de una agencia aduanal.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Manueal C. is very thankful for his participation in a previous loan program, the money from which enabled him to pay for the supplies his children needed for school. Currently Sr. C. is requesting a new loan to enable him to pay school tuition for his son, who will soon finish with school and begin his professional career. Sr. C. plans to repay the loan with the salary he earns as an employee of a customs agency.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos escolares

loans.name: Myriam Esnith

texts.es: Myriam Esnith R. V. tiene 43 años,  vive en Bosa-Brasil, un barrio de la capital de Colombia justamente al sur de la misma. Myriam expresa que su comunidad es unida, colaboradora y con gran sentido de pertenencia, y que es allí donde ella ha logrado generar ingresos dedicándose a trabajar en su propio negocio: “la fabricación  de rodillos de diferentes tamaños en felpa y espuma”. Su familia la conforman  sus 3 hijos en edades de 24, 12 y 6 años y su cónyuge, quien también trabaja en esta actividad, y es que el emprender este negocio, se lo debe Myriam a la experiencia que adquirió su esposo cuando se retiró de una empresa, donde aprendió a elaborar los rodillos que hoy venden; fue así como ellos decidieron vivir rodeados de cabos,  tapas, tornillos  felpas y espuma. Con su primer crédito en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo obtuvo mayores oportunidades para trabajar, ya que fue capaz de agregar más productos o elementos a su negocio; ahora con sus segundo crédito, por valor de $1.000.000, realizará arreglos de una máquina inyectora de plástico que se les dañó, y en consecuencia su producción se ha visto afectada; con este dinero también comprará materiales, como  cabos,  tapas, tornillos  felpas y espuma, así continuará  trabajando en su propia casa junto con su esposo. Su máximo desafío es convertirse en una empresa consolidada a nivel comercial y laboral en el mercado y agregar otras maquinarias modernas que mejoren su desempeño  productivo.
texts.en:
Myriam Esnith R. V., age 43, lives in Bosa-Brasil. This neighborhood is just to the south of the capital of Colombia. Myriam says that her community is united, and the people work together. There is a great sense of belonging in her community. That is where she has been able to generate income by working in her own business of making different sizes of felt and foam rollers. Her family consists of her three children; ages 24, 12, and 6; and her life partner. He also works in this activity; he started the business. Myriam owes it to the experience her husband got when he retired from a company where he learned to make the rollers they now sell. That is how they decided to live surrounded by handles, covers, screws, felt, and foam. With her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo she got greater work opportunities. She was able to add more products or elements to her business. Now, with this second loan for 1,000,000 COP, she will make repairs to a damaged machine that injects plastic. Because the machine is damaged their production has been affected. With this money she will also buy materials like handles, covers, screws, felt, and foam. That way she will continue working in her own house with her husband. Her biggest challenge is to become a consolidated business at a commercial and labor level in the market. Part of this challenge is to add other modern machines to improve her work effort.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like handles, covers, screws, felt, and foam, and fix the machine that injects plastic

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca, 43 years old and a mother of four, has been operating a retail shop and a boutique for the past five years to earn a living.  She also runs a butchery to earn extra income.  Previously employed before she went into business, Francisca hopes to grow her enterprise and improve her living standards in the future.  She is now requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stocks of sugar, wheat flour and clothes to sell in her boutique.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour and clothes for sale in her boutique

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Melania  es una mujer trabajadora, de edad de 43 años. Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos, el cual comenzó con ahorro de su hechuras de costuras, pues se dedicaba a la costura, con ayuda de su esposo económica logra invertir en cosmético con poca cantidad. Su esposo es albañil y se beneficia con las mejoras de su casa ya que no paga mano de obra. Ella trabaja con catálogos con los cosméticos de la Avon, las ventas están bajas, y desea invertir más para lograr mejores ventas. Lo que quiere mejorar en su casa es el piso que esta ya en mal estado el cual cambiara con cerámica que comprara a si como lo que necesite en material para comenzar la obra. Contenta por los beneficios alcanzados con las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Melania is 43 years old. She is a hard-working woman, and for several years she has been selling cosmetics and clothing. Melania started this business with the savings from her previous work as a seamstress. Combining these funds with some help from her husband, she managed to invest into a small amount of cosmetics inventory. She sells cosmetics from Avon catalogs, but her sales volume is low, so she wants to invest more in order to increase her sales. Melania would like to improve the flooring in her house because it is in poor condition. She wants to install a ceramic floor and thus she needs to purchase the necessary materials in order to start the work. Her husband is a bricklayer, which is a advantage, since they don't have to pay the labor costs. Melania is happy about the improvements she has been making to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ceramics and other materials for improving the floor which is in poor condition

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel, married and living with his wife and three children, runs a cereals shop with one employee in his hometown to earn a living. In this business for two years, Daniel was previously employed before he ventured into his enterprise.  His wife is a business lady and together they are able to provide for their family and pay school fees for their children.  

Daniel, who hopes to grow his business into a wholesale operation and improve their living standards in the future, has requested a loan of Kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of cereals.  He describes himself as hardworking and ambitious. 

(photo has been taken away from the business)

loans.use: To add stock of  cereals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leoncida

texts.es: Leoncida tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la venta de pastes de baño y mercadería en general. Por lo que tiene mucho de estar en este negocio. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que siempre le ha gustado obtener una fuente de ingreso ya que desde muy joven se ha preocupado por mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio. Su deseo ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonicida is 53 years old. She makes her living selling bath scrubbers and other general merchandise. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years. Having a source of income has always been important to Leonicida; ever since she was very young, she devoted herself to improving the living conditions of her family. Leonicida wishes to further expand her business; she is asking for a loan in order to purchase the necessary raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es: Juana Rosa tiene 33 años, por lo que siempre le ha gustado su actividad. Ella se dedica a una pulpería  por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora que disfruta de su trabajo, y que además está luchando por llevar los ingresos necesarios a su hogar ya que tiene 3 hijos menores a su cargo. Ella actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, lácteos, carnes, golosinas y detergente. Ella sueña con tener una casa con muchas comodidades y tener un negocio muy productivo, si es posible establecerlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Juana Rosa is 33 years old. She is a very industrious woman who enjoys working in a local grocery shop and has always liked her work. She has three dependent children and strives to provide the income necessary for her family. Currently, Juana Rosa is requesting a loan for the purchase of staple grains, dairy products, meat, sweets, and detergent. Her dream is to have a house with amenities as well as to have a very profitable business established in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana Fidelia

texts.es: La señora Juana F. tiene 54 años de edad, posee 2 hijos a su cargo. Ella tiene aproximadamente 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería en general. Sus ventas generalmente las realiza de manera ambulante, sin embargo en su casa oferta también sus productos. Ella empezó con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, después fue agrandando el negocio con inversión y con los préstamos otorgados por la fundación, hasta que ahora tiene un negocio establecido con una clientela que la reconocen. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de mercancías. Por lo sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana F. is 54 years old, and she has two children under her care. She has been selling general merchandise for approximately five years. She generally sells as a street vendor. However, she also sells products in her house. She started with a small business of selling used clothes. Later she was expanding her business with investment from the loans from the Fundación. Now she has an established business with customers who know her. The loan she has requested is to buy merchandise. She dreams of improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación tiene 36 años. Doña Ana tiene 2 hijos y ella se encarga de proporcionarles lo necesario. La actividad económica de Ana es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio vendiendo pocos productos y con los financiamientos fue mejorando su inventario para ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos solicitaban. Es por eso que solicita un financiamiento con el motivo de mejorar su inventario y comprar productos como granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, refrescos naturales  y otros. Siempre desea poder proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana Maria has been working with Fundación for a long time. She is 36, has 2 children and she is the one who supplies what they need. Ana’s business is a general store and she has worked in it for more than 8 years. She began selling few products, and with loans she was able to widen her inventory to have the things that her customers requested. That is why she is asking for a loan-to expand her inventory and to buy more items such as: basic grains, soft drinks, juices natural drink, etc. She always wants to be able to arrange for improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Leonza Marina

texts.es: Leonza Marina tiene muchas experiencias con financiamientos por lo que ha sido lo más satisfactorio para ella.  La actividad económica de Doña Leonza es venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que inicio este negocio, la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar de la forma más humilde pero con muchos sacrificios ha obtenido lo necesario. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así aplicar la inversión en pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, bolsas plásticas y calzado. El sueño de ella es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonza Marina has a lot of experience with loans. They have been most satisfactory for her. Leonza sells general merchandise. She started the business over six years ago. She is a street vendor. She has always liked working in this most humble way. With a lot of sacrifices she has gotten what she needed. She is asking for this loan for working capital. She will invest in pants, shirts, underwear, plastic bags, and footwear. Her dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Veronica
