texts.es: Verónica tiene 31 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, entre lo que sobresale la venta de pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. La señora ya tiene 4 años de haber empezado con su negocio, ella inicio con una prima, la cual en ese tiempo se dedicaba a la venta de ropa usada y poco a poco fue haciéndose de inventario hasta llegar a tener el negocio que hoy en día posee. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercancías, ya que si compra en este momento tendrá buenas ventas en sema santa. El sueño siempre ha sido realizar mejoras a su casa, con ello pretende invertirle más a su negocio para que sea más rentable y de allí obtener los recursos para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Verónica is 31 years old, and she has a three year old son. She sells clothes. Pants, shirts, skirts, and suits sell the most. She started her business four years ago. She started it with a cousin, who was selling used clothes at the time. Little by little she increased her inventory until she came to have the business she now has. The loan is to buy merchandise. If she buys now she will have good sales during Holy Week. Her dream has always been to improve her house. She intends to use the loan to invest more in her business so that it will be more profitable. That is where she will get the resources to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fabiola Danelia

texts.es: La señora Fabiola Danelia se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en comarcas. Es madre de 2 hijos y junto a su esposo han logrado salir adelante. Ella tiene  5 años de trabajar de esta manera, ofrece sus productos a la gente del campo ya que ellos son sus principales clientes debido a que por falta de tiempo ellos no pueden venir a la ciudad a realizar sus compras. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fabiola Danelia travels about the region selling clothing. She has 2 children, and she and her husband have been able to get ahead. She has been in this business for 5 years, offering her goods to people in the rural areas. These are her main customers, because they do not have time to come to the city for shopping. She is requesting a loan for working capital, to be used to purchase stock. Her goal is to keep her business going.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Aurora Elena

texts.es: La señora Aurora posee un negocio que es la venta de granos básicos ubicada en su casa de habitación, sus compras las realiza de compra do y sus ventas de contado y al crédito. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar ya que ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsable por pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Además  de su negocio la señora venden cosméticos para a si ayudarse con los gastos de su hogar, su esposo trabaja como sastre brindándole un poco de ayuda a su familia. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es brindar el mejor servicio necesario.
texts.en:
Aurora’s business is selling basic grains from her home. She purchases her goods and then sells for cash or on credit. She has always enjoyed working, and has demonstrated that she is very reliable, in that she has paid her installments on time and correctly. In addition to this business, she sells cosmetics, to help out with household expenses. Her husband works as a tailor, which offers some help to the family. The loan is for working capital to buy stock. Her goal is to offer the best service required.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gloria Estefania

texts.es:
La señora  Gloria A. es otra socia activa  del banco comunal  Ensueños, ella vive en la ciudad de Azogues, localidad que se caracteriza por su clima frío,  sus iglesias y por la belleza que esta ciudad encierra en  su centro histórico donde se mezcla lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente es muy amable y trabajadora  como nuestra socias que día a día buscan oportunidades de superación personal y familiar.

Nuestra socia tiene 22 años es casada y madre de un bebé de un año ocho meses,  Gloria y su  esposo trabajan en su  cafetería que montaron   hace cinco meses aquí  laboran  de lunes a jueves de 09h00 a 17h00 y los fines de semana  para mejorar el negocio preparan almuerzos,  pinchos, arroz con menestra, carnes asadas,  entre  otros platos .

Se encuentra en su quinto ciclo y fue una prima quien la invito a formar parte de este hermoso grupo, con el dinero de su crédito va a invertir en  la ampliación de su cafetería, comprará  mesas, sillas, vajillas, y más menaje de cocina que le hace falta. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante para dar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is another active member of the community bank "Ensueños". She lives in the city of Azogues, which is characterized by its cold climate, churches, and the beauty of its historical city center where the colonial and modern are mixed together. The people here are very kind and hardworking, including our members who, day in and day out, are searching for opportunities to improve conditions for themselves and their families.

Our member is 22 years old, married, and the mother of a baby who is one year and eight months old. Gloria and her husband work in the cafeteria that they opened 5 months ago. They work Monday to Thursday from 9 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon and at weekends in order to improve the business and prepare lunches, snacks, rice with vegetables, roast meats, and other dishes.

She is in her fifth loan cycle, and it was one of her cousins who invited her to be part of this wonderful group. With the money from the loan, she will invest in growing the cafeteria, buying tables, chairs, dishes, and more kitchenware. He greatest dream is to have her own restaurant in order to best serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, dishes and kitchenware.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CATALINA ES UNA CLIENTE QUE YA TRABAJO  DOS SECUENCIAS CON LA INSITUTCION EN LOS DOS ANTERIORES CREDITO DEMOSTRO RESPONSABILIDAD YA QUE NO TUBO NINGUN PROBLEMA CON EL PAGO DE SUS CUOTAS, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA DE BEBE, PAÑALES Y COLGADORES, SU PUESTO ESTA UBICADO EN LA  ZONA 16 DE JULIO LA FERIA MAS POPULOSA DEL ALTO DONDE ENCUENTRAS TODO TIPO DE MERCADERIA , ELLA VENDE TODOS LOS DIAS SU PUESTO ES MAS LLENO LOS DIAS JUEVES Y DOMINGO QUE ES LA FERIA DE LA 16 DE JULIO, ESOS DIAS LA VENTA ES MAYOR,  TAMBIEN VENDE ROPA PARA NIÑOS, LA SEÑORA TIENE DOS NIÑOS PEQUEÑOS QUE ESTAN EN COLEGIO, SU ESPOSO SE LLAMA MILTON  Y SE DEDICA A LA SUPERVISION EN LA EMPRESA SUMA PACHA, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE ROPA DE BEBE Y NIÑOS POR MAYOR, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Catalina is a client who has already participated in two loan cylces with Kiva field partner Emprender. With the prior two loans, she demonstrated responsibility by never having a problem making loan payments. Catalina sells baby apparel, diapers and clothing hangers. Her stall is located in the 16 de Julio street market, the most populous of all, where you can find any and all types of merchandise for sale. She is open every day. Her shop is busiest Thursdays and Sundays, the days when the market is busiest. She also sells childern's clothing. Catalina has two young children who are in school. Her husband Milton is a supervisor for the Suma Pacha Company. The loan will be largely invested in the purchase of clothing for infants and children. Catlin is very grateful to Kiva and partner Emprender for the confidence she has received by being granted this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel tiene 30 años, es un hombre perseverante que no le teme a las adversidades, sólo ve hacía adelante. Está casado con Elizabeth de 28 años y ambos tienen 3 hijos, quienes viven juntos en su casa propia. Es así que la necesidad de brindarle comodidades a su familia, hacen que Joel, en compañía de  su esposa, se dedique a la siembra de papa, arveja y gladiolos sobre sus terrenos propios, además el tener un puesto en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, en donde vende toda su producción desde hace 7 años, le genera ingresos adicionales. De manera particular, le gusta sacar leche de las vacas, propiedad de sus padres, que lo realiza con el fin de ayudarles en la venta de quesos. Estos oficios, le permiten cubrir las necesidades de sus seres queridos, e incluso adquirir bienes como un terreno de dos hectáreas que compró recientemente, en donde piensa sembrar gladiolos. Por lo que espera las ganancias, producto de su cosecha para  comprarse una casa en la ciudad e instalar su tienda de comestibles, además de situar la producción de verduras en su actual puesto. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y manifiesta que continuará trabajando en su grupo  comunal con el mismo empeño como cuando empezó en el primer día. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 8 sacos de fertilizantes, dos bolsas de arveja y 5 botellas de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Joel is 30 years old, and a persevering man who is not afraid of adversity - he only looks forward. He is married to 28 year old Elizabeth, and they have 3 children. They all live together in their own house. The need to offer their family good living conditions motivates Joel and his wife to work hard at growing potatoes, peas, and gladioli on their own land. Joel also has a stall in the major city market where he has been selling his products for 7 years, which earns him additional income. He also takes milk from his parents cows in order to help them with selling cheese. These trades allow him to provide all the basics that his loved ones need, and even to recently purchase two hectares of land where he is thinking of growing gladioli. He hopes that the income from his harvest will enable him to buy a house in the city and set-up a store, as well as having his vegetables at his current market stall. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he states that he will continue to work with this community group with the same commitment as he had when he began. With the loan that he is requesting, he will buy 8 sacks of fertilizer, two bags of peas, and 5 bottles of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed peas, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Julio Jose

texts.es: El señor Julio Cáliz tiene 36 años es padre de familia, tiene 3 hijas, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la periferia del poblado, la actividad económica del señor Cáliz es la elaboración de artesanías, realiza la actividad de manera manual. Hace más de 12 años tiene este negocio porque tenía que proporcionarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y a sus hijos una educación. El señor Julio empezó trabajando como ayudante y luego aprendió a fabricar piezas de barro. El financiamiento es para compra de materia prima y elaborar artículos de barro, para cumplir  sus deseos de tener dinero suficiente para trabajar con capital propio y dar una estabilidad emocional y económica a su familia.
texts.en:
36-year old Señor Julio Cáliz is the father of three daughters. His home is located on the outskirts of the village. Señor Julio earns his living by making crafts by hand. He has done this work for more than twelve years because he needed to provide a steady income for his family and educate his children. He began working as an assistant and subsequently learned to make pieces out of clay. The loan will be used to buy basic materials for making the clay artifacts. It will allow him to achieve his wish of having enough of his own money to invest and give emotional and economic stability to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Diana Ivon

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es el esposo.
Diana Ivon y su esposo es una pareja joven que empieza a formar un patrimonio para su familia. Es por ello que en este momento quiere un préstamo para poder construir un cuarto en la planta alta de su vivienda para poder realizar este proyecto es comprar material y pago de mano de obra. Esta joven pareja se preocupa por el bienestar de su único hijo más que todo darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the photograph is the husband. Diana and her husband are a young couple who are just starting to form a family. It's for this reason that they are requesting a loan at the moment, so they can build a room on the top floor of their home by purchasing materials and hiring labor to complete the project. This young couple worries about the well-being of their only son and want to provide him a better quality of life more than anything.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room on the top floor of their home

loans.name: Martha Francisca

texts.es: Martha Francisca A. y su esposo han luchado para poder obtener un buen patrimonio. Esta familia se dedica a la venta de muebles usados para el hogar y renta de locales de esta manera es como ellos ganan dinero para mantener los gastos. Martha es madre de dos hijas por quienes se preocupa en dejarles un mejor patrimonio para que se puedan defender en un futuro. La señora quiere terminar una barda que tiene empezada que por falta de dinero no la ha terminado es por ello que pide el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto ya que la delincuencia esta cada día pero y teme que algún desconocido pueda hacer algo en contra de sus hijas y ya con la barda construida se sentirá mas protegida.
texts.en:
Martha and her husband have fought hard to establish a good patrimony. The couple make a living selling used furniture and renting lots and in this way they earn money to cover their expenses. Martha is a mother of two daughters for whom she wants to leave with a good inheritance that they can use in the future. She wants to finish building a fence that they had started but couldn't finish because of a lack of funds, which is why she is asking for support in completing this project. Crime is on the rise every day and she is afraid a stranger could do something to her daughters, and with the fence built she will feel more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish building a fence

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: LA SEÑORA FLORA ES UNA DE NUESTRAS CLIENTES MAS ANTIGUA DE LA INSTITUCION,  ESTA EN LA INSITUCION DESDE EL AÑO 2003, ES UNA CLIENTE CON BUENA ACTITUD, RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE POLLERAS Y MANTAS DE SEÑORA DE POLLERA (LA VESTIMENTA DE LA SEÑORA DE POLLERA EN LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ ES MUY PARTICULAR, ELLAS LLEVAN UNA FALDA GRUESA Y ADENTRO UNA POLLERA DELGADA QUE LA DENOMINAN ENAGUA, EN LA PARTE SUPERIOR LLEVAN LA MANTA CONFECCIONADA CON TELA DE SEDA) , ELLA VENDE EN LAS DIFERENTES FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO ENTRE ELLAS LA FERIA DE BATALLAS Y ACHACACHI ESTAS FERIAS ESTAN ALEJADAS DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, ELLA HACE UN GRAN ESFUERZO AL LLEVAR MERCADERIA A LOS DIFERENTES PUEBLOS DE LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ, ELLA TIENE DOS HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SU EPOSO ES CHOFER Y TRABAJA TODOS LOS DIAS PARA LA MANTENER SU HOGAR, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Flora is one of this institution's most long-standing members; she has been working with this institution since the year 2003. She is a woman who has a good attitude, and is responsible and hardworking. She has a business selling polleras (traditional skirts) and shawls in the style of "Señora de Pollera" (The traditional "Señora de Pollera" outfit in the city of La Paz is very particular: they wear a thick skirt and then inside a petticoat called an "enagua", and on the top they wear a shawl made of silk fabric.) She sells these items in different markets in the city of El Alto, including the markets of Batallas and Achachi. These markets are on the outskirts of the city of La Paz. She makes a great effort to take her merchandise to the different parts of the city of La Paz. She has 2 children who are school-aged, and her husband is a driver who works every day to support the household. This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (traditional Bolivian clothing)

loans.name: Zara Liduvina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Ensueños está ubicado en la ciudad de Azogues, su clima frío es propicio para el cultivo de papas, habas, fréjol, y algunas frutas y verduras, también nos invita a disfrutar de la belleza de sus templos, su centro histórico donde podemos apreciar el arte colonial y  moderno, además de la calidez  de su gente siempre amable y cordial con el turista.

 En éste banco encontramos a la señora Zara C.  con apenas 19 años se encuentra casada y ya tiene un bebé de un año tres meses, viven en casa de sus suegros porque aún no tienen casa propia;  su esposo trabaja en una lavadora de autos y ella en su gabinete de belleza gracias a que estudió por tres años en una academia de la localidad,  su horario de trabajo es de 08H30 a 18H30 compartiendo con las actividades propias del hogar, cuidado de su bebé y también se da tiempo para vender productos cosméticos de las  líneas Yanbal, Esika, L´bel, nos comenta que lleva siete años como consultora de belleza lo que le ha permitido contar con su clientela fija.

Este es su tercer ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal gracias a la invitación que le hizo una amiga socia activa del banco. Con el dinero del crédito solicitado comprará tintes, bigudíes,  líquidos permanentes, así como perfumes, cremas, esmaltes, tratamientos,  y más productos cosméticos  Yanbal, Esika, Lébel para damas y caballeros. Tiene como máximo sueño tener su departamento independiente para poder vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
The Ensueños (Dreams) Community Bank is located in the city of Azogues. Its cold climate is favorable to cultivating potatoes, beans and some types of fruits and vegetables. It is also known for the beauty of its temples and is a historic center where people can appreciate colonial and modern art, not to mention that its people are always friendly to tourists. In this community bank we find Zara C., who at only 19 years old is married and has a 3-month old baby. She lives in the home of her in-laws since she doesn't have her own home. Her husband works at a car wash, and she works at a beauty parlor thanks to studying for three years at a local school. She works from 8:30 a.m. until 6:30 p.m. and still fulfills her household duties, cares for her baby and also takes time to sell cosmetic products from the Yanbal, Esika and Lébel product lines. She tells us that she has seven years of work experience, which has allowed her to have a fixed clientele. This is her third loan cycle with the community bank, which she joined at the invitation of a friend who is also an active member. With the money she is requesting, she plans to purchase dye, curlers and permanent solution, as well as perfumes, creams, nail polish, treatments and more cosmetic products from Yanbal, Esika and Lébel for women and men. Her biggest dream is to have her own place where she can live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dye, curlers and permanent solution, as well as perfumes, creams, nail polish, treatments and more cosmetic products from Yanbal, Esika and Lébel for women and men

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José Luis C. C. y su esposa son padres de familia de tres niños pequeños, por quienes tienen que trabajar para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y un patrimonio.
En este momento José Luis desea impermeabilizar su vivienda y pintarla por dentro y por fuera, mas que todo para que en temporada de lluvia el agua no trasmine y pueda mojar algún aparato electrónico y pueda hacer un corto circuito en su vivienda; así ocasionar un accidente grave. Es por esto que vuelve a pedir el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
José Luis C. C. and his wife are the parents of three small children, for whom they need to work to offer them a better quality of life and legacy. Currently José Luis wishes to seal and paint his home both inside and out, more than anything so that in the rainy season the water does not leak and soak their electronic appliances, which would create a short circuit in his home and create an unfortunate accident. It is for this reason that he is requesting the support to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seal his home

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Fátima Del Rosario tiene 42 años de edad, tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos. Dio inicio a este negocio hace 5 años, con una parte de productos, hoy en día compra una amplia variedad. Es importante mencionar que ella sale todos los días a ofrecer los productos a sus clientes y a enseñar los catálogos en donde sus clientes deciden lo que Fátima les llevara. Ella sueña con llegar a tener algún día un tramo en el mercado. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pintura de uñas, perfumes cremas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
42-year old Fátima Del Rosario has two children. She earns her living by buying and selling cosmetics. She began the business five years ago with just a few products but nowadays she has a wide range. Fátima goes out every day offering her customers the products and showing them the catalogs from which they decide what she can bring them. Her dream is to have a place in the market one day, and for this reason she is asking for a loan to buy nail polish, perfumes, creams and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: LA SEÑORA YOLANDA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA DE LA INSTITUCION TRABAJA EN LA INSTITUCION DESDE HACE SIETE AÑOS ATRAS, ES UN CLIENTE CON BUENA ACTITUD, TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE VIENDO POR EL BIENESTAR DE SU FAMILIA, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA EN LA CALLE QUINTANILLA, SU NEGOCIO ES FIJO Y TRABAJA DESDE MUY TEMPRANO PARA LA ELABORACION DE SU COMIDA HASTA EL MEDIO DIA, LUEGO SE DEDICA A  LA LIMPIEZA DE SUS OLLAS, ELLA TIENE DOS HIJOS UNO ES MENOR QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR Y EL OTRO ES MAYOR,  EL MAYOR SE DEDICA AL PINTADO DE CASAS Y ARREGLO DE COMPUTADORAS, LA INVERSION QUE REALIZARA ES PARA LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS E INGREDIENTES COMO ARROZ, ACEITE, PAPA, ETC. Y TAMBIEN OLLAS Y PLATOS PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUS COMIDAS Y ASI BRINDAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a long-time client of the institution, who has been working with us for the past seven years. She is a hard working person with a good attitude who is always looking after the well being of her family. Yolanda sells food on Fifth Street. She has a permanent location and begins cooking very early in the morning and continues to the afternoon. She then spends time cleaning her pots and pans. She has two children, one of whom is school-aged and the other works as a house painter, and as a computer repairman. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and ingredients, such as rice, cooking oil, potatoes, etc. She will also buy some pots and plates in which to cook her food and be able to better serve her customers. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in her by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ELVIRA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA DE LA INSTITUCION  ESTA EN LA INSITUCION DESDE EL AÑO 2003, ES UN CLIENTE CON BUENA ACTITUD ES RESPONSABLE Y MUY TRABAJADORA, ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE POLLERAS Y MANTAS DE SEÑORA DE POLLERA (LA VESTIMENTA DE LA SEÑORA DE POLLERA EN LA CIUDAD DE LA PAZ ES MUY PARTICULAR, ELLAS LLEVAN UNA FALDA GRUESA Y ADENTRO UNA POLLERA DELGADA QUE LA DENOMINAN ENAGUA, EN LA PARTE SUPERIOR LLEVAN LA MANTA CONFECCIONADA CON TELA DE SEDA) , ELLA LO DISTRIBUYE EN TODAS LAS FERIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO, SU TRABAJO ES SACRIFICADO POR QUE TODOS LOS DIA TIENE QUE AMBULAR Y REPARTIR SU MERCADERIA EN TODA LA CIUDAD DE EL ALTO, ELLA TIENE UN HIJO, SU EPOSO ES CHOFER PROPIETARIO DEL SINDICATO PEDRO DOMINGO MURILLO ESTE SINDICATO ES DE MICROBUSES Y EL SE LEVANTA DESDE MUY TEMPRANO Y TRABAJA HASTA MUY TARDE PARA GANAR Y SUSTENTAR A SU FAMILIA, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Elvira is a long time client of the institution and has been working with us since 2003 and is a hard working woman with a good attitude. She sells “polleras” (a pollera is a big Spanish skirt) and shawls. (Wearing shawls is very common in La Paz.) She sells her wares in all of the fairs around the city of El Alto. Her work requires much sacrifice, because she needs to walk every day to deliver her merchandise around the city. She has a son and her husband is a driver for the Pedro Domingo Murillo Company, a bus company. He rises very early and works very late in order to earn enough to support his family. Elvira is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in her by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, es una mujer laboriosa y muy alegre, tiene 53 años y está casada con Jeremías de 60 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales vive solo con dos de ellos, en su casa propia. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa, arveja, habas y maíz, sobre terrenos propios y arrendados, en donde su esposo la ayuda en esta labor todos los días, empezando muy temprano por la mañana, en tanto que en sus ratos libres teje chompas para caballeros y damas, que luego son comercializados a S/. 70.00 soles cada uno. Asimismo y por temporadas, ofrece prendas de vestir dejando a crédito a sus conocidos. Ella no se queja de sus actividades, pues asegura que le dan buenos beneficios económicos, con las cuales cubre sus gastos domésticos, así como los estudios de sus hijos e incluso le permite ahorrar para prevenir cualquier eventualidad. Es por eso que desea arrendar más tierras, para extender sus siembras y generarle una buena producción agrícola. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal, porque le enseñan a ser responsable y sobre todo puntual con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará dos sacos de arveja.
texts.en:
Julia is a happy, hardworking woman. She is 53 years old and her husband Jeremías is 60. They own their own home and live there with two of their four children. For 30 years, Julia has been a farmer, growing potatoes, peas, beans, and corn on her own land as well as on rented fields. She wakes up very early every morning to work in the fields with her husband. In her free time, she knits sweaters for men and women, which she is able to sell for approximately $25 each. Seasonally, she also sells clothing to her acquaintances on credit. Julia does not complain about working so hard. She knows that it ensures that she has enough income to cover her household expenses, to pay her children's school fees, and to save money for unexpected expenses. She would like to rent more land to increase her harvest and generate more income from farming. This is her first loan from MFP. She has enjoyed working with her communal bank because they are teaching her to be responsible and, above all, on-time with her payments. She will use the loan to purchase two bags of peas.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 2 bags of peas

loans.name: Jiovanna Mirian

texts.es: LA SEÑORA JIOVANNA ES CLIENTE ANTIGUA DE LA INSTITUCION, HA DEMOSTRADO SER MUY RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS, DINAMICA Y TRABAJADORA, ESTA EN SU SEPTIMO CREDITO, TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO Y UNA PELUQUERIA, DESDE HACE 4 AÑOS, VIVE EN CASA DE SU SUEGRA, ELLA ES CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ELLA TRABAJA CON CAPITAL PROPIO. EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA AHORA ES PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA DE BARRIO, ELLA TRABAJA DURO PARA SACAR A SU FAMILIA ADELANTE YA QUE ES LA UNICA QUE MANTIENE SU HOGAR.  LA SRA. JIOVANNA TIENE MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERACION DESEA MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Jiovanna is a long time client of the institution who has proven to be responsible with her payments. She is dynamic and hard working and this will be her seventh loan. She has had a neighborhood store and a barber shop for four years. She is married, has three school aged children and lives with her mother in law. She has been working with her own capital. She will use the money from this loan to stock her store. She works hard to support her family and maintain her home. Jiovanna is anxious to get ahead and improve the quality of life for her entire family. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in her by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Mariana es socia del Banco Comunal Familiar en una localidad situada a las afuera de la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí.

Nuestra socia desde hace algunos años enviudo y vive con su hijos, está dedicada al trabajo artesanal  en  tagua, todo empezó cuando ella trabaja en una fábrica y aprendió el oficio, tiene 3 años que se independizó para empezar invirtió casi 400 dólares ya que tuvo que comprar una maquina para cortar la tagua. Su trabajo consiste en hacer las fichas para botones para lo cual viaja a la ciudad de Manta  donde adquiere  la matería prima, ella elabora sus artesanías y  las entrega a una persona que se encargada  de enviar a otros países y allá le dan  el  acabado final,  no tiene horario fijo pero si tiene que ser las  8 horas diarias, como ella trabaja sola debe organizarse  para tomar los pedidos y  no quedar mal  con las entregas de su trabajo por lo cual debe dividir bien su tiempo entre el trabajo y los quehaceres del hogar,  todas las semanas adquiere suficiente materia prima para entregar a tiempo sus pedidos.

Mariana integra el  banco comunal hace dos ciclos, el  dinero que recibirá  lo invertirá en comprar  tagua, por el momento es pequeño su taller pero aspira poder comprar una maquina para contratar operadoras y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariana is a member of the communal bank "Familiar," located in the outskirts of the city of Montecristi in Manabí province. She has been a widow for a number of years, and she lives with her children. She makes handicrafts from tagua (a large nut with an interior that looks and feels like ivory and can be carved into handicrafts.) She started in this business when she worked in a factory and learned the trade. Three years ago she became independent and, with an investment of 400 dollars, she bought a machine to cut the tagua. Her work consists in cutting shapes for buttons. To do this she travels to the city of Manta, where she acquires the raw materials. She then makes her products and delivers them to a person who is in charge of sending them to other countries where they are given a final finish. She does not have a set schedule but she works 8 hours a day. As she works alone, she must organize herself to take the orders and avoid mistakes with the delivery of her work, because she must divide her time well between the work and her household tasks. Each week she must have sufficient raw materials on hand in order to fulfill her orders on time. Mariana joined the communal bank 2 loan cycles ago, and the money that she will receive from this loan will be invested in the purchase of tagua, because at this moment her workshop is small but she aspires to be able to buy a machine so that she can have employees and make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tagua to make buttons

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria es una persona joven y muy alegre. Ella y su esposo, Carlos, tienen un pequeño hijo en edad escolar y viven en la zona de Villa Salomé que se encuentra a 30 minutos del centro de la cuidad. María se dedica a la venta de carne de llama y cordero en el Mercado 10 de Enero de Pampahasi. Comenzó con esta actividad debido a que su madre realizaba la misma actividad pero debido a que ya era mayor le dejo a María el puesto de venta. Carlos trabaja como enfermero en el Hospital General de esta cuidad. Ellos son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables ya que con su trabajo esperan poder ahorrar lo suficiente para poder comprar una casa propia. Uno de los mayores anhelos de Maria es poder ver a su hijo como profesional. Este es el segundo préstamo que María tiene con nuestra institución, en el primer préstamo ella demostro ser una persona muy puntual. En esta ocación ella solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para levantar un muro en su casa. Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
María is a happy young woman. She and her husband, Carlos, have a young, school-aged son. They live in the Villa Salomé zone, which is located 30 minutes from the city center. María sells llama and lamb meat in the "10 de Enero" market in Pampahasi. She began this business with her mother, who left the business to María when she retired. Carlos works as a nurse in the city's general hospital. They are both hard working and responsible people. They hope to be able to save enough money to buy their own home. One of María's greatest desires is to see her son in a professional career. This will be María's second loan through our institution. She demonstrated great punctuality in repaying her first loan. She will use the money from this loan to build a wall around her house. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in her by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building Materials

loans.name: Dora Eloisa

texts.es: Dora Eloisa tiene 53 años, ella se dedica a la actividad económica de es la venta de mercadería en general. La ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así poder realizar las compras de ropa, calzado, toallas, perfumes, cremas y protector solar por la temporada de verano. El sueño de ella es ofertar muy buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora Eloisa is 53 years old, and she has dedicated her professional life to the sale of general goods. Her business is mobile, and she has been in business for over 16 years. The financing she is requesting is for working capital so that she will be able to purchase clothes, shoes, towels, perfumes, cremes and sunscreen for the summer months. Her dream to to offer very good products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel de 45 años de edad, vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casado con cuatro hijos que su esposa procreo, el trabaja desde hace varios años a la empresa el Minsa en mantenimiento y reparación de equipo del hospital. el cual ha logrado hacer su casa toda de concreto poco a poco la ha ido construyendo, lo que le falta por terminar es el porche que ya tiene un comienzo, el cual desea terminar: comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y tratar de cerrar el porche para tener mas espacio en donde descansar y respirar mas el aire. Todo esto es para dar a su familia una mejor vivienda, que a mucho esfuerzo ha logrado para obtener estos beneficios que junto con la institución ha alcanzado.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 45, lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. He is married and has four children. He has worked for several years in the maintenance and repair of hospital equipment for the Minsa Company. This has allowed him to build his house all from concrete. He has been slowly building it, but he has not finished the porch. He started it, and he wants to finish it. He will buy rocks, sand, cement, and iron. He will try to close the porch in order to have more space to rest and breathe more air. All of this is to give his family a better house. With great effort he has gotten these benefits, which were achieved together with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rocks, sand, cement and tools to start builing the porch

loans.name: Felipa Esperanza

texts.es: Felipa Esperanza tiene 65 años, anteriormente ella ya había tenido experiencia con financiamientos. Por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a sus clientes los productos necesarios. Ella sueña con mantener activo su negocio ya que es su único medio de ingreso. ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo como granos básicos, golosinas, cosméticos, detergentes, gaseosas y jugos.
texts.en:
Felipa Esperanza is 65 years old, and she has had experience with financing in the past. Felipe dedicates her professional life to her grocery store, and it has been 7 years that she has dedicated herself to this business. She has always been concerned about providing her clients with the products they need. She dreams of maintaining an active business since that is her only mode of income. She is requesting this financing for working capital for basic grains, sweets, cosmetics, detergent, sodas and juices.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de año y medio de edad, vive junto a su madre en el caserío Calazán del distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la crianza y comercialización de animales, ella cría cuyes en un ambiente de su vivienda para venderlos a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona y a algunos vecinos que eventualmente adquieren los animales que cría. Los cuyes son animales domésticos de carne muy estimada y cuyo consumo se extiende a nivel nacional desde tiempos remotos.

Margarita desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más cuyes para criarlos y venderlos, asimismo desea comprar el alimento balanceado que estos necesitan para lograr un desarrollo optimo. Por este motivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Margarita es una mujer bastante responsable y muy entregada a su trabajo. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es poder darle a su menor hijo una educación de calidad que le garantice un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old, and she is a single mother of a small boy who is one and a half years old. She lives with her mother in the rural community of Calazán in the Monsefú district, located 15 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 3 years she has worked raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs in an area of her house, in order to sell them to the traders who frequent her area and to some neighbors who acquire them for breeding purposes. The guinea pigs are highly valued for their meat; they have been consumed throughout the country since ancient times. Margarita wants to expand her business by purchasing more guinea pigs to raise and sell. In addition, she wants to buy nutritious feed for them so that they will grow optimally. For this reason she has seen the necessity of coming for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa to request a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles that will help her achieve these goals. Margarita is a responsible woman who is very dedicated to her work. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high esteem, and consider her to be a trustworthy person. Her main wish is to be able to give her small boy a quality education that will ensure him a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and nutritionally balanced feed to expand her business

loans.name: Gloria Ernestina

texts.es: Gloria Ernestina es una mujer muy responsable y lo ha demostrado con los créditos que ha tenido con Fundación. Actualmente ella se dedica a una pulpería,   por lo que tiene más de 6 años de realizar esta labor, que le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Ella no tenía el capital suficiente  para comprar la variedad de productos que le solicitaban, fue con los financiamientos que logro progresar con su negocio. Gloria está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de café, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, detergente, papel higiénico entre otros productos. Su deseo es que sus hijos sean personas de bien y logren ser excelente profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria Ernestina is a very responsible woman and has demonstrated this with the credits she has had with the Foundation. Currently she is dedicated to her grocery store, which has taken her 6 years to achieve. It has costed her significant effort and sacrifice. She did not have sufficient capital to buy the variety of products that her clients requested. It was through financing that she was able to progress with her business. Gloria is requesting this financing for the purchase of coffee, rice, beans, sugar, oil, detergent, toilet paper, and other products. Her wish is that her children be good people in life and that they excel in their professions.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mardi De La Concepcion

texts.es: Mardi De La Concepción tiene 55 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado mejorar su ingresos ya que además tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 está a su cargo, ella siempre ha buscado la forma de salir adelante cuando dio inicio a su negocio no tenía mucha experiencia, pero sus clientes le han proporcionado la confianza necesaria y fue así como fue prendiendo a desenvolverse con cada uno. Ella sueña con mejorar su condición económica y quisiera proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mardi De La Concepción is 55 years old, and she has dedicated her professional life to her grocery store for over 5 years. She has always enjoyed increasing her income and has 2 children, one of whom is still under her care. She has always looked for a way to succeed. When she began her business she had little experience, but her clients have given her the necessary trust and in this way she has built a relationship with each one. Her dream is to increase her income and to perform improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Marisol Genoveva

texts.es: Marisol Genoveva tiene 37 años, Marisol tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general por lo que ofrece diferentes productos, hace mas de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad, pues también tiene un trabajo extra de impulsadora en la empresa DISEGSA ya que cuenta con los ingresos fijos de este empleo es así que ella sufraga los gastos del hogar. Actualmente este financiamiento lo realiza para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es llegar a tener un negocio establecido.
texts.en:
Marisol Genoveve is a 37-year-old woman with two children. This is not her first financing round. For eight years, Marisol has been selling general merchandise, offering a variety of products. In addition, she also works as a sales promoter for a company named DISEGSA. With the help of steady income provided by this job, Marisol is able to cover her household expenses. Currently, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase raw materials. Her wish is to develop an established business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
KARIN MILAGROS, TIENE 27 AÑOS, , ES CASADA TIENE UN PEQUEÑO HIJO. DESD. HACE TRES AÑOS ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "SAN FRANCISCO", FORMADO POR SEIS PERSONAS MÁS, QUIENES LA ELIGIERON COMO LA PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE TRES AÑOS, INICIÓ EL NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. DESAYUNOS, EMPEZÓ CON MUY POCO D. FORMA AMBULATORIA, VENDIENDO SOLO CAFÉ Y MATES, LUEGO FUÉ COMPLEMENTANDO CON SANGUCHES. AHORA OFRECE TAMBIÉN ALGUNOS PLATOS D. COMIDA Y HA PODIDO CONSERVAR LA VENTA D. 40 DESAYUNOS AL DÍA.
CON SU NEGOCIO HA PODIDO IMPLEMENTAR UN ESPACIO EN LA CASA D. SU MAMÁ PARA TENER UN LUGAR FIJO D. VENTA.
SU PROXIMA META ES IMPLEMENTAR UN LOCUTORIO, POR AHORA CON EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO EMPEZARÁ COMPRANDO SALDO PARA LLAMADAS Y DARÁ EL SERVICIO AMBULATORIAMENTE.
texts.en:
Karin Milagros, 27, is married and has a son. She’s been a member of the “San Francisco” group, which has six additional members, for 3 years; she was elected group president. She started selling prepared breakfasts thirteen years ago; she started out with very little peddling her meals in the streets; her only menu items were coffee and teas. Later on, she added sandwiched and now prepares complete dishes and manages to keep a daily 40-meal production. Her business has maD. it possible for her to establish a fixed location in her mother’s house for her sales. Her next goal is to set up a portable phone booth; she will use the funding to buy phone credits and will proviD. the service moving place to place.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in a portable phone booth.

loans.name: Jamileth Del Rosario

texts.es: Jamileth del Rosario es cliente de nuestra institución desde hace mucho tiempo por lo que tiene una amplia experiencia en financiamientos. Su actividad económica es el servicio de bar y comedor. Ya que este negocio inicio hace más de 15 años, por lo que ha sido de gran ayuda para ella. Por lo que siempre ha sido una mujer muy responsable con sus cuotas. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de gaseosa, jugos, granos básicos, verduras y frutas. Ella sueña con seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Jamileth del Rosario has been a client of our institution for a long time so she has extensive experience managing loans. She has had a restaurant/bar for over 15 years which has been of great utility for her. She has always been very responsible with her loan installment repayments. She is asking for funding to buy soft-drinks, juices, basic grains, fruits and vegetables. She dreams with being able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food and drinks.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 30 años, está casada con Alberto de 32 años, con quien tiene dos hijos, y juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicado en la zona alta de Tarma. Desde hace 10 años que Silvia empieza su día, cada mañana con la preparación de los alimentos, luego atiende a sus animales que tiene, como: gallinas, cerdos y vacas, de éste último, extrae leche para elaborar quesos, que son ofrecidos posteriormente en las tiendas de su localidad, después se traslada a su terreno agrícola, en donde cuida los cultivos de papa, maíz y arveja, en tanto su esposo se dedica a la mudanza de muebles, debido a que cuenta con un carro para realizar tal labor, cobrando por viaje, S/. 60.00 soles, dependiendo además de la distancia. Como ambos tienen ingresos económicos, lo derivan en los gastos de sus menores hijos, para que no le falte nada. Sabe que sus cosechas son bastante productivas, es por ello que para el futuro desea sembrar en mayor cantidad arvejas. Este es su primera vez con MFP, por lo que se muestra muy entusiasta y atenta a las decisiones que acuerdan dentro de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una bolsa de semillas de arveja y tres sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Silvia, 30, is married to Alberto, 32, and they have two children; they all live together in their own home which is located in the high part of Tarma. For the last 10 years, Silvia starts her day off preparing meals and then caring for the animals, chickens, pigs and cows, that she has; she milks the cows to extract milk to make cheese that she then sells to local stores. Next, she goes to her fields to tend to her potato, corn and pea crops. Her husband works as a furniture mover because he has a vehicle appropriate for this kind of work; he charges 60 soles per load depending on distance. Since they both have sources of income, they can see to their children’s needs so that they won’t lack anything. She knows that her crops are quite profitable so she’d like to plant more peas in the future. This is her first loan request with MFP and she is enthusiastic and attentive to her communal group decisions. She will use the requested funds to buy a sack of pea seed and three sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia tiene 49 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y amorosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su querida hija Yusely de 16 años, quien es su principal apoyo a la hora de trabajar en la chacra y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que Delia tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, junto a la más joven de sus hijas trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando papas y habas, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Paralelamente a esta actividad, tiene una tienda, en donde abastece de víveres a todo su poblado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como crecen sus plantaciones. Es así que lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus sembríos, puesto que los químicos que utiliza para eliminar a las plagas, son altamente dañinos para su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar su producción. Este es segundo crédito con MFP; en su primer crédito fue muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En tanto, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy alegre, motivo por el cual es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras.
Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus chacras, así como también productos de primera necesidad para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Delia is 49 years old, mother to a very happy and loving family, who lives in her own home with her dear daughter Yusely who is 16 years old. Yusely is her main help when working on the farm and what she wants most is to improve Yusely's quality of life.

The arduous work days that Delia spends on the farm have improved their crops and made their land more productive. Alongside of the youngest of her daughters she works from very early in the morning, growing potatoes and beans, products that they will then sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. In addition to this job, she has a store where she sells foodstuffs to the people of her village. What she enjoys most about her job is sowing the land and watching her crops grow. She has been working in the fields for thirty years and thinks the hardest part is having to spray the crops, since the pesticides are highly damaging to your health.

With time she would like to be able to buy more land and increase her production. This is her second loan with MFP; with her first loan she was very punctual with her payments and hopes to be this time as well. In her village bank she is known as a very cheerful member, beloved by the rest of her group. With the 100 nuevos soles that she is asking for, she will buy fertilizer for her farm as well as food staples to improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying fertilizer and staples for her store

loans.name: Unidos Con Exito Group

texts.es:
MARIA ANGELICA, TIENE 52 AÑOS, SEIS HIJOS, D. LOS CUALES 02 SON MENORES D. EDAD Y ESTAN A SU CUIDADO. HACE TRES AÑOS INTEGRA EL GRUPO "UNIDOS CON EXITO", FORMADO POR 09 PERSONAS MÀS, RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO, ELLOS LA ELIGIERON PRESIDENTA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
TIENE 30 AÑOS COMO COMERCIANTE, ELLA APROVECHA LA TENDENCIA PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO D. NOMBRE "GEHOVA - JIRE"
EMPEZÓ OFRECIENDO ROPA D. CASA EN CASA, VENDIÓ COMO AMBULANTE EN EL MERCADO.POCO A POCO FUE CRECIENDO SU NEGOCIO, AHORA YA SE ESTABLECIÓ EN UN LOCAL, Y CONTINUAMENTE PARTICIPA EN FERIAS, ESPECIALMENTE EN LA EPOCA ESCOLAR.
CON SU NEGOCIO HA LOGRADO TECHAR SU CASA Y PAGAR LOS ESTUDIOS D. SUS HIJOS.
SU PROXIMA META ES IMPLEMENTAR UNA LIBRERÍA - BAZAR GRAND. EN SU CASA.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA CAMPAÑA DEL DÍA D. LA MADRE, EN LA COMPRA D. ROPA Y REGALOS.
texts.en:
María Angélica, 52, has six children, two of whom are still minors and in her care. She has been a member of the “Unidos con Exito” (United with Success) group which has 9 additional members; all resiD. in Carabayllo and they elected her president. She has been a merchant for about 30 years and she takes advantage of trends to invest in her business, called “Gehova-Jire.” She started out selling clothing door-to-door and ambling along the market aisles. Gradually, her business grew and now she has a fixed stall; she also participates in large market events, too, especially when the school term starts. Her business has maD. it possible for her to roof her house and pay for her children’s schooling. Her next goal is to set up a large stationery-general store in her home. She will use the requested funds to buy clothing and gift items for Mother’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Kelly Jovanny

texts.es:
Kelly es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus menores hijos en el sector Alan García del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace mas de 4 años ella compró una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con unos ahorros que tenía. Actualmente alquila el vehículo a un chofer de la zona para que este brinde el servicio dentro de la localidad y en los caseríos que la rodean. Los ingresos que percibe constituyen una importante fuente de ayuda a la economía familiar.

El contínuo uso brindado a la unidad móvil y los caminos accidentados de la zona han hecho que su vehículo empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por este motivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.

Kelly es una mujer emprendedora y muy entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle una buena educación a sus hijos y asi ayudarlos a salir adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus coutas.
texts.en:
Kelly, 31, lives with her husband and children in the Alan García neighborhood of Olmos district, Lambayeque province, located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. A little over four years ago she used some savings she had to buy a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo). She currently leases it to a driver in the area so that he can provide transportation services within the locality and to surrounding settlements. The income she earns is an important source of family support. The continuous use of the vehicle along the rough roads in the area has brought about the urgent need for service and repairs in order for it to continue operating properly. For this reason, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa to request a 1000 new sol loan. Kelly is an enterprising woman who is very dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to provide a good education for her children and help them succeed in life. She has collaborated with our institution in the past and has shown responsibility and punctuality with respect to loan installment repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Luisa Mirelly

texts.es: La Sra. Luisa Mirelly S. E. de  33 años de edad, cuenta con  casa propia de material noble y adobe ubicada en la entrada los Coyotes de Santiago. Percibe remesas de España ya que su conyuge trabaja en Contrucción desde hace 3 años. Adicionalmente tiene otros ingresos laborando como obrera de campo desde hace 2 años. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Luisa Mirelly S. E., 33, owns her own home made of substantial materials located at Entrada Los Coyotes in Santiago. Her husband, who works as a construction worker in Spain, sends her monthly allotments; in addition, she has earned extra income working as a field hand for the last 2 years. She is an enterprising person who, thanks to her efforts, has acquired her assets. She needs financing in order to complete her house, which was damaged by the 2007 earthquake. Her dream is to complete the entire house so that she can attain a better standard of living. She is very grateful for the help we might provide through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 30 años, es una madre de familia muy responsable y amorosa, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Nilton de 30 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. La actividad a la que Elena se dedica es el cultivo de papa y arveja, desde entonces y casi todos los días por las mañanas, junto a su esposo, trabajan en las chacras, ya que sabe que mientras más cuidadosos sean con sus cultivos, mejores productos obtendrán en el momento de la cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, es por eso que lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, que es donde vende sus productos. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras, para extender sus cultivos y aumentar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En tanto que en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetada por sus compañeras. Con los tres mil soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, así como también comprará insecticidas.
texts.en:
Elena, 30, is a loving and responsible mother; she lives in a leased house with her husband, Nilton, 30, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a good education. Elena is a potato and pea farmer. She and her husband tend to their farmlands every day in the morning. They know that the more they care for their crops the better the sale price will be when they take their harvest to market. What she most enjoys about her work is planting, which she does very patiently; she’s been in this line of work for 14 years. She considers the most difficult part of it transporting the products to the city’s wholesale markets. In time, she hopes to buy more land in order to expand her crops and increase production. This is her 3rd loan with MFP; she knows she must be punctual with repayments if she wants to have access to future loans. Her fellow group members respect greatly because she’s a very responsible member. She will use the requested 3000 soles to buy more manure and fertilizers for her crops as well as to buy insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Esperanza X Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama esperanza x por que esperan mucho de si mismas, esta ubicado en la colonia arboledas de loma bella en el estado de Puebla en México el grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes.
Ana Isabel Vázquez peña es la presidenta del grupo tiene 39 años estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos (dos mujeres y un varón) ella se dedica a la venta de comida que inicio hace 5 años solicita el préstamo para la venta de la misma, sus clientes opinan que la señora tiene un buen sazón y trato agradable.
Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente bastante contenta quiere este crédito para invertir en sus negocio también espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
Lucia S. C. es otra integrante de este grupo tiene 41 años estudio hasta el 3 año de secundaria es casada y tiene dos hijos ambas mujeres, ella se dedica a las manualidades que inicio hace 4 años solicita el préstamo para comprar fieltro sus clientes en la mayoría mujeres la buscan muchas por sus artesanías al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente muy feliz quiere este préstamo para invertir en sus negocio también espera superarse con esta actividad.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son.
María Georgina Águila Hernández vende comida
Socorro C. S. vende comida
Beatriz Adriana T. T. vende  carteras y bolsas dama
Juana Rosa T. M. vende plásticos o toperware
Andrea Vázquez C. vende pan
Leticia Vázquez Sánchez perfumes originales
María  del Roció O. C. vende lencería
María Isabel Vázquez Peña vende comida
Paulina Martínez Vázquez vende pan
Laura Vázquez Peña vende calzado y blancos
texts.en:
This group calls itself Esperanza X (Hope X) because they expect much of themselves. They are located in the Arboledas de Loma Bella community in the state of Puebla. The group is composed of 11 members. Ana Isabel, the group's president, is 39 years old and studied through the 3rd year of secondary. She has 3 children (2 girls and a boy). She has sold meals for the past 5 years and is requesting a loan to advance her business. Her customers think she offers good flavors and agreeable treatment. As she solicits this loan she feels quite content and wants to invest the money in her business in hopes of improving her quality of life. Lucia is another member of this group. She is 41 years old and studied up to the 3rd year of secondary. She is married and has 2 girls. For the last 4 years she has dedicated herself to handicrafts. She requests a loan to buy felt. Her customers, in the majority women, frequently ask for it for their artisan work. She felt very happy upon requesting this loan to invest in her business. Also, she hoped to advance by means of this activity. The other members of the group are: María Georgina who sells meals Socorro who sells meals Beatriz Adriana who sells wallets & purses Juana Rosa who sells plastic items and tupperware Andrea who sells bread Leticia who sells original perfume María del Roció who sells dry goods María Isabel who sells meals Paulina who sells bread Laura who sells shoes and pillows

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: INVESTING IN THEIR BUSINESSES, INCLUDING PREPARING MEALS AND SELLING FELT

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia tiene 31 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y responsable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Aquiles de 32 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos para salir adelante. Desde muy pequeña ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una de las principales productoras de papa y arveja de su ciudad, en donde sus compradores van hacia allá para comprar sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, es por ello que lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos que llevan su producción. Con el paso del tiempo, desea comprarse un carro, en donde su esposo pueda realizar el trabajo de transportar sus productos con mayor tranquilidad. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, está muy segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy responsable. En tanto en su grupo comunal, es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la rendimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 31, is a loving and responsible mother; she lives in her own home with her husband, Aquiles, 32, and their three beloved children, who are the motivating force behind all her efforts to succeed. Since she was a little girl she worked the fields alongside her parents; as time has gone by, she has managed to buy her own farmlands and now she is one of the main potato and pea producers in her city. Buyers come to her to purchase her products. What she likes best about her work is tending her crops, a task she does lovingly. She has been in this line of work for 15 years and considers the most difficult part of it transporting the goods to market because it’s very difficult to find trucks willing to carry the heavy sacks. In time, she’d like to buy a car so that her husband can transport the products more easily. This is her 6th loan with MFP and she’s sure to be able to repay on time because she’s always been very responsible. She is a cheerful and cooperative group member. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy manure and fertilizers in order to improve crop yields.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: La Mariposa De Ocuituco Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA LA MARIPOSA DE OCUITUCO  PORQUE UNA DE LAS HIJAS DE LAS INTEGRANTES LE DICEN LA MARIPOSA Y TAMBIEN PORQUE SON DEL MUNICIPIO DE OCUITUCO  EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 11  PERSONAS. 
LA SEÑORA PETRA R. A. TIENE 45 AÑOS ESTUDIO LA PRIMARIA,  Y TUVO TRES  HIJOS VARONES SE DEDICA DESDE HACE 1 AÑO A LA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR ANAQUELES.
ELLA DICE SENTIR UN GRAN APOYO CON EL  CREDITO QUE SE LE HA OTORGADO, PUES LE VA AYUDAR A MEJORAR SU TIENDA.  EL PROYECTO QUE TIENE CON RESPECTO A SU NEGOCIO ES AMPLIAR SU LOCAL  Y CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE ESTO LE GENERE  CONSTRUIR UN RESPALDO FAMILIAR Y ECONOMICO PARA ELLA Y SUFAMILIA.
LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON:
GLORIA P. C.                VENDE POLLO
TERESA OBDULIA A. C.     VENDE PUERCOS
GUADALUPE E. M.           VENDE BECERROS
BLANCA ESTELA M. G.          VENDE RASPADOS
LUISA MARIA ROSANA C. C.     VENDE TORTILLAS
GILBERTA R. A.          VENDE TACOS
SOFIA A. C.                VENDE RASPADOS
ATALY D. C.                  VENDE TACOS
ROSALIA Y. S.                VENDE LECHE
PETRA R. A.             TIENDA DE ABARROTES
MARIA DE LOS ANGELES F. C.  VENDE BECERROS
texts.en:
This group is called “La Mariposa de Ocuituco” because they call one of the member’s daughters “mariposa” and they are from the town of Ocuituco in Morelos state. The group has 11 members. Petra R. A., 45, finished elementary school. She had three sons. She has had a grocery store for the past year. She is asking for funding to buy shelving. She claims to feel much supported by the loan she’s been granted because it will make it possible for her to improve her store. Her project, with respect to her business, is to expand her store and use the profits this generates to build a nest egg for herself and her family. The other group members are: GLORIA P. C.-Chicken vendor TERESA OBDULIA A. C.-Pork vendor GUADALUPE E. M.-Sells Calves BLANCA ESTELA M. G.-Sells raspados (shaved ice treats) LUISA MARIA ROSANA C. C. –Sells tortillas GILBERTA R. A.-Taco vendor SOFIA A. C.- Sells raspados ATALY D. C.-Taco vendor ROSALIA Y. S.-Sells milk PETRA R. A.-Grocery store MARIA DE LOS ANGELES F. C.- Sells Calves

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shelving.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Mrs. Margie G., a resident of Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur, is 36 years old and married with three children. She is a PDP_LP member. To make living, Margie has been operating a sawali-making (woven bamboo mats) business with her husband for more than two years, earning about 5000 a month. They can earn much higher during the summer season.

Margie joined PMPC to gain access to financial assistance and to help improve their living conditions. Having fully repaid her previous loan of 5000 from PMPC, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 7000 as additional capital for her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Rosalina's Group

texts.en:
Rosalina S., from the village of Lawis, is the 43-year-old leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalina, who is married to a train operator, owns a fishing boat which is operated by her neighbor. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rosalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. texts.en:
To supply additional income for her family, Elren would like to receive a loan to expand her retailing business.  With the loan, she will purchase inventory for her business, including detergent powder, dish washing liquid, fabric softener, perfumes, and other supplies.  She believes that offering a wide variety of products will attract loyal customers in the neighborhood and will generate good proceeds. 

A loving mother and member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Elren is grateful for access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Elren is hopeful that her business endeavor will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life that is far away from under the umbrella of poverty.

Rosita successfully repaid her previous loan of 14,000 from PMPC. She now has a new loan of 50,000 which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be the 8th cycle taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She palns to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan V. (pictured above), 51 and her husband, Mr. Korn Pho, 50, have been married since 1979 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Three of them married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker and the other two assist their parents in the farming business. They live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Kan and her husband are farmers. They grow rice and vegetables. Besides farming, she wants to create a new business raising a cow. She will be able to get extra income from selling a cow when it grows big enough. Hence, Kan is requesting her first loan of $400 to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Mrs. Norma L. is from Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 60 years old, widowed, with 2 children. To make living she operates her sari-sari store to have an income. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from her farm. She has operated her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 a month.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid her previous loan of 7,000 taken from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 which will be used to purchase additional items to be sold. This will be her 4th cycle of loans from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Felipa Tinaza Group

texts.en:
"Obey God's word and have faith," said Felipa T., a simple villager of Leron Buguey, Cagayan. She is 49 years old. Felipa is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Felipa T.'s Group.

Felipa is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felipa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Felipa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Virginia's Group

Virginia P. is from the village of Salimpuno, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Virginia is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virginia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector running a cassava plantation. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from the plantation. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional equipment for the plantation. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 30,200 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the plantation. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
