Benta has a clothes stall where she sells second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She is applying for her fourth loan after successfully repaying the previous one without any problems thus she has a good credit history. Her customers mainly consist of passersby and other business people. Benta normally buys the bales of clothes from the nearby market and is in need of new stock to enable her to meet her customers' demands. 

Her hope is to expand her business and use the profits she makes to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Monica Owino

texts.en:
Monica Owino O. is 48 years old and married to Michael Ouma. They have eight children: the eldest is Everlyne Auma who is 28 years old and the youngest is Yvonne who is 14 years old. They live in Oraba in Migori town. 

Monica sells both used and new clothes at her clothes stall and is known for bringing in the latest fashions. This is the fourth loan that she has had from KADET and she intends to use it to buy more stock to expand her business. The previous loans have enabled her to expand her business and to even improve her family's living standards. She has a good credit history as she has been repaying her loans well. Her customers mainly consist of other business people and passersby in Migori market.

Her hopes and dream are to expand her business and even start other subsidiary businesses.

loans.use: To buy more stock to expand her business

loans.name: Tabitha Juma

texts.en:
Tabitha Juma R. is 48 years old, married to Charles Olale, and they have four children. They live in the Oruba area in Migori town. 

Tabitha sells second-hand clothes in Migori market and has been in this business for the last 12 years. This will be the seventh loan that she has had from KADET. She intends to use the money to increase the stock in her business which includes men’s shirts and children’s clothes. Her clients are mainly people who come to shop at the market.

Her hope is to improve her business and even invest in other fields.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua Y. sells fresh tomatoes at Jukwa market. She has received senior high education and is single with five dependents. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills.

Afua has been selling fresh tomatoes for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy extra tomatoes and other vegetables which will serve as additional goods for sale. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to complete a building she has already started.

loans.use: To buy extra tomatoes and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more DVDs and VCDs

loans.name: Perlas Del Pedregal Group

texts.es:
PERLAS DEL PEDREGAL es un banco D. Emprendimiento formado en la zona del pedregal ubicado al sur D. la ciudad, esta compuesto por 11 socias que viven en la misma zona, por ser una zona alejada la mayoria D. sus habitantes se dedican a la crianza D. animales y otras actividades.

La Sra.Rosario es la presidenta del banco, casada  y trabaja en la cafeteria D. la universidad, y tiene como segunda actividad la venta D. artefactos a credito, actualmente vive con su esposo que es chofer D. una linea D. radio taxis y sus dos hijos que aun estan en etapa escolar, ella utilizara el prestamo para el incremento D. su capital D. trabajo y mejorar la condicion D. vida D. su familia.

tambien forma parte D. este grupo la Sra. Virginia es la tesorera D. Banco D. Emprendimiento, es casada y se dedica a labores D. casa como su actividad principal, pero ademas tiene otra actividad que es la D. artesania en tejidos D. mantas y otros, ella vive con su esposo que trabaja como carpintero realizando muebles, ambos tiene dos hijos D. los cuales solo dos van a la escuela. la meta D. la sra Virginia es la D. poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo en sus artesanias y dedicarse completamente a este oficio. 

Todas las socias son personas responsables que en muchos casos mantienen solas el hogar y trabajan duro para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. toda su familia, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Perlas del Pedregal” (Pearls of Pedregal) was established in the District of Pedregal, which is located to the south of the city. The group consists of eleven members who live in the same area. Since they live in remote areas, the majority of the local residents engage in raising animals and other activities.

Sra. Rosario is the Communal Bank president. She is married, works at a university cafeteria, and has a siD. business selling merchandise on credit. Rosario currently lives with her husband, who works as a chauffeur for a fleet of radio taxis, and her two children who attend school. She will use her loan to increase her operating capital and improve her family’s living conditions.

Another member of the group is Sra. Virginia, who serves as the Communal Bank treasurer. She is married and works as a homemaker as her primary activity. Virginia also has a business making hand woven blankets and other items. She lives with her husband, who is a carpenter and furniture maker, and their two children of whom one is of school age. Virginia’s goal is to increase her operating capital and dedicate herself full-time to her craft business.

All of the members are responsible individuals who are, in most cases, the sole provider for their households. They work hard to improve the quality of life for their families and are grateful to both Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional operating capital to buy merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Alice Auma

texts.en:
Alice O. is 42 years old and married to Elly O., a businessman. They live in Kisumu town and have five children, three boys and two girls.

Alice runs a wholesale trade in accessories and electronics at a bus terminus in Kisumu town. This is the first loan she has accessed through KADET to which she was introduced by a friend who is an existing KADET client. She wants to use the loan to buy more accessories and electronic parts to add to her stock. Her clients mainly consist of hawkers at the bus terminus (who sell items as they move from one place to another) and retail shops around Kisumu town.

She hopes to expand her business and open other shops and thus create job opportunities for the unemployed.

loans.use: To increase her stock of electronic parts and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more ice-cream to sell.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
Avelino es un padre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío La Rinconada, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y porcino, el cría ovejas y chivos para comercializarlos con los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donde viven, este negocio es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta actualmente por lo que trata de alimentar muy bien a sus animales para que estos tengan buena acogida por parte de sus compradores.

Avelino desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales pequeños para terminar de criarlos y venderlos, por eso se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Avelino es una persona muy entregada a su trabajo y que siempre vela por el progreso de su familia, su mayor anhelo es darles a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener un mejor futuro. En la imagen nos muestra los animales que comercializa.
texts.en:
Avelino is a 51 year old family man. He lives with his wife and children in the La Rinconada settlement in rural area of the Olmos district. It is in the Lambayeque province, which is two hours from the city of Chiclay. He has been raising and selling sheep and pigs for three years. He raises sheep and goats to sell to the businessmen who frequent the area where he lives. This business is the only source of income that he has. Therefore, he tries to feed his animals very well so that they are well received by his buyers. Avelino wishes to expand his business by purchasing more small animals. He will finish raising them and then sell them. That is why he has seen the need to ask Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan for 800 PEN. This will help him achieve his objective. Avelino is a person who is very devoted to his work, and he always watches out for his family. His biggest wish is to give his children the opportunity to have a better future. In the photo he is showing us the animals he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Mwitu

texts.en:
Mwitu J. is a 45-year-old married mother of five children. She operates a food kiosk in Bamburi, Mombasa and has been in the business now for two years.

Mwitu joined KADET recently and is accessing her first loan. She was introduced by a fellow member in the group. With this loan, Mwitu plans to set up a water kiosk in the area and to purchase foodstuffs for the kiosk. Her main customers are residents of the Bamburi area. She hopes to become a very successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To set up a water kiosk and to purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi A. sells palm oil and palm kernel oil at Jukwa market. She has not received any form of education. She is married to a blacksmith and helps her husband in paying for their accommodation and utility bills.

Asi’s loan will be used to buy extra gallons of palm oil to supply her customers who always purchase in large quantities. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy land.

loans.use: To buy extra gallons of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for his supermarket

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. is a 34-year-old father of one child. He is married to Grace Jumwa who is a housewife. Daniel is a farmer in Shanzu, Mombasa and rears dairy cattle. He has been in the business of selling milk to the area's residents for the last six years and his business is a success.

He was introduced to KADET by a group member and is now accessing his first loan. With the money he plans to buy a new calf from the same area. Daniel hopes to expand his farming business by increasing his cattle stock and believes that his business will be a success.

loans.use: To purchase a new calf

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old and the mother of five. She supplies books to primary schools. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Her biggest priority is assisting her husband in feeding their children and making sure their school fees are paid.

Mary joined LAPO four years ago. She is requesting a loan of 180,000 NGN to enable her to increase her inventory of books which she says will enable her get a discount and to also meet her customers' demands. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and to LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more books to sell

loans.name: Hazama

texts.en:
Hazama M. is aged 33 and is the married mother of three children. She sells clothes by moving from one place to another. She mainly distributes the clothes to friends and neighbors and later collects her money. 

She has been able to work well with friends and neighbors and her business is doing well. Hazama intends to purchase more clothes to sell to her friends. This is her first loan from KADET and she is optimistic that she will be able to repay well. She hopes to be a very successful businesswoman in life.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. sells fresh garden eggs (eggplant), tomatoes and peppers at Jukwa market. She has no formal educational background. She is divorced and lives with her six dependents. She is responsible for the general upkeep of the home.

Efua has been in the sale of vegetables for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more garden eggs and other vegetables for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her extended business to save to build a shop to keep her vegetables and to build a good table to sell on.

loans.use: To buy more garden eggs and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is divorced with six dependents. She has received junior high education. 

Ama sells garden eggs (eggplant) at Jukwa. She goes to the nearby villages to buy in bulk and puts the garden eggs in sacks to sell in the market. She uses the income she gets from the sale of garden eggs to provide food, clothing and shelter for her dependents.

Ama will use the loan to purchase extra garden eggs and slippers which are going to be an additional trade to invest in. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more garden eggs and slippers to sell

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa Rosa inicia su tercer ciclo con 19 socias.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de comidas, ropa, bebidas, abarrotes en general, frutas, cosméticos y servicios de cerrajería, transporte.
Como es el caso de la Señora Margot es la presidenta del Banco Comunal, Margot es soltera, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Margot se dedica a elaboración de tejidos en telar como caminos, sus productos los vende a un intermediario que exporta sus productos, Margot invertirá su préstamo en la compra de lana de oveja. Los sueños de Margot son tener una microempresa artesanal y que sus hijos sean mejores que ella, profesionales.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles haciendo un total de 12,450 soles.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa group began it's third cycle with 19 members. The members all participate in different businesses such as the sale of food, clothes, drinks, general groceries, fruits, cosmetics, and locksmith and transportation services.

Margot is the president of the group. She is single, is 35 years old, and has 3 children. Margot weaves fabrics, and sells her products to an intermediary who exports them. Margo will invest her first loan in the purchase of sheep's wool. Margot dreams of having a small artisanal business and that her sons will have better lives as working professionals.

The members need different loan amounts, of 300, 600, and 1050 Peruvian Soles, for a total of 12,450 Peruvian Soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep's wool

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
LA SRA. MARINA ESTA CASADA VIVE EN LA LOCALIDAD D. EL TORNO DISTANTE A 40 KM D. LA CIUDAD D. SANTA CRUZ, SU ACTIVIDAD ES LA VENTA D. ROPA D. FORMA AMBULANTE, SU ESPOSO TIENE LA OCUPACION CHOFER PROFESIONAL, EN LA LINEA D. TRANSPORTE EL TORNO - SANTA CRUZ, TIENE 3 HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SU DOMICILIO ESTA UBICADO EN EL BARRIO 6 D. MAYO, SU DESEO  ES PODER RECUPERAR SU CAPITAL YA QUE POR UNA ENFERMEDAD SE DESCAPITALIZO  Y REDUCIO SU CAPITAL A LA MITAD, YA QUE POR LOS GASTOS UTILIZADOS EN LA CURA, TRATAMIENTO Y SUS MEDICAMENTOS, YA QUE SU SALUD D. PRONTO SE DETERIORO,  Y TUVIERON QUE INTERVENIRLA QUIRURGICAMENTE, FUE DURO PARA ELLA PERO SE RECUPERO Y CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA.

POR TAL MOTIVO ELLA HA SOLICITADO A NUESTRA INSTITUCION , EL APOYO FINANCIERO PARA REPONERSE D. TAL PERCANCE.
 
LA SRA. MARINA ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Sra. Marina is married and lives in the town of El Torno, which is located 40km away from the city of Santa Cruz. She sells clothing as a street vendor. Her husband is a professional chauffeur who provides transportation services between El Torno and Santa Cruz. Marina has three school age children. Her home is located in the May 6th neighborhood.

Marina hopes to recoup her business losses after an illness wiped out half of her business capital, which was used to pay for treatment and medicines. Her health quickly deteriorated and required that she undergo immediate surgery. Now that she is better, she faces difficulty with her business and must rely on credit to acquire merchandise. For this reason, she has requested assistance from Emprender in order to secure financing that will help her recover from this mishap. Marina is extremely grateful to both Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Agriculture has from time immemorial been the backbone of Uganda’s economy. Different genres of agricultural activities have given many Ugandan families an improved lease of life. This story is connected to one particular individual in Bushenyi district, western Uganda, who goes by the name of T. Jackson.

This 50-year-old married gentleman has subsisted on his banana plantation for the last thirty-eight years. Though adverse weather conditions have constantly affected his gardens, he has managed to consolidate the gains he has made. As a result his family of seven have enjoyed the benefits. Principally, his children all now attend good institutions of higher learning.

Jackson gleefully reveals he makes close to or even more than 250,000 shillings a month from selling bananas. He is very upbeat that with this loan he will be in position to improve on the mulching and gardening aspects of his business.

loans.use: To pay for enhancements to his farm, principally improved mulching methods

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. is 56 years old and is married to Priscillar. He is in the business of selling bananas in the Kongowea market in Mombasa. He has been in this business for three years and the business is a big success. Most of his customers are retailers who purchase the bananas wholesale.

Peter joined KADET recently and this is his first loan. He plans to use all the money to increase his stock of bananas in order to meet the market demand. He hopes to expand his business further and diversify to other businesses in Mombasa.

loans.use: To increase the stock of bananas to sell

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío La Estancia, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de cinco años, actualmente siembra maracuyá, que es una fruta muy producida en la zona, los agricultores se han venido asociando y actualmente existen diversos fundos (extensiones de terrenos agrícolas colindantes pertenecientes a diversos agricultores) especializados en el cultivo de esta fruta, esta asociación les permite conseguir desarrollar su cultivo de una manera óptima para poder obtener productos de buena calidad, así como también conseguir vender sus cosechas en el mercado a un buen precio.

Elio desea aplicarle a su cultivo fertilizantes y riegos para que la producción sea de calidad, siguiendo este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maracuyá.

El es un hombre bastante responsable y entregado a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como productor agrícola y mejorar su calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Elio is a 34 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the village of La Estancia, a rural area of the Olmos district, which is in the Lambayeque province, two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has worked in the fields for the last 5 years. More specifically, he sows passion fruit, which is a very common fruit in the area. The farmers have been collaborating and there exist various estates (extensions of adjacent agricultural lands belonging to different farmers) specializing in the cultivation of this fruit. This association permits them to pursue the optimal cultivation of the fruits so they can obtain high-quality products and also sell their crops in the market at a good price.

Elio wishes to apply fertilizers to his crops and to irrigate them to obtain a higher quality. With this in mind, he has sought his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa (a Kiva partner) for 1500 Peruvian Soles which he will use in the maintenance of his passion fruit crops.

He is a responsible man and is committed to his work. His biggest wish is to continue growing as a farmer and to improve his quality of life. His neighbors and friends consider him a trust-worthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer and irrigation for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. sells garden eggs (eggplant), fresh peppers and palm oil at Jukwa. At the time of visit, she was yet to receive her palm oil consignment. Adwoa has received senior high education. She is divorced and has five dependents. She is responsible for the general upkeep of the home.

Adwoa has been selling palm oil and garden eggs for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy palm fruits to make palm oil in addition to her vegetables for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to provide a meaningful education for her dependents.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits to make palm oil in addition to her vegetables for sale

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 25 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Cesar de 30 años, quien trabaja con ella en la chacra, ambos tienen tres hijos, de las cuales procura brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Es así que trabaja arduamente, todos los días en sus cultivos, Nancy trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, es por eso que siembra semestralmente, con ayuda de su esposo,  habas, papas y arvejas, productos que logra venderlos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas, por lo que lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el mercado para comercializarlos, puesto que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Por el momento, solo espera mejorar su producción y así obtener mejores precios. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, y asegura que este aporte le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. Asimismo en su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los dos mil soles que  solicita, comprará 3 sacos de semillas de arveja, siendo un producto muy caro.
texts.en:
Nancy, 25, is a cheerful, hard-working young mother; she lives in her own house with her husband, Cesar, 30, who works the fields alongside her, and their three children for whom she hopes to provide a better quality of life. This is the reason behind her daily hard work in the fields. Nancy is trying to change her life for the better. She and her husband plant twice a year: broad beans, potatoes and peas, products that she sells in Tarma’s wholesale market because profits are highest there. What she likes best about her work is to keep her crops pest-free. She has been in this line of work for 7 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be transporting her product to market because the sacks are very heavy. She is hoping to improve production to obtain better prices. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she assures us that this funding will be very helpful for her to grow as a farmer. She is very participatory and cooperative with her communal group. She will use the requested 2000 soles to buy 3 sacks of pea seed, which is a very expensive product.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three sacks of pea seed.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua O. sells vegetables such as garden eggs (eggplant), tomatoes and other seasonal vegetables at Jukwa. She has received senior high education. She is married with four children and her husband is a vegetable farmer. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Afua’s loan will be used to buy more vegetables and other food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hajera

texts.en:
Hajera A. produces palm oil locally for sale at Jukwa. She has a junior-high educational background. She is married with three children and her husband is a driver. She supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

Hajera has been selling palm oil for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to make palm oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a store in which to keep her palm fruits.

To prepare her locally-made palm oil, Hajera buys her palm nuts, which consist of a fleshy covering around a central kernel, from farmers. She washes the nuts and boils them for about forty minutes until they are softened. She then places them into a big mortar and gently works them with a pestle to extract the juice from the pulp while not damaging the kernels. She filters the juice from the chaff (which is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fires) and boils the juice again. As it boils, the fresh oil floats to the surface where she scoops it into yet another pot and leaves it to cool.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruits to make palm oil to sell

loans.name: Las Solidarias Group

texts.es:
“Las Solidarias”  es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón  que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Exaltación”,  se agruparon hace poco por  la necesidad de acceder al préstamo ya que todas necesitan incrementar su capital de trabajo. Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de comida, pasteles, ropa y elaboración de pan.
Una de las integras es Gumercinda A. de 31 años , ella costura polleras  (faldas para mujer originaria), hace tiempo  con apoyo de sus familiares logró instalar un pequeño taller en su domicilio y necesita el préstamo para comprar teja de diferentes colores, porque estas polleras sulen ser bastante coloridas.

Liderizadas por la mesa directiva todas  se organizan para llevar
adelante su reunión y ponerse de acuerdo en el reglamento interno, ya que les permitirá un desembolvimiento adecuado en cada una de las reuniones de pago y capacitación.
texts.en:
Las Solidarias is a group of seven women and one man. They attend their meetings at the Exaltación Center. They got together a little while ago because they need a loan. All of them need to increase their working capital. They all have different businesses like selling food, pastries, clothes, and making bread. Gumercinda A., age 31, is one of the members. She makes “polleras” (skirts for indigenous women). In time, with help from her family, she was able to set up a small shop in her home. She needs the loan to buy different colors of fabric because these polleras are usually very colorful. All of the leaders on the board of directors organize themselves to move the meeting along and get agreement upon the internal rules. That allows for sufficient development at each one of the payment and training meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Kipailoi

texts.en:
Kipailoi L. is 43 years old. He is married to Naishuluni L. and is the father of six school-going children. Kipailoi is a farmer who farms his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last 10 years.

He learned about KADET from other members who are already registered as clients. This will be his first loan. He is planning to do large-scale farming for wheat which does very well in this area. With the profits, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land to plant more wheat and farm other agricultural products on a large scale. Kipailoi believes he is hard-working needing only the resources in order to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To do large-scale wheat farming

loans.name: Meriary Jakeline

texts.es:
Jakeline es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Jakeline es soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Jakeline tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende caña y bidones, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Jakeline necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de caña y bidones.
Los sueños de Jakeline son tener otra sucursal y que su hija estudie.
texts.en:
Jackeline is a member of the Santa Elena Communal Bank. Jakeline is 23, single, and she has one child. Jakeline has a store in a rented spot where she sells reeds and large cans. She does this everyday. Jakeline needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy reeds and large cans. Jakeline dreams of having another branch and that her daughter goes to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy reeds and large cans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cassava to make fufu to sell

loans.name: Everline Kashuru

texts.en:
Everline is a 26-year-old woman married to 30-year-old Mtawali with whom she has three children aged between 7 years and 10 months.

Everline’s business is selling food in the Kibaoni area in Malindi where she targets her customers, especially in the morning for breakfast. She also practices some farming on the side and sells makuti (traditional palm-leaf roofing). 

Everline earns a monthly profit of Ksh 5,000 from her business. She plans to utilize this loan by buying farm seeds and fertilizer with Ksh 10,000, Ksh 5,000 for food supplies like flour, Ksh 2,000 for charcoal and Ksh 3,000 sauce for fish.

Everline was introduced to KADET by an existing member and this is her second loan. She plans to buy a plot at Kibaoni center with the extra profits from this loan. Her dream is to be able to educate her children and invest for their future.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer plus supplies like flour, charcoal and sauce for fish

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Juana es casada, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Juana tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, leche y azúcar.
Los sueños D. Juana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the community bank Santa Elena. Juana is 53 years old and married with three children. Juana has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, vegetables and meat. She works there every day. Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles, money she will use to invest for the purchase of rice, milk, and sugar. Juana's dreams are that her children become professionals and she improves her health.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Karina Janett

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Karina es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Karina se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales, Karina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra los cereales, en algunas oportunidades vende útiles escolares.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, haba.
Los sueños de Karina son salir adelante y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the community bank Santa Elena. Karina is 28 years old. She has a live-in partner and two children. Karina buys and sells cereals. She travels to the different fairs in her region, where she buys cereals. Sometimes she sells school supplies. Karina needs a loan of 1050 soles, money she will use to invest for the purchase of wheat and beans. Karina dreams to get ahead in life and have her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wheat and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk to sell

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en:
Muniratu A. is married and has four children. Her husband is a mason and a farmer. She uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She has not received any form of education.

Muniratu makes palm oil for sale at Jukwa. This photo was taken on one of her busy moments making her palm oil. She will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to make palm oil for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, she plans to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to make palm oil to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Antonia es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Antonia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y arroz.
El sueño de Antonia es tener una sucursal.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the community bank Santa Elena. Antonia is 36 years old and married with three children. She has a store in her home where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and meat. She works there every day. Antonia needs a loan for 1050 soles, money she will use to purchase sugar and rice. Antonia's dream is to have her own office.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar and rice

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es socio del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Jose es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Jose tiene dos restaurantes que están ubicados en locales alquilados, Jose cuenta con el apoyo de personal que ayudan en la cocina y atención.
Jose necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de utensilios de cocina.
Los sueños de Jose son tener una cadena de restaurantes y una galería.
texts.en:
Jose is a member of the community bank Santa Elena. Jose is 44 years old. He has a live-in partner and three children. He has two restaurants located in rented spaces. Jose counts on the support of his staff who help in the kitchen and serving customers. Jose needs a loan for 1500 soles, money he will use for the purchase of kitchen utensils. Jose's dreams are to have his own chain of restaurants and a gallery.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying kitchen utensils

loans.name: Salomón

texts.es:
Salomón es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Angurucal del distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la comercialización de ganado caprino y ovino, el visita caseríos cercanos para comprar ovejas y chivos, los cuales engorda para luego venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona. Este negocio le brinda los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante y sostener la economía de su familia, por lo que trata siempre de mantenerlo con mucho esfuerzo.

Salomón desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para criarlos y venderlos. Siguiendo este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

El es un padre de familia bastante entregado a su trabajo y que siempre vela por el bienestar de los suyos. Su mayor enhelo es poder adquirir una motocarga (vehículo motorizado especializado en el transporte de carga) que le permita recorrer los caseríos de la zona y trasladar su mercadería con mayor facilidad ya que las distancias que tiene que cubrir son grandes y esto dificulta el desarrollo de su negocio
texts.en:
Salomón is a father of a family. He is 37 years old and lives together with his wife and children in the farmhouse Angurucal in the Olmos district, located in the Lambayeque province an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than three years, he has worked selling goat and sheep livestock. He visits local farms to buy sheep and goats, which he fattens to sell later to businessman visiting the zone. His business provides him the income he needs to get ahead in life and maintain his family economically, so he exerts a lot of effort in trying to maintain it. Salomón wants to grow his business by purchasing more animals to raise and sell. To do this, he realizes the necessity of asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first loan of 1000 nuevo soles. He is a father very devoted to his work and always watches over the welfare of his children. His biggest dream is to be able to get a "motocarga" (a motorized vehicle specialized for cargo transport), which will allow him to travel travel to area farms and move his merchandise with greater ease. The distances he has to cover are great, which makes growing his business difficult.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying lamb and goat livestock to increase his business

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
EL banco D. Emprendimiento GAVIOTAS es un Banco antiguo dentro D. la institucion cuenta con varias secuencias, esta formado por 13 socios 11 mujeres y 2 varones, son personas responsables que se conocen y se garantizan mutuamente.

El Sr. Jesus es el Presidente del banco D. Emprendimiento GAVIOTAS tiene como actividad la D. chofer propietario cuenta con un vehículo propio es taxi y pertenece a una red D. radiotaxis el trabaja todo el dia, esta casado y es es padre D. familia D. tres hijas que se encuentran en edad escolar el solo mantiene a su familia con los ingresos del taxi ya que su esposo se dedica a labores del hogar, el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra D. repuestos para su movilidad y la refeccion D. la misma. Es una persona responsable y trabajadora con muchas ganas D. superacion y desea mejorar la calidad D. vida D. toda su familia.

La señora Carmen es la secretaria D. Actas ella tiene una tienda D. barrio en la calle Tipuani D.  Villa Fatima es un lugar comercial ella mantiene sola a sus dos hijos D. edad escolar ya que esta separada D. su pareja y no le queda D. otra que la D. trabajar duro para sacar a su familia adelante, ya que no recibe ningun apoyo del Padre D. sus hijas,  y con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia para surtir su tienda.

El Sr Humberto es el Tesorero del banco el cuanta con una tienda D. celulares y hace tambien reparación y mantenimiento D. los mismos,esta casado y es padre D. dos hijos cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposa quien se dedica a labores D. casa, El Sr. Humberto es una persona responsable y trabajadora con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia en celulares.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que en muchos casos tienen que sacar a su familia adelante solas con ganas D. superacion y estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The “Gaviotas” Enterprise Bank has been part of the institution for a long time. It is maD. up of 13 members, 11 women and 2 gentlemen. They are responsible and proviD. mutual support for one another. Jesus serves as the bank president and drives a taxi during the day. He has his own vehicle and participates in a network of radio dispatched taxies. He is married and is the father of three school-aged daughters. He supports his family with his income as a taxi driver while his wife works as a homemaker. He will use the money from this loan to pay for repair parts and repairs to his vehicle. He is a very responsible person with a great desire to get ahead and improve his family’s quality of life. Carmen serves as the group’s secretary and runs a neighborhood store on Tipuani D. Villa Fatima street. This is a commercial zone. She is separated and she alone supports her two school-aged children. She has no alternative but to work hard in order to move her family ahead, since she doesn’t receive any help from her daughters’ father. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store. Humberto serves as the treasurer and has a cell phone store where he also repairs and maintains phones. He is married and is the father of two children. His wife is a homemaker. Humberto is a very responsible, hard working person. He will use the money from this loan to buy cellular accessories. All of the members have proven to be hard working and responsible, and in many cases must move their families ahead on their own. They are all very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in them in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs and inventory

loans.name: Estrellas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
Raquel Evelyn Faride E. A.  de 57 años  elabora chocolates  hace  3 años aproximadamente en su domicilio, es una actividad que le endulza la vida, indica. En esta oportunidad necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como el cacao, azúcar y colorantes insumos con los cuales prepara chocolates. 
Las demás integrantes de Estrellas del Mar también cuentan con diversos negocios de producción, servicio y comercio. Todas desean mejorar sus actividades económicas.
A la cabeza de su mesa directiva se organizan para llevar adelante su reunión y ponerse de acuerdo en el reglamento.
texts.en:
For approximately 3 years, Raquel Evelyn Faride E. A., age 57, has made chocolates in her home. She says it is a business that has sweetened her life. She needs the loan in order to buy the raw materials required to make chocolates, such as cacao, sugar, and food coloring.

The remaining members of the Estrellas del Mar (Starfish) group have various production, service, and retail businesses. All of them want to improve their earnings. Sitting at the directors’ table they carry out their meeting in accordance with their by-laws.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es:
Yaneth es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Elena.
Yaneth es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Yaneth tiene un vivero de plantas ornamentales, producto que vende en el parque ecológico, además Yaneth es docente y viene redactando libros.
Yaneth necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plantas de la ciudad de Lima.
Los sueños de Yaneth son implementar una imprenta y concluir con la redacción de sus textos.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a member of the communal bank Santa Elena. Yaneth is married, 36 years old, and has two children. She has a greenhouse for ornamental plants, which she sells in the nature park. In addition, she is a teacher and is writing books. She needs a loan of $750; the money will be invested in plants from the city of Lima. Her dreams are to open a publishing company and to finish writing her texts.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of plants from the city of Lima

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Mary Nataana

texts.en:
Mary Nataana T. is a 43-year-old widow and the mother of three school-going children. She is owns a piece of land which she has farmed for the last three years now.

Mary Nataana learned about KADET from other women who had already registered as members. This will be her first loan which she is planning to use to plant more maize which normally does well in her area due to the good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Mary Nataana’s dream is to do large-scale farming and become financially independent. Despite being a widow, she is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To plant more maize on a bigger piece of land

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua H. is married and lives with her two lovely children. Her husband is a driver. Akua uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the family. She has received junior high education.

Akua sells bags of salt at Jukwa. She will use the loan to purchase additional bags of salt to sell. With the new earnings from her expanded business, she plans to save to acquire a shop in the market to display her salt.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of salt to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa A. has been educated through junior high school. She is married and lives with her five dependents. Her husband is a farmer and Hawa helps him in the general welfare of the home.

Hawa sells a variety of soaps by moving from house to house in and around the vicinity of Jukwa. She will use the loan to purchase more soaps and soap powder (which is going to serve as an additional trade) to sell.

With the new profits from her extended business, Hawa plans to save to buy a shop that she can sell from.

loans.use: To purchase more soaps and soap powder to sell

loans.name: Koinet Ole

texts.en:
Koinet Ole N. is 29 years old. He is married to Nalotuesha N. and he is the father of one child aged 2 years. Koinet owns a piece of land that he has farmed for the last five years now.

Koinet learned about KADET from other members within his area who are already registered as clients. This will be his first loan. He is planning to plant more wheat on a bigger farm than the one he is currently farming because wheat has proved to do well in his area. With the profits he hopes to make, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

Koinet’s future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more wheat and other farm produce on a large scale.

Koinet believes he is hardworking and he only needs resources to attain his goals.

loans.use: To increase his wheat farming by hiring an extra piece of land

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector San Francisco de Senquelo, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de siete años al cultivo de maracuyá, en toda la zona de Olmos existen diversas asociaciones dedicadas exclusivamente al cultivo de este fruto, los agricultores forman fundos (extensiones agrícolas colindantes), estas asociaciones les permiten lograr una mejor calidad de los productos y venderlos a un buen precio en el mercado. 

Domingo desea aplicar fertilizantes y riegos a su cultivo para asegurarse una buena cosecha, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo.

El es una persona bastante responsable y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle estudios a sus hijos para que estos tengan un futuro prometedor. Sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Domingo is a fifty-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the San Francisco de Senquelo area, a rural area in the Olmos district, Lambayeque province, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. He has cultivated passion fruit for more than seven years. Throughout the Olmos area various associations are dedicated exclusively to the cultivation of this fruit. The growers form large groves of adjoining properites. These associations allow the growers to cultivate a better quality product and to sell their product in the market for a good price. Domingo wants to apply fertilizer and to water his grove to ensure a good harvest; therefore, he feels for the first time the need to request a loan of $700 from Edpyme Alternativa. The proceeds will help him maintain his grove. He is very responsible and dedicated to his family. His great desire is to enable his children to study, so that they have a bright future. His neighbors and acquaintances trust him and hold him in high esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Application of fertilizer and water to his grove of passion fruit

location.town: San Francisco de Senquelo - Olmos - Lambayeque

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana E. sells cooking oil in gallons and bigger containers at Jukwa. She is a widow and has four children. She is responsible for the welfare of her children. She has not received any form of education.

Nana has been selling cooking oil for some time now. Her loan will enable her buy her goods with cash instead of buying on credit to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy her goods with cash instead of buying on credit

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Reynaldo tiene 36 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Soledad de 26 años y sus tres queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor vida que la que él tuvo. En el poblado de Churupata, Provincia de Tarma, se encuentran las chacras de Reynaldo, siendo extensas tierras al cual le da el cuidado suficiente, actividad que tiene desde hace 25 años, convirtiendo sus campos de cultivo, mejor producidos del poblado, es por eso que cuando lleva a vender sus cosecha al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, obtiene muy buenos rentas, debido a la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, sin embargo considera que lo más difícil de esta labor, es cuidar los campos ya sembrados de plagas que afecten su producción. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar los productos que siembra. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, por lo espera continuar siendo puntual con sus pagos, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos que tiene su grupo. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará abono y fertilizantes para mejorar sus campos sembrados.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, age 36, is the very hardworking and responsible head of his family. He lives in his own house together with his 26 year old wife, Soledad, and their three dear children, whom he wants to offer a better life than he has had. Reynaldo has a farm with large fields that he takes care of in the settlement of Churupata, Tarma Province.

He has been a farmer for 25 years and has made his fields the most productive in his community. When he takes his harvest to the wholesale market in the city, he gets very good prices due to the quality of his produce.

What he likes most about his work is planting his land and making it productive. The most difficult part of his work his protecting the planted fields from diseases which affect his crops. In the future, he wants to buy more land in other communities in order to increase his production and vary the crops that he grows.

This is Reynaldo’s seventh loan with MFP, and he hopes to continue making his payments on time since he wants to obtain other loans in the future. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank and is always working towards consensus within the group. With the 1500 soles that he is applying for, he will buy fertilizer for improving his planted fields.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for improving his planted fields.

loans.name: Mi Amigo Jesus Group

texts.es:
Un grupo muy unido que  se emprenden en aéreas similares  de trabajo.
Simeón de 42 años de edad cuenta con un pequeño negocio que le permite contar con  ingresos  para su familia
Actualmente convive con la madre de sus 4 hijos de la cual el último hijo de 9 años aun depende de ellos.
Simeon comenzó a trabajar desde los 23 años  debido a la responsabilidad  de cuidar de su familia, como cobrador de micro en la ruta (Lima - Chosica) hasta los 32 años.
Con el cual le permitió acumular capital para la apertura de un pequeño Negocio de  venta de Caldo de Gallina, labor a la que se dedica desde hace 10 años junto a su esposa, empezó con 1 mesa y 2 sillas, y posteriormente fue mejorando en la implementación de su negocio el cual lo realiza de forma ambulatoria. 
Por intermedio de su cuñado se entero de los Beneficios que le brindaba EDAPROSPO, por lo cual decide  participar en este crédito grupal, Este primer prestamo le permitió adquirir   1 carpa, mesas y sillas.
El anhelo de Simeón es apoyar y mejorar la educación de su ultimo hijo de 9 años ya que sus otros tres hijos son mayors de edad y son independientes y  claro esta en brindar una adecuada atención a sus clientes
texts.en:
This is a very united group that engages in similar areas of work. Simeón is 42 years old. He has a small business that provides him with enough income to support his family. He currently lives with the mother of his four children. Their youngest child is 9 years old and still depends on them. Because of his responsibility to take care of his family, at age 23, Simeón began working as a bus conductor on the route from Lima - Chosica. He worked there until he was 32. His work as a bus drive helped him accumulate enough capital to open a small business selling chicken soup. He has done this for this the past ten years alongside his wife. He began with one table and two chairs. Later he began improving his business, which he does as a street vendor. Simeón found out about the benefits provided by EDAPROSPO through his brother-in-law, which is why Simeón decided to participate in his first group loan. This first loan allowed Simeón to purchase a tent, tables, and chairs. Simeón's greatest wish is to support and improve the education of his youngest 9 year-old son, now that his other three children are grown and independent. He can achieve this by giving appropriate attention to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in one tent, large benches, and large table

loans.name: Kanaf

texts.en:
Kanaf I. sells cereals such as beans, millet, soya beans and groundnuts (peanuts) at Jukwa market. She is without any educational background but is able to care for herself.

Kanaf is a widow and has been selling cereals and the like for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy other types of cereals which she doesn’t currently sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to complete a building her husband left behind for her.

loans.use: To buy other types of cereals which she doesn't currently sell

loans.name: María Anita

texts.es:
María Anita es una madre de familia de 36 años que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Calera Santa Rosa, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino desde hace mas de cinco años, ella cría ovejas y chivos para venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive. El negocio le brinda recursos económicos muy importantes para el sostenimiento de su familia por lo que trata de mantenerlo con el mayor esfuerzo posible.

María Anita desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para ampliar su negocio así como en la compra de su respectivo alimento balanceado, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen aparece junto al menor de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Anita is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and her two children in Calera Santa Rosa, a rural community in the Olmos district, in the Lambayeque province, two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For more than five years, Maria Anita has been growing sheep and goats and selling them to the merchants that visit the area where she lives. She does everything she can to sustain this business since it is a very important source of income for supporting her family. Maria Anita would like to expand her business by purchasing more animals; she also wants to buy appropriate feed that would provide a balanced diet for her livestock. For this reason, she approached Edpyme Alternativa to request her first loan in the amount of 1000 soles. This loan will help her to achieve her goals. Maria Anita is a woman who is very devoted to her family and her work. Her most earnest wish is to continue to grow as an entrepreneur so that she could provide a better quality of life for her family. In the photo, she is pictured with her younger son.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals and animal feed to expand livestock business and increase sales

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba Y. fries fish to sell at Jukwa. The fish are displayed in this wooden safe because of flies to prevent food poisoning. Aba has not received any form of education. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. She helps her husband with the general upkeep of their home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to save the new income from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of pea seed, manure, and insecticides

loans.name: New London Group

texts.en:
This group is named "New London" after the community in which the group members live. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This will be their first loan from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, members will be able to improve their businesses, make more sales and consequently improving their standard of living. They will be able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They'll also be able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Thus, they are requesting a loan of 500,000 leones each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

The leader of the group is Haja K.. Haja, 35 years old, was born in Matotoka village, about 8 miles away from Magburaka town. She is married to a miner and they have three children. For three years now, Haja has been selling shoes. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by buying shoes wholesale to add to her business. 

Attached to this photo is snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy shoes wholesale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married and has five dependants. She has received junior high education.  Ekua bakes bread and sells locally made porridge (made from millet) as well, within the locality of Jukwa. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses the income she generates from the sale of porridge to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ekua will use this loan to purchase more flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake larger quantities for people to sell for her. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake bread

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es:
“MARIA ELENA MOYANO”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  10 socios entusiastas y luchadores, quienes tienen por afinidad realizar actividades de comercio minorista, trabajan con  EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace 8 años.
Sonia asume el cargo de presidenta, a sus 43 años, es casada, tiene 1 hija de 23 años de edad, quien realiza estudios superiores.
Desde hace 18 años se dedica a la compra y venta de insumo textil (waipe, algodón, trapo industrial), se inicio en este negocio porque ella ayudaba a sus padres logro aprender y decidió independizarse, además en campaña navideña vende almanaques, calendarios, tarjetas personales, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado comprar una refrigeradora, cocina, cama y mejoro su calidad de vida, sus ingresos cubren el pago de servicios, y la educación de su hija. Poner una imprenta y estudiar diseño grafico es el gran sueño de Sonia,  el reciente préstamo será destinado a la compra de insumos (waipe, algodón, trapo industrial) para su negocio, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado de los inversionistas y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
“Maria Elena Moyano” is the name of a Communal Bank that consists of ten enthusiastic and determined members who manage small retail businesses. They have worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the past eight years.

Sonia was elected the Communal Bank president. She is 43 years old, married, and has a 23 year old daughter who is pursuing higher education. For 18 years, Sonia has been buying and selling textile supplies (fabric scraps, cotton, and industrial cloth). She decided to start this business because she wanted to help her parents, continue to learn, and become independent. During the Christmas season she sells almanacs, calendars, and greeting cards. The efforts of her daily labor enabled her to buy a refrigerator, a stove, and a bed so that she could improve her quality of life. Her income also covers her utilities and her daughter’s education. Sonia’s greatest wish is to open a printing and graphic design studio. Her current loan will be used to buy supplies (fabric scraps, cotton, and industrial cloth) for her business.

All of the members are grateful for the support that has been invested in them. Therefore, they promise to complete their payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric scraps, cotton, and industrial cloth

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama C. sells cooking pots and utensils in Jukwa. She is divorced and has two children. She has received junior high education. Ama is responsible for feeding, clothing and providing a better education for her children. Her loan will be added to her own capital to buy various types of utensils for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To buy various types of utensils for sale

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “SOL NACIENTE”, está conformada por 10 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes tienen por afinidad dedicarse al comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desde hace 13 años.
Nilda es una socia del grupo comunal y a su vez asume el cargo de presidenta, tiene 37 años, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 13, y 19 años, se dedica a la venta de queso, carne, trucha (desde hace 15 años) y además trabaja como cobradora en una empresa de transporte, (desde hace 7 años), se inicio en este negocio por la necesidad que había en su hogar, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado la construcción de su vivienda de material noble.
El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido en la compra de mercadería, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos respectivos.
texts.en:
The “SOL NACIENTE” (Rising Sun) communal bank is composed of 10 enthusiastic, enterprising members who are retailers; they have collaborated with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the past 13 years. Nilda is a group member and also acts as group president. She is 37 years old and a single mother of two children, a 13-year-old and a 19-year-old. She has sold cheese, meat and trout for 15 years; she’s also employed as a bill collector for a transportation firm (for the past 7 years). She started her business to meet household financial needs; through her daily efforts she has managed to build her home with substantial materials. This recently granted loan will be used to buy merchandise. All the members are grateful for the help provided and pledge to repay their respective installments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua N. goes from house to house selling palm oil which she makes herself in Jukwa. She has seven dependants. She is responsible for the well-being of her dependants. Akua has received junior high education. Her husband is a farmer. Akua has been selling palm oil for about four years now. Her loan will be used to buy extra palm fruits to make palm oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a plot of land for a family house.

loans.use: To buy extra palm fruits to make palm oil for sale

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2ans et demi et a de belles performances avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, son crédit lui permettra d'acheter deux bœufs, de les engraisser pendant 4 à 5 mois et de les revendre dans le marché hebdomadaire de sa localité. Les profits générés par son activité lui permettent participer aux différents besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Marie is 60 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” for 2 ½ years and has had good experiences with credit loans. She fattens cattle, and her loan will enable her to buy two oxen, to fatten them for four-five months, and resell them at the local weekly market. The profits generated by her activity will enable her to participate in meeting various family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pair of oxen for fattening

loans.name: Yessenia Maria

texts.es:
doña Yessenia E. tiene 30 años de edad, vive en el kilometro 8 carretera a Guasaule, aldea el Jacalito Choluteca.
Yessenia se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, las cuales las elabora en su casa de habitacion.
Yessenia es madre de 2 hijos los cuales tienen 2 y 4 años de edad.
Yessenia es bien dedicada a su familia, todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para elaborar sus ricas tortillas luego salir a venderlas a sus vecinos.
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de sus tortillas, necesita incrementar sus ventas, las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de sus hijos y del hogar.
texts.en:
Yessenia E., 30, lives near the 8 kilometer marker along the Guasaule highway in a village called, Jacalito Choluteca. She sells tortillas that she manufactures at home. She has two children who are 2 and 4 years of age. Yessenia is dedicated to her family; she rises every day at 5am to make her delicious tortillas in order to go out and sell them among her neighbors. She will use the funds to buy more ingredients for tortilla making because she needs to increase her sales; she needs the profits to cover her children’s and her home’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, lime powder, corn and water.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mously

texts.fr: Mously N. est âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Ses 7 ans et demi d'existence dans le Banc Villageois de DANKH-SENE lui on permis d'avoir une bonne expérience en matière de crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, avec son prêt elle achète deux bœufs qu'elle engraisse pendant 4 ou 5 mois et revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
texts.en:
Mously N. is 36 years old, married and the mother of five children. After 7 ½ years in the DANKH-SENE “Banc Villageois” loan group, she has acquired a solid experience in credit loans. She fattens cattle, and with this loan intends to buy two oxen for fattening during 4-5 months, after which they will be resold in local markets.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce and promote her cattle-fattening activity

loans.name: Delmy Jaquelina

texts.es:
la sra. Delmy Jaquelina P. B. tiene 43 años de edad, vive en la colonia el Barquito en la ciudad de Choluteca. Delmy se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, baleadas, tortillas con quesillo etc. tambien vende refrescos, jugos y agua en bote y en bolsa.
dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco cada dia.
el prestamo lo va a utilizar para comprar materia prima para hacer las golosinas, comprar refrescos, jugos y agua. una de las cosas que mas vende son los refrescos ya que Choluteca es una ciudad muy caliente y muchas personas compran refrescos para saciar la sed.
las ganancias que obtenga las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Delmy Jaquelina P. B., 43, lives in Choluteca’s El Barquito neighborhood; she sells snacks like tacos, enchiladas, baleadas (wheat flour tortilla, often quite thick, folded in half and filled with mashed fried beans), tortillas with quesillo (a cottage cheese-like cheese), etc. She also sells soft-drinks, juices, water in cans and plastic bags. She states that she is very happy because her business grows a little every day. She will use the funds to buy ingredients to make the snacks as well as soft-drinks, juices and water. One of her highest-selling items is the soft-drinks because the weather in Choluteca is very warm and many people buy soft-drinks to quench their thirst. Profits obtained will be used to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, juices, water, tortillas, beans, quesillo (similar to cottage cheese), lard, cooking oil, salt, spices, meats, cheeses, potatoes and vegetables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
“SANTA ANA”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  10 miembros entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes tienen por afinidad realizar actividades de comercio minorista, trabajan con  EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace 4 años.
Rosario Del Pilar asume el cargo de presidenta, a sus 39 años, es casada, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar.
Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, se inicio en este negocio porque a los 29 años, dejo su tierra natal, ya que Rosario es del norte del país y no contaba con un trabajo, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado la educación de su hija y siempre ha apoyado a su familia, sus ingresos cubren los gastos de alimentación, ropa y pensión del colegio. El gran sueño de Rosario es tener su propio puesto en el mercado, el  reciente préstamo será destinado para la compra de mercadería de su negocio, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado de los inversionistas y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
"Santa Ana" is a communal bank made up of 10 enthusiastic and empresarial members, who have in common their minor commerce activities. They have worked with EDAPROSPO Prosperidad for 4 years. Rosario del Pilar assumes the role of President, and at 39 years old is married with 1 school-aged child. For 10 years she has sold clothes. She began this business because, at 29, she left the land of her birth and moved to the north of the country without having a job. With the force of her work she has managed to educate her daughter and her always supported her family. Her earnings cover the food costs, clothes, and school fees. Rosario's big dream is to have her own stall in the market. This loan is destined for the purchase of clothing for her business. All of our members are thankful for the support given by the investors and promise to pay within the agreed terms.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: Fidel, de 43 años, vive en su casa propia en  compañía de su conviviente y de sus 3 menores hijos. Desde muy joven ayudaba a sus padres en el cultivo de frutos, puesto que vivía con ellos en la selva, en donde estudio agropecuaria, aprendiendo todas las técnicas necesarias para sembrar  en esa parte del Perú. Cuando formo su familia no dudo en continuar trabajando en lo que mejor sabía hacer, la agricultura, que era su pasión. Desde entonces, se dedica a la siembra de carambolas (fruto selvático, con él se preparan jugos), por lo que manifiesta que le gusta mucho este trabajo porque le genera regulares ganancias, permitiéndole mantener a su familia, además le agrada el olor que despiden los frutos. Aunque por lo general siembra solo, cuando la producción aumenta contrata algunos peones para que lo ayuden a limpiar y preparar la tierra. Es por eso que ha planeado aumentar su producción para vender en mayor cantidad y empezar a sembrar plátanos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hacen posible que éste aporte le permita continuar trabajando. Tiene pensado invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de fertilizantes para mejorar la producción de sus futuras cosechas de carambolas.
texts.en:
Fidel is 43 years old and lives in his own house together with his partner and 3 small children. Since he was very young he helped his parents to cultivate fruit, as he lived with them in the jungle where he studied agriculture, learning all the necessary techniques to grow crops in that part of Peru. When Fidel started his own family he didn't doubt to continue working in what he knew best, agriculture, which was his passion. Since then he has worked cultivating star fruit (a jungle fruit, which is used to prepare juice), and he likes this job very much as it gives him good earnings, permitting him to maintain his family. He also likes the smell that the fruit omits. Although normally he sows by himself, when the production increases Fidel contracts several workers who help him clean and prepare the soil. He has planned to increase his production to sell a greater quantity of fruit and begin sowing plantains. This is his sixth loan with MFP, and he is very thankful to all the people that made possible the support for him to continue working. He is thinking of investing this loan in purchasing fertilisers to improve the production of his future star fruit crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Teresa del Carmen C. tiene 63 años de edad, vive en El Banquito, El Corpus Choluteca. Teresa se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia que esta ubicada en su casa de habitacion.
Teresa es una persona de edad y esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio y asi poder surtirla ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son bastantes.
las ganancias las ocupara para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio es estable.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen C. is 63 years old and lives in El Banquito, El Corpus Choluteca. She works selling popular consumables, and has a grocery store located in he house. Teresa is an older person and this is her only source of income. The loan will be used to purchase more merchandise for her business to stock it as the demands of her customers are quite high. The earnings she gets cover the household costs. Teresa tells us that she feels very happy now that her business is stable.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase batteries, juice, soaps, oil, butter and other grocery items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
don Jose G. tiene 66 años de edad, se a dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a la fabricacion y venta de muebles de madera en la comunidad de San Marcos de Colon y en otras ciudades del pais.
Jose es una persona que trabaja todos los dias, el y su esposa son personas muy queridas por sus vecinos. En su negocio lo que mas vende son puertas, ventanas, gabinetes de cocina, mesas y sillas.
actualmente tiene una persona aprendiendo y desea que mas jovenes aprendan el oficio.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de sus muebles. las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
José G., 66, has spent most of his life manufacturing wood furniture in San Marcos de Colon and other cities around the country. Jose is a person who works every day; he and his wife are very well-loved by their neighbors. What he sells most are doors, windows, kitchen cabinets, tables and chairs. He currently has an apprentice and he would like more young people to learn the occupation. He will use the funds to buy more furniture-making materials and supplies; he needs the profits to meet household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, paint, varnish, sandpaper, adhesive, nails.

loans.name: Rosita Yasely

texts.es:
Rosita tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Insculas, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de prendas de vestir, ella adquiere su mercadería con frecuencia en la ciudad de Chiclayo y la comercializa entre sus vecinos, este negocio tiene acogida en la zona ya que queda alejada de la ciudad de Chiclayo y no tienen acceso a prendas de vestir baratas. Rosita nos comenta que inició el negocio llevada por la necesidad de obtener una fuente permanente de ingresos que le permita solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a la economía de su familia.

El negocio goza de buena acogida entre los vecinos de la zona y ella piensa ampliarlo, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más ropa para ofrecérsela a sus clientes.

Rosita es una joven trabajadora y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder percibir mas ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Rosita, 24, is single and lives with her parents in Insculas, a rural area of Olmos, Lambayeque province, which is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. She has sold clothing for the last year; she buys her merchandise frequently in Chiclayo and sells to her neighbors.
