Her business has been well-received because the area is far from the city of Chiclayo and they don’t have easy access to low cost clothing. Rosita tells us that she started the business because she needed to have a permanent source of income in order to meet her personal expenses and contribute to her family’s support. Her business is well-received among her neighbors in the area and she plans to expand it. This has led her to approach Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 1000 new sol loan to buy more stock merchandise. Rosita is a hard-working, responsible young woman; her greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businesswoman in order to earn higher income and provide her family with improved quality of life. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing.

loans.name: Joisy

texts.es:
Joisy tiene 18 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 5 hermanos. Desde muy pequeña, aprendió todas las técnicas necesarias para preparar y fertilizar la tierra, observaba como sus padres sembraban con mucha dedicación. Ya cuando creció, lo aprendido le sirvió para trabajar en búsqueda de progreso. Es entonces que hace 3 años se dedica a la siembra de papa (tubérculo peruano), en esta labor cuenta con la ayuda de  sus hermanos, y según manifiesta, le gusta mucho este trabajo porque pone en prácticas su experiencia y con su esfuerzo obtiene productivas cosechas, que recoge orgullosa de sus campos para luego venderlos a los mercados mayoristas de su ciudad. Mas adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y aumentar así  sus  ganancias. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que han hecho posible que éste aporte le permita continuar trabajando, además considera que el trabajo dentro de su grupo comunal es muy organizado y solidario, pues todos los integrantes son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.
Joisy tiene pensado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de semillas de arveja y fertilizantes para asegurar una buena siembra.
texts.en:
Joisy, 18, lives in her own home with her 5 siblings. As a very young girl she learned all the skills to prepare and fertilize soil for planting; she would watch her parents carefully. Once grown, she has been able to use her learned skills to work toward progress. For the last three years, then, she has farmed potatoes (Peruvian tuber). Her siblings help her with this work and she states that she enjoys her work very much because she puts her experience to practice and her efforts lead to productive crops that she very proudly harvests to sell to wholesalers in the city. Later on she plans to plant greater amounts so that her profits will increase. This is her 3rd loan with MFP; she is very grateful to all the people that have made this possible because these contributions allow her to continue to work. She also considers that the work within her communal bank is organized and unified because all the members are very responsible when it comes to repaying their loan installments. Joisy will use the requested funds to buy pea seed and fertilizers to insure a good crop yield.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yochira Patricia

texts.es: Yochira es una joven de 31 años de edad, soltera, vive junto a sus padres en el barrio Villa Reconciliación. Con el apoyo de sus padre logro culminar sus estudios, desde hace tres año logro ubicarse en una institución como contadora de proyectos, en donde ahora cubre sus gastos, esta dando parte de su dinero a su mama. También ha comenzado hacer las mejoras necesarias de su casa. La cocina que tiene el techo en mal estado, reforzar una ventana de verjas que solo esta pegada y desea anclarla bien a la pared para que quede reforzada bien, para mejor seguridad contra la delincuencia. Comprara zinc nuevo, perlinez, golosos y soldadura para comenzar hacer la obra. Sus planes es poder sacar una maestría para lograr un mejor nivel de trabajo en donde pueda desarrollarse mejor como mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Yochira, age 31, is single and lives with her parents in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. With the support of her parents, she succeeded in completing her studies. For three years she has worked in a business as a project accountant. Her earnings now cover her expenses, and she gives a portion of her money to her mother.

She has also begun to make necessary improvements to their house. The kitchen roof is in a bad state. The iron grating over the window is held in place only with glue, and she wants to anchor it to the wall for greater security against crime. She will buy corrugated roofing material, purlins, beams and solder in order to begin the work. Her plan is to obtain a Master’s degree so that she can get a better job which allows her to advance herself and earn a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, purlins, beams and solder in order to fix the kitchen roof,  which is in poor condition.

loans.name: Douglas Felipe

texts.es:
el sr. Douglas Felipe M. es un tipico San Marqueño como comunmente se les conoce, trabajador y muy amable.
Douglas se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de botas baqueras, las que son bien aceptadas en la zona y las cuales 
tambien vende en otras ciudades del pais.
tiene 43 años de edad y 23 años de dedicarce a este tipo de actividad, el que asegura hace con mucho gusto.
es padre de 2 hijos que estan estudiando.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materia prima asi como algunas herramientas para su taller.
texts.en:
Douglas Felipe M. is a typical San Marqueño (someone from San Marcos), as they are commonly known: very hard-working and kind. He makes and sells cowboy boots which are very well received in his area and which he also sells in other cities throughout the country. He is 43 years old and has been in this line of work for 23 years; he tells us that he enjoys his work very much and does it quite happily. He has two children who are students. He will use the funds to buy raw materials as well as some tools for his workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather, polish, brushes, thread, sponges and tools.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El Sr. Adrian  es  de Chuquisaca (sucre capital de Bolivia) nacio el 8 de septiembre de 1962 trabaja y vive en la junta pirai a 3 km de el torno, esta casado con doña margarita y tiene 5 hijos algunos mayores de edad y otros que se encuentran en edad escolar, trabaja junto a su esposa y sus hijos ellos se dedican a la agricultura le ayudan en la siembra de muchos productos como papa, yuca, cebolla, etc. cosechan los productos y despues lo comercializan en el mercado de la Zona donde les va muy bien en la venta de sus productos, Con el dinero del  credito comprara semillas para la la siembra de Papa ya que es temporada de siembra, el Sr. Adrian trabaja con la institucion de EMPRENDER  hace 3 años y esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Adrian is from Chuquisaca (the constitutional capital of Bolivia). He was born on September 8, 1962 and lives in the “Junta” area, 3 km from El Torno. He is married to Margarita and they have five children, some adult and some school-aged. He, his wife, and children work as farmers. They raise many crops, including potatoes, yucca, onions, etc. After harvesting their crops, they sell them in the zone marketplace, where sales are good. They will use the money from this loan to buy potato seeds, now that it is planting season. Adrian has been working with Emprender for the past 3 years. He is grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have place in him is helping him obtain this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farm supplies and seed

loans.name: María Gaby

texts.es:
María Gaby tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Insculas, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de un año a la comercialización de carne de animales: ella cría animales menores y aves de corral en su vivienda, los engorda, y cuando ya han alcanzado su desarrollo optimo, los sacrifica para luego vender su carne por kilos entre sus vecinos; el negocio es de mucha utilidad para sus vecinos ya que la zona en la que vive queda alejada de la ciudad y ellos no cuentan con los suficientes recursos para movilizarse hacia allá todos los dias.

Este negocio también es de ayuda para su familia ya que con los ingresos que percibe apoya al sostenimiento familiar. María Gaby desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para criarlos y venderlos, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

María Gaby es una joven bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es incrementar su nivel de ventas y hacerse más conocida en la zona. Ella es muy estimada por sus vecinos y clientes, los que la consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
María Gaby is 27, single, and lives with her parents in the Insculas area, a rural district of Olmos, in Lambayeque province, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than a year she has been working selling meat. She raises young animals and birds in the yard by her house. She fattens them, and when they have reached their optimal size, she slaughters them so that she can then sell the meat by kilo to her neighbors. Her business is very useful to her neighbors since the area where they live is away from the city and they don’t have enough reason to go there every day. This business also helps her family since her earnings are a support for her family. María Gaby wants to enlarge her business by buying more animals to raise and sell. That is why she is asking for a loan for the first time from Edypme Alternativa of 1000 sols. María Gaby is a hardworking woman who is close to her family. He biggest goal is to develop the level of sales and to become better known in the area. She is very respected by the neighbors and customers-they see her as a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals to raise to sell the meat

loans.name: Jorge Aquiles

texts.es:
el sr. Jorge Aquiles S. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Flor de Mayo, San Marcos Choluteca. Jorge se dedica a la venta de productos de uso domestico como ser estufas de dos hornillas, termos para cafe, ropa para cama y platos. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia ya que estos productos se venden rapido pero como vende al credito le cuesta recuperar el dinero en dos meses o mas. necesita comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener productos todos los meses que vender.
texts.en:
Jorge Aquiles S., 37, lives in San Marcos’ Flor de Mayo neighborhood, Choluteca. He sells products for the home like: two-burner stoves, thermoses for coffee, bed linens and dishes. He will use the funds to buy more merchandise because his products sell quickly. However, because he sells on credit, it takes him two or more months to recover his investment and he needs funds now to buy more stock so that he can have items to sell every month.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two-burner stoves, thermoses for coffee, bed linens and plates.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bernarda Del Carmen

texts.es:
doña Bernarda P. es muy conocida en su comunidad y es un ejemplo para su familia. Tiene 58 años de edad, esta viuda y tuvo 9 hijos de los cuales ya todos estan adultos, casados y en sus respectivos hogares.
desde hace 23 años se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de las marcas avon, jackelin karol entre otras.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar cosmeticos de otras marcas que los clientes le estan solicitando, en la actualidad con las compañias que trabaja le dan credito de un mes, pero ya con las nuevas que quiere ingresar tiene que comprar de contado. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Bernarda P. is well-known in her neighborhood and an example for her family. She is 58 years old, widowed and has 9 children who are all adults, married and living in their own homes. She has sold Avon, Jackelin, Karol cosmetics, among others, for the last 23 years. She will use the funds to buy other brands of cosmetics that her customers are asking for. The companies she works with now give her one month credit but the new ones she wants to start working with insist on cash. She needs the profits from her sales to meet household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams, lotions, perfume, deodorant, nail polish, lipstick and eye liner.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Velinda Silvia

texts.es: El negocio D. L. Sra Velinda es por temporadas entre los meses D. Enero y abril venD. frutas con su cuñada en un puesto que ellas alquilan, y entre los meses D. abril y julio se dedican a L. venta D. carne D. res que traen desD. provincias del Perú, ElL. nos comenta que así obtiene mayores ingresos, Velinda tiene como meta adquirir un puesto propio y ofrecer diferentes productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Velinda’s business is seasonal. In January and April, she sells fruit with her sister-in-law in a leased stand. From April to July they sell beef that they bring from the provinces of Perú. She comments that this provides higher earnings. Velinda’s goal is to acquire her own stand and offer the various products that her customers request.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and guano to improve potato production.

loans.name: Mario Antolino

texts.es:
el Sr. Mario Antolino Z. tiene 58 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Puente salida hacia Arenales, Trojes El Paraiso. Mario se dedica a la venta y compra de leña tambien vende materiales de construccion. tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
el credito lo utilizara para la reparacion de su pick up, vehiculo que nesecita para el acarreo de madera 
y materiales,  neceseta repararle el motor ya que este carro es el alma de su trabajo.  
Según nos comento se siente bien satisfecho con su negocio.
texts.en:
Mario Antolino Z., 58, lives in the neighborhood near the exit bridge to Arenales in Trojes, El Paraiso. He is a firewood merchant and also sells building materials and supplies; he’s been in this line of work of over 10 years. He will use the funds to repair his pick-up truck that he uses to haul wood and supplies; he needs to repair the motor because the truck is the soul of his work. He stated that he is very content with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy engine replacement parts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
el sr. Andres C. U. se dedica  a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia negocio en el cual vende abarrotería, mismo opera bajo el nombre de pulpería "Las Colinas " 
rubro que mas resalta en nuestra sociedad, el es casado tiene 1 hijo que depende de El.
Su negocio lo atiende personalmente y cuando sale a comprar granos basicos se lo atiende su esposa ya que juntos se apoyan mutuamente,  gracias a la buena administracion su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco todos los dias.
Su clientela se siente bien satisfecha y Andres se siente agradecido por el apoyo que varias personas le han dado, el crecimiento de su negocio a sido de gran provecho para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Andres C. U. sells popular consumer products. He has a grocery store, a common line of work in this society, which is named "Las Colinas." He is married and has one dependent child. He attends to his business personally, and when he leaves to buy staple grains his wife attends to the store, since they both support each other. Thanks to good management his business has grown gradually over time. His customers are very satisfied, and Andres feels grateful for the support that various people have given him. The growth of his business has been a great benefit for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy butter, sugar, soap, toilet paper, coffee, soft drinks, pastas, sauces, chicken, eggs, soups, salt, crackers, corn and wheat flour, margarine, cooking oil, beans and tortillas

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther Clotilde

texts.es:
Esther tiene 33 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Insculas, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de abarrotes y golosinas en una pequeña bodega instalada en su vivienda desde hace mas de tres años, el negocio nació de la necesidad de agenciarse de un ingreso adicional que le permita ayudar al sostenimiento familiar, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero agrícola y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar la economía familiar.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más abarrotes para captar más clientes y así aumentar sus ingresos, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Esther es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que siempre vela por el progreso y bienestar de los suyos, su mayor anhelo es aumentar su negocio y hacerse mas conocida en la zona. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Esther, 33, is single and lives with her parents in Insculas, a rural area of Olmos, Lambayeque province which is two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She has had a small grocery in her home for over three years now. The business grew out of her need to have additional income to help support the family because her husband works as a field hand and his earnings are insufficient to cover family expenses. She wants to expand her business buying more groceries to attract more customers so that her income will increase. This has led her to approach Edpyme Alternativa to request a 1500 new sol loan to help her reach this goal. Esther is quite hard-working and she’s always looking to make progress and provide for the wellbeing of her loved ones. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and become better known in the area. She has collaborated in the past with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with her repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es:
la sra. Norma Elena C. R. Se dedica al comercio, cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, calzado y fantasia fina,  actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace mas de 3 años, es madre de familia, tiene 1 hijo.
Con los ingresos que le genera su negocio, le permite suplir algunos gastos personales y de su hijo, de esta forma 
contribuye en el hogar a su esposo ya que en estos tiempos si se desea salir adelante se tiene que esforzarse y trabajar el hombre y la mujer, echarle para adelante.
El credito lo utilizara para comprar mas ropa, calzado y joyeria.
texts.en:
Norma Elena C. R. is a retailer; she has a small clothing, shoes and fine costume jewelry sales business. She has been in this line of work for over 3 years. Norma is the mother of a son. Earnings from her business make it possible for her to meet some personal expenses as well as those of her son. In this way, she adds to her husband’s contribution to family expenses because nowadays, to get ahead, both husband and wife have to work. She will use the funds to buy more clothing, shoes and jewelry.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and costume jewelry.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma Teofila

texts.es: Norma vende postres como: mazamorra de maíz, arroz con leche y otros dulces en la vía publica al lado de una tienda por donde ella reside, empezó este negocio hace muchos años para solventar los gastos de su familia, además vende comida como: pollo frito cuando lo solicitan sus clientes, su objetivo lograr la  apertura de una tienda y vender por las noches salchipapas y hamburguesas, todo esto le traerá mejores ganancias. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de  productos que le hacen falta para la preparación de la comida que vende.
texts.en:
Norma sells desserts such as corn pudding, arroz con leche (a rice dessert) and other sweets on a public road at the side of a store near her home. She started this business many years ago to pay for family expenses. In addition, she sells food such as fried chicken when requested by her customers. Her goal is to open a store where she can sell salchipapas (a meal including sausage and fried potatoes) and hamburgers in the evenings. This would bring her better earnings. She will use this loan to buy products that she needs to prepare the food that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food-selling business

loans.name: José Adrian

texts.es:
José tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en el sector La Pilca, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de siete años a la comercialización de ganado vacuno, el cría ganado para luego venderlo a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Este negocio le provee los recursos que necesita para sostener a su familia por lo que siempre da todo de si para mantenerlo y salir adelante.

José desea mejorar la calidad de crianza de sus animales para obtener mas ingresos al momento de venderlos, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

El es un padre muy entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por el bienestar y progreso de ellos. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
José, 53, is married and lives with his family in the La Pilca sector, a rural area of Olmos district, Lambayeque province, which is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a cattle merchant for over 7 years. He raises cattle for subsequent sale to merchants that regularly come by his area to buy. This business provides the necessary income to support his family so he always gives all of himself to insure that it is successful José wants to improve the quality of his animals so that he can earn higher income when they are sold. He is, therefore, approaching Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to ask for a 1500 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed. He is a very dedicated father who always watches over his family’s wellbeing and progress. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman and to improve the quality of life of his loved ones. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced cattle feed.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 28 años, vive en su casa propia en  compañía de sus 2 hijas menores de edad, que aún dependen de ella. Desde muy joven, empezó a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y así aprendió todo lo necesario para cultivar la tierra y lograr que ésta brinde una buena producción. Cada día se despierta muy temprano para vigilar sus cultivos de papa y arveja, previamente sembrados con mucha paciencia. Luego de varios meses de esfuerzo trabajo, la espera brinda sus frutos y recoge toda la producción que luego lo transportaría al mercado, en donde son comercializados a buen precio. Es así que han transcurrido 12 años dedicándose por entero a esta actividad. Manifiesta además que le gusta su trabajo porque puede continuar con la herencia que le dejaron sus padres, siendo esta propiedad que le ayudará a salir adelante en bienestar de su familia. Para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y acumular ganancias que le ayuden a cubrir la educación de sus hijas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy segura que éste aporte le ayudará a mejorar su producción. Asimismo la labor que realiza su grupo comunal es buena, por ser todos muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Rosario tiene pensado invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de semillas de arveja y fertilizantes para asegurar una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Rosario is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her two young daughters. Since she was very young, she worked to help out her parents and thus learned everything she needed to cultivate the land and yield a good production. Every day she wakes up very early to tend to her potato and pea crops, which she previously planted with a lot of care and patience. Then, after numerous months of hard work, she hopes her efforts bear fruit and she can pick all her crops and transport them to the market, where she can sell them at a good price. This is what has transpired over the 12 years she has dedicated herself entirely to this activity. Furthermore, she says that she enjoys her work because she can continue the legacy passed down from her parents, as the land will help make headway for her family. In the future, she plans to plant larger quantities to increase her profits, which will help cover the costs of her children's education. This is her third loan cycle with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very certain this will help her increase her production. Her work with her community bank has been good, and all of the members are very responsible with their payments. Rosario is planning to invest the loan in the purchase of pea seeds and fertilizers to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria es casada, y tiene 5 hijos una de las cuales sufre el mal de Epilepsia. María comenzó su negocio vendiendo productos de belleza pero este tipo de ventas no le generan muchos ingresos así que opto por cambiar de negocio Un buen día una amiga le recomendó los productos naturales de la empresa Omnilife para su hija, ella probo y los resultados fueron favorables para su menor hija así que pensó en comercializar estos productos y poder ayudar a otras personas, esto le trajo beneficios y ganancias para su familia, ella se siente contenta y al igual que su hija ha mejorado su salud.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has five children, one of whom suffers from epilepsy. Maria started a business selling beauty products, but the kinds of sales she made didn't generate much of a profit, so she oped to change businesses. One day a friend recommended natural remedies from the company Omnilife for Maria to give to her sick daughter. She tried it with her daughter and the results were favorable, so Maria decided to start selling the products and help out other people. This has yielded benefits and profits for her family. Maria feels pleased, and her daughter's health has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase natural products

loans.name: Siempre Adelante Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "SIEMPRE ADELANTE"

Deyby pertenece a la alcancia comunal "SIEMPRE ADELANTE", que esta formada por personas positivas y alegres.
Una D. ellas es Deyby que esta casada y es madre D. 2 hijos, el menor aún está en el colegio y el mayor ya es un joven independiente.
Hace 2 años solicitó que le dieran un espacio para la venta D. comida, en el colegio donD. estudia el menor D. sus hijos; la directora accedió y apartir D. ese momento Deyby colocó un puesto donD. venD. golosinas, bebidas y comidas al lado del patio del colegio, sus clientes son los niños y jóvenes estudiantes, tambien los profesores y algún padre D. familia que vino a ver a su hijo o hija.
Deyby planea tener abrir una dulcería dentro del negogio D. cabina D. internet que tiene su padre, para asi tener un mayor ingreso.
Aunque su sueño más granD. es tener un gran restaurante cuyo nombre sea conocido en su zona y una casa propia.
texts.en:
Deyby belongs to the "Siempre Adelante" ("Always Moving Forward") Community Bank, which consists of positive and happy people. Deyby is married and has two children. The youngest one is still in school, and the eldest is an independent young man. Two years ago she requested a place to sell food at the her youngest son's school. The principal agreed, and from that moment Deyby has manned her food stand selling snacks, drinks and meals on the school's patio. Her customers are the students as well as the teachers and some parents who come by to see their son or daughter. Deyby plans to open a sweet shop insiD. the internet cafe her dad has so she can increase her income. Her biggest dream is to have her own home and a big restaurant whose name is known throughout the area.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital, purchase ingredients to prepare meals for food stand

loans.name: Paz Y Progreso Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe venD. comida hace 5 años en la puerta D. su casa con mucho esfuerzo pudo conseguir una carreta la cual es D. mucha ayuda para ella, porque pueD. exhibir los diferentes comidas que hace. Además los fines D. semana venD. golosinas, todo esto lo hace por amor a su familia. Con el préstamo recibido y algunos ahorros que tiene desea comprar un trimovil para aumentar sus ingresos.
Ines se dedica a la venta y renovación D. calzados juntamente con su esposo con los pocos ingresos que tiene pueD. educar y mantener a sus tres hijos, el préstamo obtenido lo invertirá en la compra D. materiales para mejorar los acabados del calzado que ofrece.
Con mucho esfuerzo Fausta pudo aperturar un restaurant hace muchos años este negocio la ayuda a pagar  a la manutención y  educación D. sus hijos. Además ella pudo construir su vivienda y dentro D. ella un local para eventos sociales: como fiestas D. cumpleaños, bautizos etc D. lo cual percibe ingresos por el alquiler del local y así pueD. tener mayores ingresos.
El grupo esta muy comprometido con los créditos y se comprometen a realizar sus pagos en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe has been selling food for five years from the doorstep of her house. With much effort, she was able to obtain a cart that proved to be of great help to her because she is now able to display the different foods that she prepares. On the weekends she sells candy. All of this is done out of love for her family. With the loan she will receive and some of her savings, Guadalupe wants to buy a “trimovil” (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi) so that she can increase her earnings.

Ines sells and repairs shoes with her husband. With the little income that they make, they are able to support their three children and send them to school. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of materials to improve the finished shoes that she offers.

With great effort, Fausta was able to open a restaurant many years ago. This business has helped to support and educate her children. In addition, she wants to build a home and next to it an events hall for hosting social gatherings such as birthday parties and christenings. She hopes to generate rental income that would increase her earnings.

The group is very committed to their loans and promises to make their payments on the specified due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products & supplies

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es: Violeta tiene 27 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 3 hijas que aún son menores de edad. Cuando era muy pequeña observaba como sus padres trabajaban la tierra, y como jugando aprendió todo lo necesario para obtener una cosecha productiva;  es así que tiene 8 años sembrando arveja. Manifiesta que le gusta mucho trabajar las labores agrícolas, por las ganancias que obtiene luego de vender la producción de arveja a los mayoristas de la ciudad, siendo estas rentas que le permiten vivir cómodamente. Aunque la agricultura es una actividad muy variable debido a las constantes amenazas que se presentan, como la plaga de insectos y los cambios climáticos que afectan las plantaciones, confía en que mientras sea mejor la tierra que prepara con fertilizantes, mayor será la producción. Para el futuro tiene planeado empezar a sembrar otro tipo de vegetales para variar un poco y obtener mejores ganancias. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y espera que éste crédito le será muy útil para mejorar su trabajo en búsqueda de progreso. Violeta tiene pensado invertir el crédito que solicita, en la compra de fertilizantes para asegurar sus próximas cosechas, por lo que espera aumentar ésta última producción.
texts.en:
Violeta is 27 years old and lives in her own home with her three young daughters. As a girl she watched her parents work the land and learned everything that needed to be done to achieve a good harvest. She has been growing peas for eight years. Violeta says she enjoys farming because of the income she is able to generate selling peas to the wholesalers in the city. These profits allow her to live comfortably. Agriculture is an activity that can have variable results as a result of constant threats, such as swarms of insects and changes in weather that can affect planting. However, Violeta is confident that she can improve her land by preparing it with fertilizers to increase production. In the future, she hopes to begin planting other types of vegetables to add some variety and to earn generate more revenue.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Violeta expects that this will loan will be useful in improving her work and making progress. She will invest the loan she requested in the purchase of fertilizers to ensure her next harvest in hopes of increasing production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, un distrito de territorio bastante accidentado y cuya población se sitúa principalmente en zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y queda ubicado a una hora y media de a ciudad de Chiclayo.

Trabaja desde hace mas de tres años como carpintero metálico, actualmente posee un taller ubicado en una zona céntrica de Olmos, allí el confecciona todo tipo de estructuras metálicas como puertas, ventanas, mesas, entre otros. La calidad con la que realiza su trabajo ha hecho que su negocio se haga conocido y que tenga una cartera fija de clientes que siempre acuden a solicitarle sus servicios. Esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingreso y se vale de ella para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a la economía de su familia.

Pablo desea implementar su negocio con la compra de una compresora que le permita pintar los muebles que confecciona, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Pablo es un joven voluntarioso y emprendedor, su mayor anhelo es seguir ampliando y equipando su taller para trabajar y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, el es un joven bastante conocido y estimado en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Pablo is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the district of Olmos, which is located in rugged territory where the population lives mainly in rural areas. This community is part of Lambayeque Province and is located 1½ hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Pablo has been in business for more than three years as a metalworker. He currently has his own workshop located in central Olmos. There he makes all types of metal structures such as doors, window frames, tables, and other items. The quality of his work has brought recognition to his business and he has several established customers who always request for his services. This activity is his only source of income, which he uses to pay his personal expenses and support his family financially.

Pablo wants to continue his business by purchasing a compressor that will allow him to paint the furniture he makes. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN to help meet this goal.

Pablo is an enterprising young man who also volunteers. His greatest desire is to continue expanding and equipping his workshop so that he can work to provide his family a better quality of life. He is well-known and respected in the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a compressor

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo barrio Augusto cesar Sandino, el señor Leonardo P. Pineda, ha dedicado parte de su tiempo a realizar y desarrollar actividades agropecuarias dentro de las cuales se destacan la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar así como el establecimiento de algunos cultivos como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo entre otros los que están destinados al comercio, de los cuales obtiene su ingreso. También este señor Leonardo P. P.es empleado de la distribuidora de energía  Unión Fenosa en la cual tiene mas de 8 años de laborar, realizando jornadas de trabajo de 6 a 8 de la noche los seis días de la semana, dicho empleo le ha permitido realizar la compra de su finca en donde desarrolla sus actividades agropecuarias las que son dirigidas en su mayoría por su esposa he hijos, dichas actividades en conjunto ha permitido la mejora de sus condiciones de vida, con el crédito solicitado espera aumentar su hato ganadero y a su vez sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In the Augusto Cesar Sandino neighborhood of the city of Somotillo, Leonardo has dedicated part of his time to his farming activities. He raises cattle, hogs, and poultry. He also raises crops, including corn, sesame seed, and sorghum, among other things. He earns income from the sale of these items. Leonardo is also employed with an energy company, Unión Fenosa, where he has worked for more than eight years, making work related trips from 6:00 pm to 8:00 pm, six days a week. His job has made it possible for him to buy the land on which he conducts his farming. His wife and kids run the farm. These activities together have allowed them to improve their quality of life. They will use the money from this loan to increase their herd and income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Damas Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 37 años es soltera y es consultora D. belleza venD.  la mayoría D. marcas y tiene mucha clientela, también venD. ropa por  pedido todo esto la ayuda a solventar los gastos que le genera la educación D. su hija quien cursa estudios en una universidad.
La Sra. Patricia toda la vida ha trabajado en lo que se refiere a  ventas, sabe el movimiento D. ese negocio, en el futuro quiere tener  un  bazar  o una jugeria para eso esta pensando en alquilar un local adecuado ya sea en un mercado o un lugar céntrico.  Para este fin ella trabaja mucho por que quiere lograrlo muy pronto. Su présT. actual lo usara en la compra D. productos D. belleza y ropa para vender, ella es la presidenta D. el grupo “DAMAS TRIUNFADORAS”  ya tiene en ese cargo 1 año y lo desempeña D. la mejor manera apoyando a su grupo.
*lA Sra. Patricia esta sentada,es la quinta D. la parte D. atras con blusa blanca.
texts.en:
Patricia is 37 years old, single, and works as a beauty consultant. She sells most brands and has plenty of customers. Patricia also sells clothing upon requests. All of this helps to pay for the educational expenses of her daughter who is studying at a university.

Sra. Patricia has worked in sales her entire life and knows how this type of business operates. In the future, she wants to open either a bazaar or a juice bar. She needs a suitable location that she can rent in the market or in a central area. In order to achieve this, she works hard because she wants to accomplish this very soon. Her current loan will be used to purchase beauty products and clothing to sell. Patricia is the president of the group “Damas Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women). She has already held this position for one year and has demonstrated that she is the best at supporting her group.

*Sra. Patricia is the fifth person seated in the back, wearing a white blouse.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & clothing

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es: Zulema tiene 20 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos y de sus 2 hermanos. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa (tubérculo peruano) y arveja, en donde cada día se despierta por la madrugada, y con ayuda de sus hermanos, vigilan los cultivos que tienen de las constantes amenazas como los cambios climáticos y plagas de insectos que afectan su producción. Afirma que le gusta mucho esta labor porque puede desarrollarla con mucha tranquilidad, aunque es algo sacrificada, sin embargo la recompensa llega cuando recoge toda la producción y logra venderlo a los mayoristas de su ciudad, pagándole regulares precios por todo lo cosechado. En el futuro desea sembrar nueva variedad de papa, de esa manera aumentaría sus rentas. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y espera alcanzar con lo que se ha propuesto. Además está contenta de saber que continuará trabajando en su agricultura. Además le agrada estar con su grupo comunal por ser todos muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Zulema tiene pensado invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de fertilizantes y abono para asegurar una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Zulema is 20 years old and lives at home with her parents and two siblings. She has been farming for three years, growing potatoes (Peruvian tubers) and peas.

Zulema wakes up every day at dawn. With the help of her siblings, she monitors the crops for constant threats such as weather changes or infestation of pests that can affect her production. She says she enjoys this work very much because it allows her to grow in a peaceful environment. Even though the work requires sacrifice, there is great reward when it is time to harvest her entire crop and sell it to wholesalers in the city who pay regular prices for everything she produces. In the future, she wants to plant a new variety of potato so that she can increase her income.

This is her second loan with MFP. Zulema hopes to proceed with her plans. She is happy that to know that she will be able to continue working in agriculture. Zulema also enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because all the members are very responsible with their payments. She will invest the loan she requested in the purchase of fertilizers and compost to ensure a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & compost

loans.name: Mujeres Del Sol Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal Mujeres del Sol está conformado por 9 socias con deseos D. superación personal así como también para su familia.
Como es el caso D. Esthercita, ella se dedica a la venta D. granos en el M. central D. Lima lo hace para solventar sus gastos y deudas que tiene, ella vive con su esposo que también  aporta en el hogar.
La venta D. ropa como ambulante trae muchos beneficios a Nelly ella reparte la mercadería y cobra diariamente, la ganancia que obtiene pueD. invertir en mas mercadería, como es la compra D. diferentes modelos D. prendas para sus exigentes clientes. Todo este esfuerzo no es en vano ya que desea mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
Mercedes es la secretaria del grupo ella se dedica a la confección y venta D. bolsas D. repuesto para maquinas aspiradoras, al principio ayudo a su familia en este negocio pero después D. un tiempo comenzó a trabajar sola ahora tiene clientes que le solicitan sus productos y así pueD. obtener mayores ganancias
texts.en:
The “Mujeres del Sol” (Women of the Sun) communal bank has 9 members who seek personal and family growth. An example is Esthercita who sells grains in Lima’s central market; she does this to cover expenses and debts she has. She lives with her husband who also contributes to household expenses. Nelly is a clothing peddler; she sells and collects payments daily. She invests her profits in more merchandise, like different styles of clothing for her demanding customers. All this effort is not in vain because she wants to improve her family’s quality of life. Mercedes is group secretary; she makes and sells vacuum cleaner replacement bags. At first, she helped her family in their business but eventually became independent and worked for herself; she has regular customers now that ask for her products and thus she can earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sabina Gladys

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 41 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, un distrito de la zona norte de la provincia de Lambayeque caracterizado por su accidentada geografía y porque tiene a la mayoría de su población dispersa en zonas rurales, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de agenciarse de ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos la llevó a instalar en su vivienda una bodega hace ocho años, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de consumo diario y abarrotes. La calidad de productos que ofrece y el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes han hecho que se gane la preferencia de sus clientes y su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco, esta es su unica fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para sacar su bodega adelante.

Sabina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de abarrotes y golosinas de modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Sabina es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que ha sabido ganarse el sustento y progresar mediante un continuo esfuerzo diario. Su mas grande anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar una carrera superior y brindarles un mejor futuro. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriomente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sabina, 41, is separated and lives with her children in Olmos, a district in the north of Lambayeque province famous for its rugged landscape and because most of its population lives in rural settings; it is located an hour and half from the city of Chiclayo. Eight years ago she set up a grocery store in her home because she needed to earn income to support her children; she stocks all kinds of daily use articles and groceries. The quality of her inventory and the good customer service she offers customers makes them prefer her over the competition and her business has gradually grown. This is her only source of income so she always makes the best effort to help it succeed. Sabina hopes to expand her stock of groceries and snacks so that she can continue to satisfy customer demand. This has motivated her to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to help her reach this goal. Sabina is quite dedicated to her family and has learned to earn her daily support and to make progress through sustained daily effort. Her greatest wish is to offer her children the possibility to study higher education to have a career that will provide them with a better future. She has collaborated with our institution previously and has shown punctuality and responsibility with respect to her loan installment repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks.

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sisley es Profesora enseña en un colegio tiene 02 hijos, ella  es soltera por lo mismo tiene muchas necesidades que cubrir, es por eso que adicional a su trabajo ella ha  buscado la forma D. tener otro ingreso adicional hace un año se dedica a vender productos por campañas, son sus compañeros D. trabajo sus mejores clientes, actualmente esta en plena campaña escolar. le va muy bien pues ha vendido muchos paquetes escolares proximamente se prepara para la campaña del día D. la madre y así sucesivamente, sus ganancias son buenas por que ella compra directo D. fabrica a menor precio. Con sus ingresos  ella ha podido mejorar su casa y darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
Para mas adelante ella tiene planeado poner un bazar librería en su propia casa, ella  es tesorera del grupo “AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE” un grupo nuevo pero con mucho animo D. trabajar con su préstamo desembolsado comprara mas útiles D. librería para entregar pedidos que aun tiene pendiente.

*la Sra. Sisley es la tercera D. la derecha esta sentada.
texts.en:
Ms. Sisley is a high school teacher. She is a single mother of two children, so she has many expenses to cover. Because of this, she went looking for a way to make additional income. So, for the last year she has sold seasonal merchandise. Her best customers are her colleagues at work and she is currently selling back-to-school products. It is going very well and she has sold a lot of school supplies. She is preparing to sell Mother's Day items next. She is able to earn a good profit because she buys directly from the factory at low prices. With her earnings, she has been able to make improvements to her home and to proviD. for her children's education. In the future, Ms. Sisley plans to open a bookstore in her own home. She is the treasurer of the “AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE” (“Friends Forever”) group. They are newly-formed, but have a lot of spirit. With her share of the loan payout she will purchase more school supplies to fill orders that are still pending. *Ms. Sisley is seated, the third from the right

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for resale

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is 46 years old and married with three children.  The children range in age from 2 to 16 and two of them currently attend school. He runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where he has been farming for over ten years. He sells milk to the Kenyan Cooperative of Cremeries and maize at the local market.  He says that the main challenge is finding a suitable market for his produce and consistent wages.

Johnson requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help his family's health and provide for his children's education. In the future, he would like to improve his farm's milk and poultry production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 70 years old and married with 18 children, ranging in age from 18 to 45. He is currently supporting the schooling of 4 students, including 3 of his grandchildren. He runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where he has been farming for over fifty years.  His main source of income is selling maize, bananas, potatoes, milk and poultry products at the local market. He says that the main challenges to his business are poor prices for his produce and difficulty in accessing quality dairy animals.

Francis requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will enable his grandchildren to have a better life and education. In the future, Francis would like to concentrate on his dairy farming and be a major supplier in his area.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Villa Del Sol Group

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Esther pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal Villa de Sol ella se dedica a las confecciones de artículos para el hogar hace 4 años es casada y juntamente con su esposo desean seguir progresando con sus ventas, ya que su objetivo es alquilar un local para hacerlo un taller y dar trabajo a otras personas.
Otilda alquila y vende trajes de vestir y vestidos de fiesta, con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar su stand hace mucho tiempo, con este negocio apoya con los gastos en casa además contribuye con los gastos de sus 5 hijos  
Juan es uno de los socios optimistas y responsable del grupo el hace jaulas para mascotas, de diferentes materiales, asi el crédito recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos para mejorar la calidad de los acabados ya que hay mucha competencia, y sabe que tiene que innovar sus trabajos.
Nuestros socios destinaran el reciente préstamo para la compra de mercadería y otros artículos que le ayudaran a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Communal Bank “Villa del Sol” (Village of the Sun) and has been selling everything from clothing to household products for four years. She and her husband want to continue progressing with their sales. Her goal is to rent a location for establishing a workshop where she can provide employment to other people.

Otilda rents and sells formalwear and party dresses. After much effort, she was able to buy a vending post where she spends most of her time. This business helps her with the household expenses and supporting her five children.

Juan is one of the optimistic and responsible members of the group. He builds animal cages out of different materials. His loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies that will improve the quality of his finished goods. He experiences much competition, so he knows he has to be innovative in his work.

The members have designated this loan toward the purchase merchandise and other items that they need to improve their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Lusvi Francisca

texts.es:
Lusvi tiene 41 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, caracterizado por su geografía accidentada y por que la mayoría de sus habitantes se encuentran dispersos en zonas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y queda ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace tres años decidió crear un negocio que le permitiera obtener ingresos permanentes para apoyar a sus padres y salir adelante. Fue asi que empezó a vender golosinas de manera ambulante. El negocio tiene muy buena acogida debido al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes, durante el tiempo que viene trabajando en esta actividad, su negocio ha ido creciendo y consolidándose.

Lusvi desea mejorar la calidad de vida de sus padres, haciendo algunas refacciones y terminando de construir la casa en donde viven, ella ha creído conveniente poner piso a su vivienda ya que actualmente su piso es de tierra, siguiendo este objetivo ella se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Lusvi es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre vela por el bienestar se su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria e inatalar un negocio en su propia vivienda. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lusvi is 41 years old, is single, and lives with her family in the Olmos district. It is an area of rugged geography where most people live in dispersed rural areas. It is part of the Lambayeque province and is an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Three years ago, Lusvi decided to start a business that would allow her to have a permanent income and help support her parents. She began by selling sweets as a roving vendor. The business was well received due to the good way she relates to her customers. Since that time, the business has grown and consolidated. Lusvi wants to improve the quality of life for her parents by making some repairs and finishing construction on their house. She would like to install a floor, as the current floor is make of dirt. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme for a loan of 1500 soles. Lusvi is a hardworking woman and she always looks out for the well being of her family. Her greatest desire is to continue growing her business and install a store in her own house. She has worked with Edpyme before and has always been punctual and responsible in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a floor in her house

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal Paz y Bien cursa su tercer préstamo y desean continuar trabajando con EDAPROSPO todas demuestran responsabilidad en sus pagos 
Hace tiempo con la ayuda D. los créditos otorgados por EDAPROSPO, Guadalupe pudo aperturar una bodega con la cual subsiste hasta ahora, con su negocio pueD. mantener a sus 4 hijos, aunque ella nos comenta que eso no es suficiente.
Natali se dedica a la venta a crédito D. ropa con las ganancias pueD. aportar con los gastos en casa. Su mayor sueño es adquirir un puesto en un centro comercial donD. puedan vender mas productos y   con mas comodidad.
Elizabeth tiene diferente negocios venD. ropa a pedido por las tardes, y por las mañanas ayuda a su suegra con la venta D. pescado, con eso pueD. aportar con los gastos en casa.
Los socios están agradecidos con los créditos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Paz y Bien” (Peace and Good) is in its third loan cycle and continues to work with EDAPROSPO. Everyone in the group has demonstrated responsibility with their payments.

Some time ago with the help of the loans from EDAPROSPO, Guadalupe was able to open a grocery store that is still in operation today. This business enables her to support her four children. However, she says this is still not enough.

Natali sells clothing on credit. Her earnings are used to pay for her household expenses. Her greatest wish is to acquire a vending post at a shopping center where she can easily sell more products.

Elizabeth has different businesses. She sells clothing by order in the afternoons and helps her mother-in-law in the mornings sell fish. These activities allow her to cover her household expenses.

The members are grateful for their loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Madres Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal Madres Laboriosas cursa el sexto ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. 
La mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo como es el caso D. Celia, ella para ayudar la economía familiar venD. productos Natura hace 1 año, tiene 3 hijos por los cuales seguir trabajando, así que inicio una empresa D. seguridad juntamente con su esposo, Espera tener mayores ingresos con este nuevo servicio.
La marca D. productos D. belleza Oriflame es la que Mirtha representa, en este negocio tiene algunos beneficios ya que por la cantidad D. ventas pueD. obtener regalos que ella a su vez los venD., Ella es madre soltera y tiene que educar y mantener a sus 3 hijos. 
Nuestra socia Blanca tiene un negocio D. alquiler D. cabinas para acceso al internet hace varios años, ellas nos comenta que al principio tenia mayores ganancias pero ahora hay mucha competencia y no obtiene lo que necesita para mantener a sus 2 hijos pero ella es optimista y desea colocar una exhibidora para vender otros productos complementarios en su local comercial y asi tener otros ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Madres Laboriosas” (Working Mothers) communal bank has crossed its sixth cycle of being responsible and punctual with its payments. Most of its members sell cosmetics via catalogs. This is the case with Celia, who does it to help bring income to her family and has been selling “Natura” brand products for a year. She has three children for whom she continues to work. She and her husband have also started a security company and she expects to bring in a good income from this service. Mirtha sells the “Oriflame” brand of cosmetics. This business has other benefits because she receives gifts (which she resells) because of the amount of products she sells. She is a single mother and must support and educate her three children. Blanca has had an Internet café for several years. She tells us that she used to bring in a large income, but now there is much more competition and she no longer makes enough to support her two children. However, she is an optimist and wants to set up a display case in order to be able to sell other items and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory and supplies

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Both the children, ages 13 and 7, attend local schools. Gantumur lives with his family in a house which they own and he operates a carpentry business in his town.

He usually manufactures wooden furniture including wardrobes, tables and beds. His wife, Davaajargal, helps him with his business and polishes furniture. Gantumur has been operating his business since 2004, and has gained much experience in these years. Customers like to buy his high quality and well designed products. In addition, he uses a coating technology which his competitors do not use. His monthly profit is between 150,000 – 250,000 tugrugs (~ 110 – 185 USD). He has been planning to grow his business and improve his product design in the future. Gantumur is a very hardworking person and says, 'I would like to repair and enlarge my house for my family this year with my business profit.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ 732 USD) loan to purchase raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ahtai

texts.en:
Ahtai, 36 years old, lives with his wife and four children in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. All four of his children are between the ages of 15 and 10 years old and attend a local secondary school. Ahtai is an experienced driver who, since 1997, has operated a truck transportation business carrying packages twice a month to Taikeshken, a Chinese border town, earning 1,200,000 tugrugs ( ~ 880 USD) for transporting five tons of packages there. On his way to Taikeshken he also carries flour to his other provincial customers and on his return trip transports other packages from Taikeshken.

Having developed a stable business, Ahtain is requesting a 2,400,000 tugrug (~ 1755 USD) loan to purchase a trailer with an eight-ton capacity which, according to his calculations, will help to increase his profit by 50%. An energetic person who has a great business mind, he says, “I would like to save my business profit to purchase a car which will be comfortable to use in the city.”

loans.use: To purchase a trailer

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya, 36 years old and divorced, lives with her two children and her father in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her father, who is retired, is very supportive and looks after her two-year-old son in their home. Her oldest son, Altangerel, is 15 years old and attends a local secondary school.

Altantuya has been working hard to provide a better life for her family. She operates a beauty products business at a local trading center called Mandal. She started her business in 2008 with working capital of 500,000 tugrug (~ 365 USD), and over the years has used her earnings to expand her business to include selling clothes in addition to beauty products at her counter. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,450,000 tugrugs (~ 1060 USD).

She is a very hardworking person, and her business and family are so important to her. Altantuya says, “I started saving money to pay university tuition fees for my oldest son. I am also working hard to create my own clothing trading shop in the future.” She is now requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~ 732 USD) loan to purchase beauty products and a large amount of clothing for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Analyn Alvarado's Group

texts.en:
Analyn A. is from the village of Centro Norte Camalaniugan, Cagayan. She is 36 years old. Analyn is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Analyn A.'s Group.

Analyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Analyn is just starting this business.

In 2010, Analyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. She also believes in the quotation that says: "If there's a will, there's a way."

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Leilanie's Group

texts.en:
Leilanie G. is 40 years old and is from the town of Quimalabasa Norte, San Agustin. She is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is the Leilanie G. Group.

Leilanie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leilanie is just starting this business.

In 2010, Leilanie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en:
Battogtoh, 48 years old, lives with his wife and five children in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, in Uvs Province, Mongolia. His oldest daughter, Tsetseggerel, is 20 years old and a university student, while his oldest son, Altangerel, is 22 and helps in his parents' business.

Battogtoh and his wife operate two businesses in their town. In 2001 they started a raw material trading business that sells a variety of materials including sheepskin, wool, and cashmere. In 2005 they purchased 20 hectares of land to plant wheat, a seasonal business not operating in the winter.

Battogtoh is a great businessman and father. He says, “Me and my wife are working hard to purchase a house for my oldest son and to create a bright future for all of my children.” He is now requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~ 1830 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of wheat seed for his agriculture business and more wool and cashmere for his raw material trading business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Simplicia's Group

texts.en:
Simplicia M. is 48 years old and is from the village of San Isidro. She is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is the Simplicia M. Group.

Simplicia is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Simplicia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Simplicia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 12,000 PHP will also be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This will be the fifth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make furniture

loans.name: Simiona Martha

texts.en:
Simiona Martha is a member of the “Unidos para el Triunfo” (United for Triumph) community bank. She is a 39-year-old mother of two and lives in the Santiago district of Cuzco with her spouse and their children, ages 14 and one year. Simiona Martha owns a small grocery that she runs out of her mother’s house. Here she sells foodstuffs such as cookies, drinks, rice, and pasta. She also sells fireworks. She has been operating this business for over 13 years. 

Simiona Martha is asking for a Kiva loan for business capital so that she can maintain and increase the revenue from her store. Simiona Martha is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Business capital for store

loans.name: Nenita's Group

texts.en:
Nenita B. is 52 years old and from the town of Malitao Echague. She is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nenita B.'s group.

Nenita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 20,000 PHP will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife, Ononnemeh, is an attendant in the local gold mining company. 

During the day, Baynjargal operates a blacksmith business in his town. He has been operating his business since 2000, and has gained much experience in the previous years. Bayanjargal was a herder with few head of livestock between 1997 and 2000. Bayanjargal is an experienced blacksmith and has a loyal customer base. He has been planning to expand his business and create his own workplace in the future. 

In addition to his blacksmith business, he purchased equipment for beverage manufacturing with his siblings, and is planning to operate a beverage workshop this June to earn extra income. Bayanjargal is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase more iron for his blacksmith business.

loans.use: To purchase iron

loans.name: America

texts.en:
America is 35 years old, married, and has two children ages eight and nine months. She is a member of the “Unidos para el Truinfo” (United for Triumph) community bank. America makes a living selling candles. These include “cirios”, which are large candles normally used in street processions for local saints in the Catholic religion here in Cuzco. She has owned this business for seven years, but says that business is somewhat slow right now. 

America is hoping that business will pick up with the help of a loan in the coming months, and says she will use the Kiva loan to sustain and improve her candle business. Specifically, she will buy wax to make the candles with the Kiva loan money. America is appreciative of and grateful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Wax to make candles

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan is 49 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Currently, Bayarsaihan operates a carpentry business in his town. He manufactures a variety of wooden products, but specializes in the wooden furniture and parts for gers. He has been operating his business since 2005, and the business is supported by the entire family and they have built a stable operation.  In his business, he makes wooden products with his oldest son and his wife does small jobs such as polishing the furniture. 

Originally, he worked as a carpenter in a wooden furniture workshop which belonged to another person between 1990 and 2005 where he gained valuable experience. Bayarsaihan has many customers because of his good service and high quality products. He has been planning to expand and stabilize his business. 

Bayarsaihan is a very hardworking person and his family is very important to him. He says, “I would like to build a winter house for my family after I finish paying the university tuition fees for my daughter until her graduation.” He is requesting a 900,000 tugrug loan to purchase timber to build a workplace for his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber

loans.name: Bayarlhagva

texts.en:
Bayarlhagva is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His two children, ages 12 and 10, attend a local secondary school. His wife, Otgontsetseg, is a salesperson and her monthly salary is 150,000 tugrugs (~ 110 USD). 

During the day, Bayarlhagva earns his living by operating a meat and raw material trading business in his town. He has been operating his businesses since 2000, and has steadily expanded both businesses. His meat trading business is seasonal and his profit is high during the summer. Bayarlhagva's monthly profit is between 80,000 – 150,000 tugrugs (~  60 – 110 USD).  He sells his products at his rental counter and has a loyal customer base. 

Originally he was a herder  between 1990 and 2000 before he has started the meat and raw material trading business. Bayarlhagva is a very hardworking person and is focused on the future. He says, “I started saving money for my children's tuition fees to provide a good education for them.” He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a plot of land with a house and yard for his family.

loans.use: Tp purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn O. is from the village of Brgy. Quezon, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing catering services in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.
